Reviews.Title: “Modern and cool”
Reviews.Author: LondonMW
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely - so peaceful and although it feels very modern and trendy, the service was great and we felt welcomed. Free wifi in the rooms is great and it is a short skip to the beach (although the 'downtown' attractions are quite a walk away). The room is well kitted out and looks great, but there isn't a bath which lets it down a little. The food and drink in the hotel is also expensive. That being said it is peaceful and bright and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: phil1007
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife made this our first stop on our Honeymoon, everything was perfect from the first few minutes - we arrived after a long flight from the UK, were greeted with two glasses of champagne and a handwritten note from the general manager. The room was extremely comfortable, bed and bathroom were fantastic, just what we needed after the long day of travelling!! The restaurant is expensive, the food is good but not as good as the food suggests. The pool area is great - saltwater pool, plenty of seating and shade, daybeds, everything you could possibly want! We had one issue during our stay - the concierge neglected to provide the correct information regarding buses on a Tuesday - the one day they do not travel to our intended destination, this was i'm sure an oversight on his part - however it did leave my wife upset. Elisa from guest services was great - she provided a daybed and complimentary cocktails for the inconvenience and also offered to arrange any other tours personally that we may have wanted - the prompt manner with which the sitaution was resolved was appreciated, the manager also emailed me with an apology- couldn't ask for more. I also like Wednesday nights, the hotel provide free appetizers and drinks to guests for an hour, where they gauge the experiences of their guests and endeavour to rectify any problems, it also helps to ensure the problems do not arise again. This I felt offered a personal touch that is lacking in many other hotels! When I return to Honolulu in the future, I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: EGBear
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Modern for three nights in August. They originally put us in a king room but when we asked for a room with two double beds, the friendly woman on the front desk was happy to switch us. She warned us the double room had no balcony, but when we reached it, it had a lovely view of the beach and the hotel pool. The room was clean and spacious. The beds and pillows were comfortable and the water pressure and temperature in the shower were both perfect, with plenty of towels. The pool is amazing and breakfast by the pool a gorgeous way to start the day. The staff were really nice - Ryan the concierge was very helpful and all of the poolside staff lovely. One even recognised us in another restaurant and went out of her way to say hi! The hotel is a 20-minute gentle walk out of the main street of Waikiki, which makes it quiet and peaceful but might be a drawback if you're keen on the Waikiki nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be a place to be seen, but not a good place to be treated”
Reviews.Author: wyoung0825
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review with two days of my stay remaining. My newly married husband and I stayed her for second destination for our honeymoon. We flew from uk arrived in florida first to experience and stayed there for four nights. staying in the modern honolulu was purely my husband 's choice but after four days i have to say this hotel is the worst hotel i ever stayed in my life.the best things this hotel can be proud of is: excellent cleaners. The room is very clean and tidy. the hotel has some edgy design but that's not to everyone taste. 1)- as a honeymoon couple we are not expecting fireworks. But when we arrived in, there is no flowers, card, champagne or chocolate. We made our points across to the manager laurelle and later also we spoke to resort manager nick bargel about more issues about our stay, he explained to us as he is still trying to develop a system for honeymoon couples.that,s the lamest excuse i ever heard. I do not know how many honeymoon couples already stay in this hotel but from my personal expeience had we stayed in other hotels we would have been treated more special. 2)- health & safety. the shower which is in a bath tub can easily lead to a fall. There is no anti- slip mat in bath tub and nowhere to hold on to. i hit on the shelf few times where the toiletries placed while i was having my shower. The shelf is placed on the wall more towards the shower head. So its hard to have shower in a narrow bath tub and avoiding hitting on the shelf. The pressure of the shower head is quite weak. It takes me at least twice as long to wash my hair. the wooden slat panel covering the balcony area is very pretty but the glass door is very thin. Any noises from outside can be heard inside very easily. there is a night club within the building, and you can hear the loud music clearly from inside of the room. 3)- slow service. For example: Room service breakfast : 45 mins. ordering a glass of water by the poolside : 12- 15 mins. So i took back the gratuity from the food order i placed earlier and told the waitress "it's too late. We are leaving now ". how long does it take for staff to pour a glass of water? 4).......5)...... To me, life is always about details. Hawaii is a beautiful island but the hotel i m staying in has put too much mud on my honeymoon memory .This hotel experience has made me feel very small and i am counting down every hour to set off to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel! Book now you won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: gina g
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel strictly by the reviews and pictures from the Modern's website and from Tripadvisor's site and I can say the Modern's rooms are EXACTLY as pictured from the Modern's website and Trip advisor's was too! The main reason I picked this hotel is because it was more for adults - we were on our honeymoon and even though the hotel has ammenities for children (and there were a lot of children there) I thought it had more of an adult vibe to it. Also it is a smaller hotel 300-400 rooms where it is more intimate and you don't feel like another number to them which was very important to us. The hotel has a really posh vibe to it. The ENTIRE hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating, they go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. I really loved the fresh smell of pulmeria as you walked into the hotel lobby and the fresh lemonade and cold towel when you check in. They have free newspapers in the morning and they also have a free coffee service in the lobby - we requested ahead of time (at no extra cost) to have a mini fridge, microwave and a coffee maker in our room so they supplied us with a Keurig which was a cool touch. The pools are salt water which are beautiful. The adult pool was nice but I wish it was a deeper pool - it only goes up to your ankles but when it got hot we went downstairs to the other pool to swim - both pools play jazz type music and it is pretty quiet atmosphere. Food service at the pool and the pool manager were awesome. We went to the spa and got a couple's massage - it was amazing - definately go for it! You are right next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village - so you can walk two minutes and go to their man made beach, and go to the wonderful shopping centers on the strip. And it is 8 miles from the airport which helps when leaving. The biggest complaint I saw on every site was the noise level due to construction next door. We were on the 15th floor right near the construction site and didn't hear anything. If we had our windows open we heard the live musicans playing music by the pool which was lovely! The rooms were so cool - very clean and I loved the look to the rooms, very comfortable beds and you felt like you were in someone's bedroom - very cozy atmosphere to it! I loved how the bookcase in the lobby moved to show the hidden bar in the evening. They housekeeping was great by dropping off bottles of water in the evening. The hotel was a little bit more than I would normally spend but it was our honeymoon and every hotel on that strip that I priced out is that much, if not more. So it was money well spent in my opinion! Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but Morimoto's is worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Darkly_dreaming1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok... Although its clean modern interior and rooms are fabulous, a closer look reveals a little lacking. The toiletries were bare basic, rooms on the smaller side (and we had a "bigger" room) and the pool is a bit of a letdown - i mean, the adult only pool is ankle deep? Why? did they not notice the Sheraton's infinity pool a few doors down?!? Room service screwed up our order once, so instead of a 30 min wait it was an hour before the whole meal was served. I found the lounge unnecessarily loud- its impossible to have a conversation there, so we left for another venue. It's at the end of the strip, so when we went out at night (read: HEELS) we took a $10 cab to get into the midst of the excitement. The concierge was excellent however, and even went out of his way to print off yoga schedules nearby for me to review. And MORIMOTOS was AMAZING. Even if you don't do Japanese its a MUST! Breakfast was a perfect fusion, and even picky people in my party sampled my Japanese Traditional Breakfast. All in all, I'm sure there are better options than the Modern in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Erin S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was thoroughly modern and upscale, with attention to detail throughout. We enjoyed the location, as well, since it's walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and the beach. Breakfast at Morimoto was outstanding - try the oatmeal for a surprising and delicious combination of flavors. The room was comfortable and stylish, although room service was a little lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Does it get much better--fantastic pool, restaurant and sleek rooms”
Reviews.Author: goldilachs
Reviews.Content: The Modern Honolulu hits the sweet spot with its zen pool and party scene, Michelin-starred restaurant and minimalist rooms. I recommend this hotel for young professionals and couples who want to enjoy a design hotel and great facilities but at a lower price point than true 5-star hotels. My husband and I travel for pleasure on a monthly basis and have become picky with our hotels. We loved the clean and sleek details of the white-furnishings in the room. The bathroom also had great water pressure and ample towels. The amenities are of average quality but not bad. The restaurant, Morimoto's, was amazing for the great service and thoughtful dishes. I had never seen a plate of sushi in front of me that I didn't think I could finish. Until I came here. The $40 chef's choice sashimi is more than enough for one person. Overall, the menu has a good mixture of authentic Japanese and fusion dishes. Unlike many other trendy restaurants, the portions are a decent size. We recommend sitting outside so you can watch the sunset over the yacht club. The calamari salad is also divine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of modern luxury indulgence and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: ESK11
Reviews.Content: TMH has become one of our favorite hotels! From the subtle scent of plumeria to handing out samples of sorbet at the Sunrise pool, this hotel excels in small details. Being a fan of modern luxury, TMH did not disappoint in its decor and appointments both in the common areas and individual room. There were several things I wanted for my own place, and the staff helped me get them. Morimoto is the perfect restaurant to partner with this hotel. The fusion of Asian, Hawaiian, and American elements was artful and delicious. Notwithstanding, the food at the Sunrise pool wasn't just regular hotel food. Some of the best waffles, hash browns, and mojitos that we had! The staff was happy and great as well. We really didn't want to leave our little oasis! Job well done!

Reviews.Title: “No Internet & low water pressure!”
Reviews.Author: Eichiban
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for reception ... Will not likely return. Very low water pressure- my wife could barely wash & rinse her hair. I could not connect to internet via wireless or Ethernet cable. Hotel architecture is very contemporary as are the rooms, however, these two basic provisions made our stay very unsatisfactory. The view from our ocean view room was very nice- overlooking Ala Moana harbor. Location was very convenient to walking along the beach walk. Next time will likely return to the Halekulani!

Reviews.Title: “Constant noise and no pool access”
Reviews.Author: pirt12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not cheap so you expect a high level of service. Had a partial ocean view room. Liked the room but could not sleep. It partly overlooks the sea, but also the hotel entrance and a parking lot across the street which had cars in and out all night. The hotel has a night club and the noise blares up all night if you are either on the partial ocean view side, city view or above the entrance. We came back on two nights over the weekend and there were queues of people sprawling out around the hotel entrance trying to get into the nightclub and cigarettes everywhere. .Reminded me of a college night club. Not very pleasant, plus police cars were called with their blaring sirens both nights. Simply means you cannot sleep.The girls on the reception are helpful. One guy on reception is completely disinterested and unhelpful. They cordon off the pool area for private functions. We stayed five nights and four of them have partial or no access due to private functions. Breakfast service at pool area is slow. Seems to be no service for pool drinks at the adults pool. Would love to recommend this hotel but when you cannot sleep after paying a lot of cash, I would not risk staying here. They need to do something about the queue system at the nightclub and the mess it creates outside. The guys at reception could learn lot from their female colleagues. Stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a Celebrity”
Reviews.Author: Amy K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Modern in July 2012 and it is the most amazing hotel I have ever stayed at. It's like your inside Vogue magazine! They treat you like you are a celebrity! Perfect location for me as i have been to Hawaii 4 times. It is not right in the heart of Waikiki however if you are looking for a relaxing holiday with not to much fuss than this is your hotel! Housekeeping comes around twice a day, we always had new water bottles put in our room which was fantastic. Pool attendants are great and the Morimoto Resturant is AMAZING! A little expensive but if you have the budget then I would definitley recommend this Restaurant. Very Funky and worth your money! Have fun! :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mel T
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Hawaii and my husband and I thought we would try another hotel closer to the main shopping centre and therefore chose the Modern based on the reviews. Big mistake! I should have listened to the warning bell after an email I sent when I booked the City View Room was never answered however, I chose to ignore it. We arrived via taxi to the hotel Monday morning after a very draining and long overnight flight from Australia. Whilst there were 3 staff at the entry of the hotel, not one came to assist us with our bags. Once inside there were a number of other guests waiting to check-in but given the outlay of the reception desks (there's a big pillar right in the middle), there was no orderly queue. We finally got served and as expected, the room was not ready however we were told there was another one available which had no view. Given we had just arrived and were exhausted, we agreed and when we got to the room, our view was that of the roof with all the airconditioning vents. I later queried the room rate with reception and was told it was the same price even if the room had a balcony which I found puzzling. I also noted at the time that another guest checking in had been provided hot towels for their use which is obviously not applicable for all guests! The pool is small and uninviting along with the clinical feel of an all white hotel. I have absolutely nothing complimentary to say about our stay and would definetely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a very good Waikiki Hotel - detailed trip description”
Reviews.Author: naylenk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (32 years old) checked out of the Modern Honolulu today following a 10 day stay. Overall, we found the Modern to be a great, clean hotel in a convenient location offering many amenities. Our stay started off a little rocky when we arrived on a Friday night to a full hotel and the only room available was apparently one on the 4th floor. The nightclub Addiction is located within the hotel and is open till 3:00 in the morning Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights. Unfortunately, the hotel is not soundproofed well and we were able to hear bass beats throughout the night. Our “ocean view” room looked out at the roof and air conditioning units and it was only once you went out on the balcony that we were able to see that lovely ocean view we had been looking forward to. With that being said, we talked to the front desk about being moved to a different room on Saturday, only to be told that the hotel was still full. I really didn’t want to be stuck on the 4th floor for another week and a half, so we waited to unpack and were able to move up to a room on the 10th floor on Sunday. This was MUCH better! The rooms are very clean, white, modern and they were tastefully decorated with a cute splash of Hawaiian colour added through wall decorations. Our room had a comfortable bed, a large chaise lounge, a large flat screen tv with HDMI inputs and a bedside Ipod dock that allowed me to charge my IPhone. From what I can remember, the bathroom amenities included a hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner, body cleansing gel, body lotion, mouthwash, q-tips/cotton balls, and slippers. There was a safe, lint brush, shoehorn and iron/ironing board in the closet. The really impressive part of this hotel is the pool areas. We spent most of our time at the 2nd floor adult pool which is really a very shallow water area surrounded by sand and comfortable chairs/beds. We never had difficulties finding chairs in our desired locations around the pool. We found the service to be much better at the lower level pool where they will put chair covers on your chosen chairs and provide you with towels upon arrival however, the day we spent at this pool there were many children having a great time, frolicking in the water, splashing and jumping in and out. We found the adult area to provide the relaxing atmosphere we were looking for. Towels are available to be used around either pool or to be taken to the beach which is only a couple minutes walk away. If you are a runner, the hotel offers great routes either down Waikiki beach which includes sidewalk and sand running or along the boat harbor and through Ala Moana park which provides sidewalk running along the coastline. The Ala Moana Shopping Center is a large mall about a 10 minute walk away from the hotel. In the lower level, there is a Foodland grocery store where we were able to pick up fresh produce and stuff for making our picnic lunches when we did day trips out. There are small refrigerators in the rooms to keep groceries cold. There are also ABC stores all through Waikiki, one right across the street from the hotel. We bought swim rafts for $3 from the ABC store to use for lying at the beach, as renting chairs along Waikiki beach is expensive and most of the beaches around the island don’t have beach chair rentals. We did many pre planned tours while we were there but on three of the days, we wanted to rent a car to explore. I strongly recommend talking to the concierge at the hotel who will set you up with a car from Enterprise right across the street. They get very good rates and I checked into various options but the pricing and convenience that the concierge was able to provide was unbeatable! Parking offered by the hotel is strictly valet at a cost of $28 per day. While the valet guys all seemed very nice and I’m sure the come and go system they provide for that works well, it was more expensive than we were interested in. The good news for those value conscious people out there is that there is much cheaper parking available all around the hotel. All the way along the Ala Wai Harbour which is just behind the hotel, there is parking available for $1/hour and we were gone for most of the day that we had a rental car so we just paid $10 a night. Some of the stalls even offer a $6 all day rate. The other recommendation I have is to talk to the concierge if you are interested in going to the Cheesecake Factory for supper. It offers an amazing location for people watching if you get a table outside and seems to be the busiest restaurant in Waikiki with average waits of over an hour to get in. They don’t take reservations but if you talk to the concierge, they can call and will probably be able to put you on a call ahead list which provides you with a wait time that is half whatever everyone else has to wait. We did this and only had to wait 35 minutes for an outside table even though they were quoting 70 minutes to the other people in line. The concierge staff was very friendly and also provided us with printouts outlining 2 different driving routes to follow – one with recommendations for stops up to and along north shore and one for the southeast part of Oahu. On Friday nights, Hilton Hawaiian Village which is just down the beach from the Modern, sets off fireworks. The pool deck at the Modern provided a good location to watch them. Magic Island is a short walk from the hotel at the tip of Ala Moana park and it was a great place to watch the sunset. Check out was at 12:00; we were able to get a late checkout for 1:00 but we were not being picked up until 7:45. Fortunately, the hotel had no problems storing our luggage for us and they allow guests in those situations to use the spa facilities to get cleaned up. In the spa bathrooms there are showers with many little amenities including shampoo, conditioner, razors, disposable brushes and combs, hairspray, blowdryer, etc. All in all we were very pleased with our stay at the Modern and would probably stay there again in the future. With that being said, we would recommend they do some work soundproofing for the people on the lower floors on weekend nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: kaixinboy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Modern for three nights recently. I found the hotel to be very comfortable and the staff to be very friendly. The feel of the hotel was very adult friendly, and much better than typical resorts where you have a bunch of screaming kids at the table next to you. It's close to Waikiki and it was good value for money. I would definitely choose the Modern next time I am in Honolulu. Also, Morimoto is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, with some Cons”
Reviews.Author: nomoretummy69
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel located outside of the busy Waikiki area. Very clean and updated. Walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center, the beaches and main Waikiki strip. If you needed anything in the room, like ice, you would have to call Guest Services, which sometimes took awhile. There are no vending machines or ice machines on any floor. For a cheaper breakfast, don't eat at the hotel, walk 5 minutes down the street to IHop or Wailana Coffee Shop. The valet parking fee is ridiculous, $28 a night. Park across the street at the Red Lobster Building for $20 a night, with in and out priviledges. The hotel driveway was often crowded and busy, one afternoon I blocked the entrance to the driveway, cause it would have been awhile before I would exited the driveway, so that my girlfriend could get in the car, but an impatient valet employee was giving us the stink eye. On another occasion, I was ready to take a shower at 11am, but there was not water. The hotel failed to notify us of this issue. Also, a fight broke out from party, that 7 police cars and an ambulance were called in.

Reviews.Title: “New Standard...”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Modern Honolulu. service and staff exemplary. the concierge services outstanding and they couldn't have been more helpful and very understated and not over the top! a welcome relief! Excellent live music in the bar and again great service that wasn't over the top! only negative was the cost of the breakfasts which was excessive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tstangel
Reviews.Content: While traveling on Business is rough ... you can't complain if you are booked into The Modern Honolulu for your business trip to Oahu. The hotel is fresh, welcoming and close to the Convention Center (5 min walk). Staff is welcoming, decor is modern and "white", and the restaurant is unbelievable. Beds are comfortable, lanais big enough, showers modern, and amenities are good. If you must go to Oahu and don't want to stay in a crowded tourist hotel, try this one!

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so; nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: Esqtodd
Reviews.Content: As a hospitality professional, I always take seriously my responsibility as a reviewer. It's rare indeed when a hotel/resort truly offers world class service. Many hotels strive for this, but few achieve. The Modern also strives, but misses the mark. First, the positives: very contemporary and updated design. It's clear this hotel has been updated recently and it reminds me a bit of what you mind find in a "W" hotel in appearance. Very nice pools and convenient location to the ever popular Ala Moana Shopping Center. Rooms were clean and comfortable, but that's about where the PROs end. On a less positive, the rooms are quite small and there is no tub in a standard room. I had several problems with my TV remote control and while I can understand that electronics fail, what is NOT acceptable is when the staff doesn't make it right. I had to ask three times to have the remote replaced. This was not a complicated fix. But, how a hotel handles service failures is what makes them great. The Modern missed the mark on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique Hotel in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: californiagirl26
Reviews.Content: An Ian Schrager designed boutique hotel make this a standout in the sea of cookie cutter resorts in Waikiki. Great public spaces, especially the pools, that embrace the location and Hawaiian atmosphere without overdoing it. The rooms are simple and clean, but do error a bit on the side of being a tad generic (meaning they look like they could be in almost any big city). I got my room at a discount, so I'm not as apt to nitpick as someone who perhaps paid more. I had a "city view" room, but the hotel is perpendicular to the water, not parallel, so only a handful of rooms actually face the ocean dead on. Most rooms are a combo of both city and marina views. I was able to get a room with a balcony, which was really lovely. Traffic noise is definitely an issue in the rooms, especially for the price. Ala Moana Blvd roars during the day, and I was on the 11th floor (14 total floors). The good news is that at night the traffic dies down so I didn't notice any noise at all, and I am an incredibly light sleeper. However, daytime is disappointing, it feels a bit like being in New York City. Room-to-room noise was nil, which was great, but I also wasn't there over the weekend when the nightclub is open. One review complained of the traffic noise at the pool, but when the music is on (which is almost always), I couldn't hear the traffic at all. If traveling with a companion, make sure you are very comfortable with each other as bathroom noise privacy is virtually nonexistent in the room. I spoke to three different concierges who were all super helpful. They arranged a discount on a rental car right across the street and recommended great places for surf lessons and snorkel gear. The rest of the staff was friendly and helpful especially housekeeping, the bellhops and pool attendants, but wait service at the pool was slow and sporadic. Food was decent, not amazing, but in general I'm disappointed with most food in Hawaii. Iron Chef Morimoto's restaurant is well designed with a friendly staff, and some items are slightly cheaper than the hotel menu. Having lived in Los Angeles with some of the world's best sushi, I was not wowed by the food, but it was good and the Hamachi Tartare appetizer was out of this world. The hotel fronts the marina, which is actually quite pleasant and calm, compared to ultra crowded Waikiki Beach (just a short walk way). It's a bit of a trek to the center of Waikiki, but a nice walk. Ala Moana Mall is very close if you need to get a shopping fix in. Do yourself a favor and rent a car for at least a day, so many amazing beaches and sights are a short drive away. The crowd at the hotel seemed like a mix of young friends, couples, and some families with kids. I was a bit surprised to see families at this type of hotel, but they were all very friendly and respectful. Both pools are great (the adult pool is designed to be a mellow soaking pool) and never too crowded. Free internet worked well. The movie selection on the TV was fantastic, although expensive, $14 a pop. Room service was quick. Luggage delivery was slow, but prompt once they found out I was still waiting. The business traveler might enjoy this hotel, but bring your own computer. The business center charges by the minute for their computer use (unless you're printing a boarding pass, which is free). I didn't use the spa so I can't comment on that, but I was told that I could use the spa facilities to change and shower while waiting for my room to be ready. If you're looking for the resort experience, this is not for you. If you're looking for a quiet peaceful getaway-from-it-all place, this hotel isn't for you. But then again neither is Waikiki. It's a hotel with lots of amenities and service on the slightly higher-than-average side, in the middle of a bustling city that happens to have a world class beach nearby. And it will only take you a minute to get from your room to any of the public areas (unlike a resort). It seems the boutique hotel trend has yet to make much headway in Hawaii. The Modern is trying to meet that need and they are doing a good job, but with a few improvements (mainly noise), they will have repeat guests. Overall a nice oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Kids will love the pool!”
Reviews.Author: CLP5
Reviews.Content: The pool is heated and open 24h/ day. The beach is close and your kids will enjoy that, but its super nice to have a heated pool as a back up that is always open. Also there is good food service poolside. We watched the nearby fireworks from the pool - great view! We rated the room a "4" because we have little kids who kept banging their knees on the low platform bed corners- ouch! Beautiful decor, though. Service was great. We checked in quick. We had some special requests which they accommodates easily. They provide a mini fridge if you want one, no charge.

Reviews.Title: “So chic and hip”
Reviews.Author: Syllee15
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the modern was an incredible one. The hotel is beautiful/modern and unlike any others in Waikiki. The service was awesome and rooms so clean and beds so comfortable. The pool was our favorite to hang out at even with the beach so close to us. I highly recommend for people looking for a young hip place to stay! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing corporate meetings I've attended!!”
Reviews.Author: MB_Cine
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! I recently stayed at the Modern Honolulu on a business trip with a few added days of leisure. Our company blocked rooms for our meetings and utilized the conference areas.  The Modern is a contemporary boutique hotel located between the edge of Ala Moana Shopping Center and the Waikiki Strip (walking distance).  Easy to find if driving for the first time. The hotel lobby was inviting, with an additional tucked away lounge area that doubled as a bar at night and club on the weekends. The front desk, concierge, and valet staff were friendly and very courteous.  The concierge was able to rent cars for us the same day, and was conveniently located just across the street. The rooms were crisp white with a touch of Hawaiian flair, and very clean. Although my room didn't have the best view, the extremely comfortable bed and pillows made it worth it! The large flat screen and free Wifi were an added plus! Both pool areas were relaxing with it's lounge chairs, lounge beds, and gorgeous bay views. The ambience at night- the lights in the trees, ocean breeze, and soft Hawaiian music in the background.  The poolside staff service was so-so.. there were more not-so-helpful food service attendants than friendly ones.  However, the special pizza (of the day) and the pork tacos were our group's favorites!  We frequented Morimoto's Restaurant in the hotel for both breakfast and dinner. We loved the contemporary oceana decor, not to mention the food was excellent! The breakfast Banana Pancakes are a definite must try!! If diners are more your style, the Wailana Cafe is just a short walk away.. Great food for the value with excellent courteous service! As for catering our conference meetings, the staff were friendly and helpful.  For the most part the food was good, there just seemed to be quite a few things that ran out quickly- food and iced tea (breakfast and lunches), water on the conference tables, and napkins. Overall, the experience was very enjoyable. We look forward to returning again! I would recommend this hotel for business, couples, ladies/gents weekends, and families.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: limones
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but very clean. Great bathroom. We paid 339/nt for ocean view which is only from balcony. Had my birthday party at Morimotos, which by the way is excellent! So we stayed here. First off, this hotel is ok, it's just for the price the service needs a lot of help. A welcome basket sent by a friend to be waiting in my room was delivered after we arrived. Even more embarrassing for them this same friend needed to call them when she found out we never received the choc covered strawberries ordered. This was set up day before we arrived, I guess they never got the memo. Check in took awhile to get acknowledged. Maybe I've been spoiled and expect better. Oh by the way, in the morning no hot water! My husband took a cold shower and I waited until I got home. Next time we'll go to the Kahala, Halekulani,Moana Surfrider or Royal Hawaiian, because at least we know we will get what we pay for.

Reviews.Title: “WAIKIKI hotel”
Reviews.Author: bpsencik
Reviews.Content: Nice conveinent hotel close to the but away from the bustle of downtown. The place to go to breakfast is across the street below the Chart house which is a good place to eat dinner. The Shore bird is also a good place to eat breakfast. The staff are attenative to your needs and if you want to have coffee in your room they will bring a keurig along with the pods; just ask. The is a few other places to eat breakfast on Ala Moana ; take a walk and you will find them. I've stayed here two times and each time I stay is for the convienence of location.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: robyn s
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Modern Honolulu. Our room was clean and fresh looking, the staff were always helpful and friendly, the pool was a beautiful area to relax and was never overcrowded and the food was good. It is nice and close to Ala Moana shopping centre and only a 15 min walk into the main strip. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Bright Side of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Desron9
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleasant experience from the attitude of the front desk staff to the superior meals at Morimoto. Facilities are first class and the location, while a little off the beaten path, is in a very nice spot alongside the Ala Wai Harbor. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: johannos
Reviews.Content: First impressions were that we had arrived at the rear entrance, our room was not ready, our luggage took 1.1/2 hours to arrive, no tea or coffee making facilities in room, adult pool was 300mm deep and closed at 6pm, also the adult pool was closed for a private function 2 of the 3 days we stayed. The staff were very good, no complaints there. Sorry for the negative review but we were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and hip”
Reviews.Author: ShopDiva
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I booked a room there so that we didn't have to drive home from our reunion on a Saturday night. At check-in the staff was pleasant and friendly and got us to our room quickly. Everything from the lobby to the room was modern, clean, and chic. Our room location could have been better (our room was located right across the elevator) but we weren't bothered by noise so that was a huge plus. The hotel wasn't so big that you could get lost. And I like that the pool, bars, and common areas were quick walks away. I wished that we knew more about the amenities upon check-in. We had to read about everything when we got to our room. It would be nice if the hotel would give guests some "guest passes" or "preferred access" to the clubs and lobby lounge (so you don't have to stand in the long lines or feel like an outsider). Maybe some water in the lobby for guests and extended coffee hours in the Study. Just a suggestion. But overall, it was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: WeAreHere3
Reviews.Content: There isn't much more to add than that offered by others. Our stay was so, so nice! Beautiful hotel, comfy rooms and beds, and just a super chilled atmosphere. My husband, seven year old son and I divided our time between the Modern (four nights) and the Hawaiian Village (four nights). We LOVED the Modern. Food was really good, a little overpriced but no big deal about that -- we were on vacation. Oh, and Chef Morimoto's resto was simply tasty! I was in heaven noshing on the fantastic sushi. If you love seafood, Morimoto's is a must. The Modern's location is perfect for the beach, shopping, and just exploring. When we return to Honolulu -- and we will -- we will stay at the Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: hanleysean
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel in Honolulu. Went on a trip with some mates to hike Mauna Loa on the big island, with a view to spend two relaxing days afterwards in Honolulu chilling out, and the Modern was the perfect place to be. Great facilities (in room and communal), great selection of food and drinks, and fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Looks aren't everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lani H
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean front unit reserved with an early check in. Upon arrival we were told that the room was not ready yet. We politely left to have lunch and upon returning the room was still not ready. We were told that we would receive a call when we could check in. We were never called and we could see that folks were checking in. At 3:15 we went to the back of the line at the front desk to try once again to check in after a 3 hour wait. The lady at the front desk was very cold and never made eye contact. The room was over the restaurant and pool area. Very noisy!!!! The women at the concierge were very good but the young man at the pool was letting non hotel guests use the pool, lounge chairs, towels etc. We overheard this ourselves. There was absolutely no Aloha Sprit. Felt like we were not in Hawaii but in some City Hotel on the mainland. We will never stay there again. It felt like a big con!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience -”
Reviews.Author: princessdrea
Reviews.Content: Clean modern rooms and decor, beautiful pools and lounges. Front desk staff very accommodating, but inconsistent (my office needed to fed ex me something for Saturday delivery, when i asked front desk if they received Sat deliveries was told no...my assistant called fed ex and was told yes...And i did receive my package Sat, although i had to ask for it at the desk - they sent it up, but otherwise was no indication anything was waiting for me - honestly don't know if i would have received it had i not asked). Lunch by the pool was very nice, but overpriced for what you got. Beautiful setting and will keep it in my top 3 on Honolulu options (Kahala Resort and Royal Hawaiian being the other 2). Oh - and if you're going to be there over a weekend, definitely request a room on the highest floor possible - nothing like being woken up at 3am with the nightclub on the first floor blasting "Bohemian Rhapsody"...Fortunately the hotel was understanding and relocated us to room higher up on our last night...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: aboutmelbourneapts
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Hawaii, I spent my last night in Waikiki at The Modern and boy how I wished I had stayed there for longer! The Modern greatly improved my trip to Hawaii, during which I had been very disappointed with the general standard and cost of other accommodation. From the time I arrived at 1030am staff were wonderfully helpful, storing my luggage and endeavoring to have my room ready early. I was always planning to spend the day shopping but staff called me on my international mobile number to advise me that my room was ready by 1130am! When I did arrive back to check in, the service could not have been more welcoming and prompt. The hotel is sleek and sophisticated and and exactly what I was hoping and searching for when I had been trying to book accommodation for my trip, The Modern is filling a huge gap in the hotel market in Hawaii. My room was lovely and fresh and a perfect retreat for a solo traveler. The pools and facilities were all stunning and modern and well maintained, and all the staff were a credit to the hotel and its management! The gym facilities were amazing and I had a great undisturbed two hour workout which was much appreciated. The room service menu was expansive and the burger I ordered was speedy and delicious :) Although I am not sure if I would make the trip to Hawaii again, the promise of another stay The Modern would surely convince me to!

Reviews.Title: “Modernity meets good old-fashioned service”
Reviews.Author: Farrah409
Reviews.Content: LOVED The Modern! We only spent one night there as we passed through Honolulu, but we immediately wished we had been able to stay a little longer. The location is perfect, the rooms defined by clean, minimalist design, and the service impeccable. Staff were happy to make recommendations for local hotspots and chat with us-- and we later found their suggestions well supported by our guidebook reviews and our experience eating out and hitting the town. I loved the floor-to-ceiling blinds in our room and took full advantage of them to enjoy the warm night breezes and early morning sun. On the whole, we were swept up in the hip, laidback vibe of the hotel and enjoyed all the little luxuries in the room. We felt refreshed after only one night!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: Panderson1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Hawaii and we decided to try The Modern Hotel instead of the chain hotels. This was one of the best decisions made for our vacation. The hotel is modern and hip! I was most impressed with the customer service-everyone at the hotel gave us excellent service and ensured that we had a great experience. They made our birthday stay/family vacation an experience to remember! Highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway for newlyweds”
Reviews.Author: E M
Reviews.Content: The Modern is an ideal location for newlyweds. Sooo many choices for drinks - 2 bars, a night club, and excellent room service choices. It was almost like a 3rd honeymoon :-) Mormioto's food is to die for. LOVE the bar at the hotel pool. The Modern decor is definitely unlike any other hotel in Hawaii. We only stayed a short time but had such a fun time - and we didnt even leave the hotel! There's plenty to do. Perfect for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay right near Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: activetravelwithkids
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel just to the west of Waikiki. Although not beachfront (faces yacht harbor), they do have a bit of sand at one of the pools. Easy to get to without getting into Waikiki traffic. Valet parking allows for in/out priviledges. Staff friendly. Room spacious. Nice bar and pool area, not the lava rock stuff. Crisp, clean but not stark. Good restaurant, Morimoto. If you want a nice place near Waikiki but do not want the chaos of a Hilton Hawaiian Village nor the $$$ of Royal or Haleaklanai, this is a good choice. Just wish bathroom had more privacy from bedroom, seems to be trend at boutique hotels to have connection between the two. Massage at spa was average, facilities good. Exercise room looks out onto upper level pool/sand. Very white, nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!! Great staff...very friendly and accommodating. Beautiful and spacious hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: Satisfiedsleeper
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted warmly by the attentive valet staff who opened our doors and carried our luggage for us. We then checked in at the front desk and were told that they had upgraded our room from one with a city view to one with a partial ocean view. When we arrived at our room, we were absolutely impressed with how clean and spacious it was! Our room had two very comfortable double beds, cordless phones, a large flat screen tv, and many other great features. We requested a refrigerator for our room and was told that it was on a first come first served basis and was put on the list. The purpose of the refrigerator was to store daily medication that needed to be refrigerated. I had called the front desk to see if I could make arrangements for them to store it since there wasn't a refrigerator in the room. They offered to store it for us and was going to send someone to pick up the medication from us. When we opened the front door we were surprised to find one of the staff members with a little refrigerator for us. Big thanks to the staff at Modern Honolulu for being so accommodating and exceeding our expectations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the hotel, and it has been nothing short of amazing! The hotel is immaculate and the decor is chic and sophisticated with a beach vacation twist. This is exactly what I envisioned when I thought "Hawaiian vacation". From valet to calling to the front desk for ice and glasses; I have been in the lap of luxury ever since setting foot on this propertyl!

Reviews.Title: “Delicious!”
Reviews.Author: z1bby
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews, this is a great hotel. Not much to add really except you have to have one of their signature cocktails - their frozen coconut mojito, I'm home now and experiencing serious withdrawl from not having a supply of them on hand. This was a weekend treat for us, we normally stay up the road at the Aqua Bamboo, but decided to splurge for the weekend and experience The Modern. So glad we did, it was fabulous, only downside is that our NZ Paeso is so worthless, it costs us an arm and a leg to stay here. I hope one day, we can afford another splurge here!

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel in Waikiki - by far!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyGirl888
Reviews.Content: After months of overwork and a brain that had fully seized up from lack of sleep, I put my tired body on a plane for Honolulu. The moment I walked through the door of The Modern, I knew I'd found the perfect hotel. The rooms are well-appointed with very comfy beds and all the mod cons. Free internet around the whole hotel is a bonus (unheard of in Australia). The food was great, across the board, as were the cocktails. An excellent burger and mojito next to the pool four days in a row was bliss. I could go on and on about the specifics, but beyond everything else, this place is COOL. The music is cool, the decor is cool, every single thing adds to the exclusive, chic, modern vibe. I am trying to find a place in my calendar for my next trip, because I will be back - and soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickinSEA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located slightly away from the heart of Waikiki near the marina. As a result, you avoid the noise and the crowds while still being walking distance or a short cab ride/Waikiki Trolley rode away from everything you might want. The facility is beautifully rendered with a fantastic Sunrise and Sunset pool. There is a an onsite gym that is surprisingly well-appointed for a hotel. I was at the hotel for 6 days and was the lucky recipient of an upgraded room with a sitting area. The room was lovely with a view of the pool and the harbor. The beds are super-comfortable and the rooms are really nice. Although I was in Honolulu on business, this hotel made me feel as if I was on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jerry B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Modern and found the rooms very minimalist and noisy. We were across the hall and down a few rooms from the elevator, but heard it all night long. We had ocean view room with a nice view of the water, but the sliding doors have no weather stripping and the noise from the street below was obtrusive and woke us up several times during the night. The room was very clean and the staff was very nice, but would not stay here again due to the noise. We met two other couples with the same complaint.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Waikiki hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderer3121
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks on Oahu and staying in a number of different hotels, I can honestly say that this one was my favorite (even over Trump.) The pools are amazing. There is one for kids and one for adults to cool off. The rooms are nicely furnished with "modern" design. The staff is helpful and friendly. The location is great--you have an amazing view of the harbor and are a short walk to the lesser crowded beaches of Waikiki. You do not want to miss the experience of staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: Shandra W
Reviews.Content: We were treated like second class citizens from the very start. We were forced to give the hotel $500 of the money we had saved to go on family excursions. We were told it was hotel policy not to accept debit cards but they didn't seem to mind accepting my debit card when it came to paying for poolside services or salon services. This put me off wanting to spend money I would have willingly parted with, had I not felt so completely bullied. They tried to charge us $65 per night for an air mattress for my children that was very nearly deflated half way through the night. The staff at the poolside were snobbish and ignored people that were not clearly well off. They gave poolside beds to their friends that would have cost guests in excess of $150 just to reserve for a day. One of the bartenders was extremely rude and inappropriate with me. When I complained to management, they credited our account $50 and refunded our drinks. This was a nice gesture but the attitude of the staff did not change and the offending person was not required to make an apology, which, in truth, was all that was required. There were several charging mistakes made with our account as well. They were charging us for the 'bed' after I'd had it removed when it deflated on the first night. I was summoned to the front desk to be informed they required more money from me, only to find they had been charging our room for a week at $65 per night for a blow up bed we didn't have! The day before, we were told at the bar that there was no money on the account. That was a mistake on their part as they had put the account under the wrong name. Needless to say I was not impressed at all with the incompetence that seemed to be prevalent in this '4 star' hotel. I regret wasting my money and it really is a shame. I feel so disgusted by this hotel. It really is quite beautiful and a pleasant ambience to be in. The staff really let this place down.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous property, horrid service”
Reviews.Author: JenniferEJ
Reviews.Content: Oh, Modern Honolulu. You're so close to being amazing! The rooms (most of them, at least) are so stylish and glam. The property is stunning - you're never far from a pool or a cocktail. The food is insanely good. The location rocks, particularly for a business traveler like me: easy access to the airport, near central Waikiki but close enough to the edge that it's not a zoo. I also love that this hotel is not too big. You can always find a lounge chair or a server. It feels manageable, unlike that mega-theme-park behemoth next door. While most of Waikiki is overrun and overwhelming, the Modern is cool and relaxing. I love the vibe here. The service, however, stinks. I have stayed here multiple times and can attest that it's not an isolated incident. There are, as always, a few dedicated staff that do a great job (approaching me with a cocktail in hand helps), but overall, they desperately need senior hotel management to come in and crack the whip. A few, but not all, incidents: The bellhops have alligator hands when it comes to opening doors or carrying your luggage down the few steps to the driveway. There is ALWAYS a line at the front desk. There is nowhere to get coffee before 7am, unless you want to pay $11 for room service; $17 for a large pot (with one mug! This despite the waiter entering the room and seeing a second, clearly caffeine-deprived person there). The room reservation system doesn't sync up with what is available, and the person I spoke with invented a room that did not, in fact, exist (ocean front with two double beds), although they were happy to charge me for it. It was corrected only after the front desk sullenly failed twice, including attempting to put me in rooms that were getting progressively worse, and I demanded to speak to a manager. These and other unlisted incidents are, admittedly, not deal-breakers. But they do add up, and simple things like asking for your check so you can catch a flight, only to watch the server stand around and talk to her friends while the clock ticks, are unnecessary and stressful. I always stay here and will continue to. However, like most hotels in Waikiki, the Modern isn't cheap, nor is hotel management and service some unfathomable mystery. Get it together, folks! Please! ... because I am coming back. I can't bear to stay anywhere else in Waikiki, although you sometimes make me wish I could.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: karenwatson48
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay at this hotel and overall we were very impressed. We got a taxi from the airport wich cost $35. But booked roberts suttle for our return $24. Check in was very speedy. We were allocated a room on the 10th floor with a partial sea veiw/ harbour and heard no noise at all the room was lovely and quiet with effective ac. the room size was also impressive with 2 double beds, lovely furniture and a 40 inch tv. The bathroom was lovely with a great walk in rain head shower. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but the reception staff did provide a kettle when one became available the following day. However nothing else to make a drink was provided but a bit of improvisation sorted that thanks to the local abc store over the road! The pool areas are beautiful and the staff are very attentive. We were a bit dissopointed however to find the adults only lagoon is actually only ankle deep but the surrounding terrace is great. The sun beds are very comfortable and fresh towels are provided daily. The other sunrise pool was also very good with a reasonable sized pool it was a little crowded at the weekend but we never had a problem gettin a lounger. The beds around the edge of the pool are expensive having to spend $150 from the bar to use one all day. We were on a bed and breakfast package and couldn't fault the food or the service there was a good selection of food and the quality was excellent. The hotel is a few mins walk to the beach and is adjacent to the Hilton lagoon. If you are planning on sunbathing on Waikiki beach the sunbeds start at $35 for 2 and get more expensive the further down the beach you walk. We made do with a couple of air beds for $3 from abc store!!! The hotel is about a 10-15 min walk to the main part of the town were there are a selection of bars and restaurants and numerous high end designer shops! They have very early happy hrs in Honolulu starting at 3pm till 6pm with half price beers and appis, the restaurants mostly stop serving at 10pm. There are a few bars an restaurants outside the hotel which are fine if you don't fancy the walk every night. We had a late flight home so were able to keep our room until 6pm for $99. We really enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel and would recommend it to any couples .

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: labergo
Reviews.Content: Waikiki is a launching point for other Hawaiian islands. The Modern was a great surprise. At one end of Waikiki this hotel is perfectly situated to explore Honolulu and close enough to the airport. Staff was friendly. Pool and pool bar are beautiful. Morimoto's restaurant was fantastic way to end our trip. Wish we would have stayed here at the beginning or our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Usually stay in the hub of Waikiki, no more, we have discovered The Modern”
Reviews.Author: HonoluluKat
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in the hub of Waikiki but decided to try The Modern. We were not disappointed. The Modern is a contemporary sleek hotel with beautiful pools and ambience second to none. We were given a complimentary up grade with views across the Lagoon to the surf. The Customer service was fantastic. We decided to extend our trip by 2 days which was seamless.The Pool service was amazing, even offered samples of banana sorbets.We invited our friends who were staying in the hub of Waikiki and they could not believe the freshness and quality of the food which we ordered during Happy Hour. We will never stay in the hub of Waikiki now we have stayed at The Modern..

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at the MODERN”
Reviews.Author: OmarTraveller
Reviews.Content: I really loved my stay here at the Modern, I have stayed here for 12 nights and enjoyed it. The new style of the hotel is amazing, so MODERN. It's so clean, and the staff are so helpful. I loved my room, specially my big screen TV, the terrace and the food from the room service. The location is perfect if you want to be a little away from the busy waikiki beach hustle, but not too far. Plus you have great restaurants around the hotel, not to mention the Morimoto, the japanese restaurant within the hotel. I would come here again if I ever come to Honolulu again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, swanky and fun!”
Reviews.Author: SondraGray
Reviews.Content: Nice place for a couple to stay at, but families are welcome too. Very classy, but not uptight. Restaurant, pool, fitness center and nightlife entertainment right on the premises. Hotel in great location, within walking distance of everything cool in Waikiki. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Superflylocalguy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I, stayed at the Modern this past weekend. Upon arrival, we were met by the valet / bellmen who offered the very first impression of the property. Very friendly and helpful. The lobby area is nice, dark floors with white walls, the sculpted wood reception desk is cool and the broken surfboards add that splash of color. The young lady at the desk was also very friendly and gave a quick run down of the property (where the pools were, restaurant and coffee service in the morning and access to Addiction). The rooms at the Modern are very low key, Asian - contemporary: white (or off-white) everywhere with the exception the some of the furniture and wood shutters. The bed was comfy although the pillows were a little too soft for us. The bathroom was clean, uncluttered - simple. This was for us, a nice change after staying at properties with the Hawaiian theme that sometimes goes overboard. The view from the room, on the 16th floor was great, It offered views of the two pools and the marina and the best seats for the fireworks on Friday night at the neighboring Hilton.The Modern is in a great area, close to Ala Moana Center and a good 15 minute walk to Kalakaua Avenue where the real action is. We had dinner at Morimoto which was a great experience. The restaurant is japanese esthetic meets beach-chic with a TOUCH of Hawaii. The food was great and the service well done. We also had a drink at the Study (lobby bar) which tends to get quite packed quickly. The only downside (if you could call it that) is that there is no self parking (Valet only) and the lights in the common/public areas are too dim at night. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay at the Modern and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Reception Supervisor - Suki”
Reviews.Author: lawhubert
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself, i would give it a 4 stars. With the service, I would give it a 5 stars. I had an issue with charge card billing & the food from the pool side bar. As I mentioned it to Suki, she took care of it for me right the way with a sincere smile. This is the type of Aloha which I can't feel anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: CG615911
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Modern hotel in April. It is a good hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was nice and clean but for the price we paid i was expecting more. Our room was at the front of the hotel and quite high up, we did have some noise from people out the front of the nightclub. The location is good for shopping, about a 10 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre. It is about a 20 minute walk to the main strip, with reatuarants, shopping and night clubs. The pool area is nice but small, you have to try a coconut mojito from the bar at the pool area, i would have to say it is my new favourite drink.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: LP1247
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not your "typical" hotel. Our room was on the small side and was in this day of technology was definitely lacking in the outlet department. The terrace with a view of the ocean was delightful. For the price, one would expect either a free coffee service in the lobby (there was none) or a coffee pot in the room (had to requeste one and when the first didn't work, we had to ask twice for a replacement). Have to say the bed (platform style) was comfy, but the wooden corners are just lurking waiting for you to catch a shin! Ouch! Very nice bathroom but I have to question why they place the wastebin under the toilet paper roll (weird!). Nice pool area and easy access to Waikiki Beach and walking distance to all the shops at Hilton Hawaiian Village. Restaurant was very pricey with a limited menu.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SassyBSydney
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I decided to take a very last minute girlie getaway to Hawaii for ten days and we spent our last four nights at this property. It is a really great hotel, the pool and private "beach" area are just wonderful and we would normally stayed there unti 7pm when the sun would dissapear behind the buildings. Lovely view of the ocean adn the marina from our room, but unfortunetly no balcony but we were very rarely in our room so it didnt matter. Great for friends travelling, two lovely big queen beds in the room and huge shower to wash off the sand and sunscreen. Very funky bar downstairs with great cocktails, but we enjoyed the outside areas much more. One of the best things, but not for our wallets, was that the hotel is about an 8 minute walk to the famous Ala Moana shopping complex! 290 stores, bars, restaurants and services- we easily spent 10 hours there one day and night, shop all day- dinner and drink all night! Breakfast was not included which was disappointing for the price we paid but we ordered it on our last morning and the food was very tasty and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean to the point of sterility; strange lavatories”
Reviews.Author: PattyDumpling
Reviews.Content: I have to start with the bathrooms, which is not a normal place to start a review, but these are not normal bathrooms. The Modern employed a talented interior designer to give the entire hotel a very unique and specific look- it's like a beach house, but newer and cleaner. All the wood is bleached white like driftwood, the light fixtures have an old-school maritime look, and a lot of the space is divided by slatted wooden blinds which you can open and close, just like a little cottage on the sea. The issue with the bathrooms is that those slatted blinds make up a large portion of the wall in front of the toilet. People on either side of the blinds can open and close them at will, so there's a privacy issue there, but more to the point: there's a lot of air between those slats. They're absolutely no barricade to <ahem> "sounds and smells". It's like putting the toilet out in the middle of the room. I thought everything else about the rooms was just fine- they're very, very clean (everything, from the walls to the sheets to the comforters, is pure white, so they have to be). The beds were quite comfortable, and I'm a stickler when it comes to mattresses. Overall, it's about what you would expect if you're paying top-dollar for a premium hotel, which in this case, you are. Where The Modern really stands out is with its outdoor pool/bar/restaurant area, which they quite rightly use as the image for their hotel. It is a gorgeous space, with nice landscaping, very cool seating areas (including middle-eastern style lounging beds), and wonderful lighting which really cranks up the romance at night (the giant glowing neon blue elevator bank from the hotel next door ruins the effect somewhat, but who's counting?). You can chill in the lounge area and watch the ocean from afar with the marina in the foreground (also not bad to look at), or you can follow the boardwalk a few hundred yards down to the beach itself. It's a convenient spot. The service was impeccable. Very professional, very friendly from the folks behind the desk to the porters to the valet. The guy behind the desk called another hotel for me to help me book a room for another leg of my trip- come on, that's good service. Where things broke down a bit was when I hung out by the pool at night. It can be very, very difficult to get service out there. There were long lines at the bar, few waitstaff taking orders, and it felt like they were understaffed by a lot. I gave up on my drink order and just bought an entire bottle of wine so that I wouldn't have to beg someone for service again. I don't recommend staying in Waikiki, period, but if you have to, The Modern is worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BurchScott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Modern from July 1st through 9th. I was worried when we first booked our room because we were traveling during the high season. That being said the hotel did not feel cramped at all, getting a chair by the pool or a pool bed was easy enough, but the place did not feel empty; it felt comfortable. The cleanliness is off the charts and with all the white they definately hold themselves to a standard. Very few hotels with them being transitional in nature would dare to use white and instead use patterns that can hide dirt. The service was off the charts. I want to give a very big shout out to Carlie (i hope i spelled her name right). She said she is new in her profession of being a concierge but you would never know. She worked hard to provide us with the entertainment we wanted and more than that when we wanted to drive around the island she gave us an itinerary with personal notes and not just something the hotel gave as a canned tour. Service has declined so much over the last decade it was good to see this place is not amongst the rest. When we extended our stay an extra day the hotel front desk worked to make sure we did not have to move rooms (Thanks Jermaine). We were also upgraded because they had space at no charge, something that hotels stopped doing for whatever reason; but is something that causes me to be loyal. The poolside staff was both hard working and attentive. Now that the love fest is over; here are the issues i had that kept me from going five circles.(I think they are supposed to be stars but they just look like circles to me) One of the three elevators was out for a couple of days which made going up and down a hassle (but it was fixed after a few days). They do not have two pools only one, the one not on a wooden deck is only three inches deep and is more estetics than actual pool. The drinks were a little high even by hotel standards. And i have to say, i like a good Mai Tai and this hotel makes about the worst one i have ever had. The one that is deconstructed is also a disappointment. I am not sure how a hotel of this price and star rating has no jacuzzi, but it does not. The club on Fri. and Sat. is loud, i heard it from my 9th floor room so keep that in mind when staying. They did not allow a late checkout but that was not a big deal, but be mindful of it when you plan your trip and ask ahead if it is something you need; and i assume they would have if they could have. If going to the beach is something you are looking to do, The Modern is a little hike to the beach and at it's price point it may be a factor. It is a very small walk to the Ala Moana mall which as far as malls go is very nice. However, the hotel is about a Ten dollar cab ride into the thick of Waikiki. On a positive note if you are going to be staying in Hawaii for the 4th of July there really is no better place to stay for the third largest fireworks display in the United States. We watched the fireworks from the pool and saw every bit of it with comfort and ease. The pool area was both inviting and quiet and offered lounge chairs in a few inches of water. All in all we had a good stay, If you are looking for one of the few boutique hotels that gets it right give The Modern a chance. Mahalo and Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay here and really enjoyed it. Check in was super fast and easy - complete with some lime water and a cold cloth. great touch. I personally loved the room - very minimalist. bed was comfy - mattress on the firmer side. Loved the shower - and LOVED the fact that the faucet was on the opposite side so that you could turn it on and let it warm up without getting soaked. Two not so great things about the room - wifi was not too strong and kept going down. and there was a crappy travel hairdryer...a pet peeve of mine. The pool and pool bar are wonderful. very relaxing and wasn't too crowded even though I believe the hotel was completely booked. bar staff were wonderful - very attentive. My only two minor complaints were the valet - once had to wait 10-15 minutes to even pull into the front of the hotel because they were backed up. Not sure if this is a regular occurrence or not. And I asked for a spoon in the lobby for some yogurt early one morning and they said they didn't have any (i'm sure the lobby bar had some silverware...) and that they would send some up. Well, 20 minutes later, it arrived. Annoying that it took that long to get a simple item. again - the complaints were minor and I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly reception desk staff, very disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Kaye T
Reviews.Content: This was a great disappointment after a very friendly welcome by the front desk staff. We had reserved two ocean view rooms, adjacent if at all possible. Upon arrival (4pm) we were told our rooms were on the 10th and 16th floors - not quite adjacent... As there was nothing else available, we checked in, and found the rooms to be acceptable, but the ocean was only visible from the lanai. My perception is this hotel is going for the ultra-modern/minimalist ambiance, but it does not work, some of the decor is questionable, and the amenities are scarce. For example: a small ukelele hanging on the wall, with a couple of brightly colored scarves next to it, a mohair throw blanket (in June in Waikiki??) on the chaise lounge, and a basket under the counter in the bathroom with soap, shampoo, etc. The bathroom was separated from the bed by shutters - and the mattress sat on top of a plain wooden box (with very sharp corners!!!) Previously we have stayed at the Hyatt Regency, Hilton Village, and the Sheraton - all within the same price range. We thought we'd try something different this time, as we were hosting family from Australia on their first visit to the islands - and the reviews looked good. We will not return to The Modern Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious treat”
Reviews.Author: Avril W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We stayed here for 3 nights last September. At the time, we had our 9 month old daughter with us and the hotel was able to accommodate us without making us feel like lepers with a kid. The room is luxurious -- all white, minimal -- I personally like this; I can't have this in my own home, but I do like to experience something different for my money. The pool is wonderful -- a perfect retreat for couples and children. Well staffed. Pool side service is excellent. Morimoto's restaurant -- a wonderful treat -- I loved the pulled pork and peanut butter caramel ice-cream. The hotel is situated next to the Hyatt or another big chain hotel, so in the evening we would walk to the next hotel to enjoy the open air entertainment and other family amenities at the hotel next door! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hip in Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: travelingaussie0
Reviews.Content: What a breath of fresh air after all the anonymous gigantic chain hotels that dominate the Waikiki hotel scene. Though slightly too many rooms to be labelled boutique- everything else earns the Mideen this label. Funky foyer, attentive staff dressed in trendy uniforms, really well appointed spacious rooms ( with cute touches like a ukulele and sarongs for the pool) and 2 lovely pool areas playing chilled background music whilst the pool staff circulates frequently refilling iced water or offering food and beverage menus. Everything appears relaxed and laid back but the staff are definitely on their ties. Just be warned that if you book a twin bedded room you will not get a balcony ( which was disappointing but we were upgraded to a pool side room and the waist high window opens up fully anyway) complaints about the openness of the bathroom are unwarranted as you can shut the louvres for privacy. The hotel certainly does not feel like an old one revamped- it's classy and contemporary. Did find the neighbourhood around it to be a bit rough at night but otherwise I couldn't recommend the Modern highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Modern in Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: HappyNileCruisers
Reviews.Content: True that Waikiki has an abundance of nice, beachfront hotels, but this one has a unique laid-back vibe. We indulged in a suite for our family and the view was over the top. We really enjoyed the casual restaurant at the pool. Staff and service very nice. Partying noise is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: jennphonic
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It was a little hard to find, but worth the hunt. A tip - park valet. The rooms are beautiful. The ocean view is lovely over the marina. I love the poolside bar. The food is great and it's just gorgeous. If you stay here, don't miss Morimoto Waikiki which is on the property. The food is a work of art! I'd also recommend this hotel for meetings and events. Again, the rooms provide a wow factor and the sales staff is accommodating as far as creating package deals to meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel with al looks but lack of personality!”
Reviews.Author: kukulimoku
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to book at this hotel after reading other reviews. We were disappointed after our 3-day of stay! We were native to Oahu and visitting Oahu at least twice per year for the last 5 years. We have stayed at the Hyatt Regency, the Hilton village and the Mariott Waikiki beach! After having dined at Morimoto's restaurant in January and seen the pool area and read some of the reviews, we decided to stay at the Modern. When we got to the hotel, the valet service was quite slow. There was no one greeting guests. The checking-in process was so so! The partial ocean view room costed approximately $300 plus per night. The room was cleaned and modernized with white wall, furniture and bed! The pool is quite nice. However, during our stay there was a wedding going on at the upper sunset deck, hotel guests were all crowded in the lower pool deck. The gym was small with some equipments but clean. The staff is average, doing their jobs with minimal effort. There was no "usual aloha smiles and warmness!" Perhaps, being modernized is meaning to be sterile and cold! The hotel is closed to Ala moana shopping center but quite a walk to waikiki. If you have a car, it will cost $28 per night to park. Taxi cost approximately $15 including tax to waikiki. The hotel does not have a hospitality room for late flight guests. You can leave your luggage with the valet and use the pool. We were told that we could shower at the spa 's shower before 5:30pm. There was no late check-out accommodation. Bottomline, the Modern is all about eye candy but lack of personality, warmness, convenience and comfort towards an unforgetable vacation! Yes, we will stay at the Modern again if we get a really great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: lisu83
Reviews.Content: Just perfect. If you really want to spend your hawaiian vacations in a remarkable place, this should be your hotel of choice. Great staff! Thanks a lot for an immediate late-night checkin truly saving our vacations.

Reviews.Title: “we got this on a secret hotel deal”
Reviews.Author: Lizzed
Reviews.Content: The price was right, it was a secret hotel deal so we did not know we were going here until it was paid in full. The hotel has been updated inside and the rooms feel like they are trying to hard to be modern..did not like the slated windows between the bathroom and bedroom, privacy was a issue. the beds were comfy and we had a view of the city which was ok with me.
