It was a overnight stay. Two people from my party went to the lounge and did not like it, it was dark and gloomy they said. We had breakfast out on the front pation in the morning it was very expensive and not very good. I am glad I did not have to pay full price for this hotel, so if you can get a deal its worth it, nice location and good beds, eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the tourist trap hotels - go PERFECT with the Modern”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: I lived in Honolulu for 20 years and come back often. I also travel weekly on business all over the US. This last week I had the PLEASURE of staying at the Modern Honolulu for 4 days and could not be happier. This hotel is fun, cool, sexy and sweet all in one. Great atmosphere all around the hotel. GREAT location - not in Waikiki, but close enough. Next to Hilton Hawaiian Village and a good beach walk. McDonalds across the street as well as Kimo Bean for good coffee. Staff is nice and friendly. This is no W Hotel - where the staff is stuck up. It's real and fun. The lobby is fun, bright and welcoming. The valet staff is SUPERB. Very good, very friendly and fast - that is what you want. The Studio downstairs is fun for coffee in the AM or drinks in the PM (it's hidden behind this cool bookcase). The pool deck and pool are PERFECT. Just the right touch of calm, modern and a great salt water pool, that is perfect temperature all the time! The lounges are luxurious and spacious. Perfect. Pool staff is good, but they might need one more person on all the time to get to everyone. Bar staff is nice as well. One issue is that you can't bring food from outside to the pool (we tried to bring breakfast back and they kicked us out due to the breakfast service there) but take it to the 2nd floor and the upstairs pool deck and you will be all set. Very nice. GREAT VIEWS of some of my favorite south shore surf spots from the deck as well. Miramoto (Iron Chef) has a restaurant on the 1st floor as well as a very trendy shop for the tastemaker in you. Rooms are PERFECT - super bright, clean, NEW, great TV and iPhone sound system. Simple and clean. Bathrooms are equally as good. Nice terrazzo sinks! Most of the rooms are partial ocean view so nice. Maid service is friendly and fast. Very good. Our room was a nice oasis from it all. Last note - there is a club that opens in the hotel on Friday and Saturday so be prepared for noise till 3am on those nights with people leaving the club on the Hobron Lane side of the building. Overall a FANTASTIC experience and one that I would recommend to anyone heading to Honolulu for a few days. Its vacation perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, my fav in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Jenn N
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a work/ vacation trip. The online pictures of the pool and hotel are beautiful so I was a bit worried it wouldn't live up the expectation, but it really is nice as pictured. The hotel is modern but not over the top. Beautiful white theme, the room was large and very comfortable. The hotel as the north end of Waikiki, about a 20-30 min to the main Waikiki area or a short cab ride (there was also cabs waiting outside of the hotel. Also it's not a large resort which I enjoyed because it was quite and peaceful throughout the hotel and pool. My only compliant it was often difficult to get the attention of the pool side staff to order drinks or food. My empty drink would sit on the side table in clear view with staff members frequently walking by but not asking if they could take it or if I wanted another. They were always plenty of staff members a but it seem more like busy activity without actual work being done.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Colleen563
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, location is great because you are away from the craziness of Waikiki but your only a mile away. The rooms look just as they are advertized on The Modern website...neat and very clean. The hotel has a very modern chic vibe to it....similar to The Standard in LA. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique & cool”
Reviews.Author: Susie W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Modern for a number of nights in mid June 2012. The hotel is positioned along the beach from the main drag, which is a good thing, given how busy Waikiki beach is but is only 4 mins walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The ocean view rooms above the two pools are best (along with ocean facing rooms) - ours was Rm 421 and have views toward the beach. Rooms are an excellent size and the beds very comfortable with Frette linen sheets. Food is excellent, especially the pizzas and sandwiches. Breakfast is served around the pool with attentive waiter service. During our stay, a strike was staged for a few hours around the hotel which was beyond the contol of management however they offered complementary cockails & food for 2 hours in the front bar which was very generous. One suggestion to the hotel is for the music which starts at 8am to late at night around the pool (& audible in your room) is to possibly start at 8.30/9am given many people arrive from international flights and might need a sleep-in :) The only glitch during our stay was that the front desk lost x2 ice-packs we asked to be held in their freezer and they did'nt offer something complementary in return. Best rates are offered via their website. We'd stay again. Susie & Matt Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, everthing you need, very big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Juzzyc21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, wish we had longer. Rooms were awesome with a big balcony and very comfortable furniture! Bed was huge and pillows were awesome! The Modern has 2 pool areas, an adults only, which has its own pool bar, and also a family pool, also with its own bar. Ample bananna lounges surrounding (and also wading in) the water, and the adults only pool also had a beach feel with sand surrounding the water. The hotel has a nice contempory piano bar which is in the reception, hidden behind the book case in the "library" Hotel is a 15 minute walk from Waikiki shops and restaurants and a 10 min walk from the Ala Moana shopping Complex. If staying again I would request either ocean view, a view looking over Ala Moana, as any other view will just be of neighboring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Sunkissedbabe23
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay here. The spa was awesome had a massage and a mani pedi both girls were friendly and professional. The room was great, beds were comfy, room was clean, housekeeping each day was great. Ordered room service twice, both times it came pretty fast, the food was good. Anytime a guest service person came they always made sure everything was going ok and seemed genuinely concerned if they could do anything else. The pool staff was always friendly and the bar staff too, kinda made you want to skip the beach and just hang at the pool all day! Part of my time spent here was by myself and I felt 100% comfortable here the whole time. Thanks foran amazing stay, I'll be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very modern”
Reviews.Author: suzyq164
Reviews.Content: A hotel that stands out from the rest. A boutique hotel with a modern chic ambience and great staff. Absolutlely two of the best pools on the strip with superb food and drinks at very reasonable rates. We had 10 of the best days we have ever spent in Honolulu. The rest of our family were staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and wanted to come to our pool each day as it was far superior and had better service. Everything we asked for was provided without fuss. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Chic”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia T
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Modern...loved the fresh, modern style and the cool ambience. The room was fantastic, the bed very comfy. Lovely views and loved the hotel's modern facilities. The pool and bar area is really pleasant and the location superb.

Reviews.Title: “chic and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley W
Reviews.Content: This is probably the only boutique hotel in Oahu that gets it right. We live on the island and take frequent weekend staycations with our 1 year old. We usually avoid staying at boutique hotels with our toddler however we felt welcomed here. The rooms are chic, modern, comfortable, and beautiful. There was a yellow ukulele in our room which my daughter fell in love with and wanted to take home and the helpful staff made it possible. We had lunch by the pool; though the food was delicious the service was extremely slow. We had an ocean view room and the view of the marina was beautiful. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Divine, Even for a Diva”
Reviews.Author: Live_frm_AsiaPac
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Modern was one of the most wonderful hotel stays I have had. I have stayed at over 100 hotels in my travels and I must stay The Modern is in my top 3. The Modern is a boutique hotel which I usually avoid because we have young children which are usually not well tolerated by boutique hotels or their guests. The Modern is a lovely exception. I saw at least 3 other families during my one night stay and all were welcomed, behaving and not. The rooms are exceptionally comfortable. While the asthetic is modern, it is not a harsh, ultra white kind. There are wonderful creature comforts like soft (cashmere?) ombre throws and brightly colored ukuleles. Some decorators remove all funcational items to make it looked modern, but The Modern gets it right by keeping towel racks and clothes lines while still looking clean and uncluttered. Shower only; no tub. The beds and pillows are just right; not overly firm or soft. The headboard is padded for nice reclining. I could not find any aspect that was worn, or needed touching up. It was clean to perfection. I almost wondered if we had a brand new room. Room service was super fast and hot. The menu included haute cuisine as well as kids items. I have included a photo of the "pleasure package" including useful agave flavored items. The tv channel and movie selection was extensive and varied between kids options, cultural interests and current releases. Check in and out was exceptional. I booked for the wrong day and there was no hassel. My kid wanted the ukulele and the gift shop was closed. No problem, they got it for me while we got our bags. The breakfast in the restaurant was divine. The best cappacino I have ever had. My daughters French Toast was deeply flavorful, not just sweet. They rushed our service because we needed to make time to the airport. I mean, could they have done better? Not at all. OK wait. One thing. We stayed in room 1234 and there was some traffic noise. On the twelth floor it was pretty subdued but on a lower floor it could be annoying. I could hear it on a 4 out of 10 scale. Someone laid on the horn for 8 seconds and that was the exception of not annoying. If you are sensitive to traffic, ask for a high floor or just tell them; all evidence is that they'll stop traffic during your stay to make you comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Chill”
Reviews.Author: Cari2665
Reviews.Content: The Modern is the perfect hotel for hipsters and chillin in Honolulu. The rooms are super chic and clean (all white and with all the things you need) Boutique style and "Modern.." The staff is helpful and the location makes it easy to go anywhere. ( Walking/Bus/Cab) I loved the bar/restaurant and had a relaxing experience just sitting by the pool having breakfast. ( I also loved the Coconut Mojito's in the evening. There are a lot of "just ok" hotels that are expensive, and this is an amazing hotel for the price. I recommended it highly and I was there for business.. but it felt like a vacation!! P.S. Don't forget to sign up for Stash rewards (the hotel rewards program)

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern!”
Reviews.Author: Lyle G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for couples with no kids. This hotel is friendly for kids, however there is nothing for kids to do at the hotel. For couples it is the best. Very modern styling and the rooms are very comfortable. The hotel is located near the Ala moana mall and Hilton village. So there is lots of shopping within 10min walk. If you walk 20min you can go down towards Waikiki beach, thats where all the upper class and 4star restaurants and shopping is. This hotel has a morning room service and a afternoon "turn down" service which provides more towels, free ice and 2bottles of water. It is not located on the beach, however you can walk 5min down the street and go through the Hilton and the beach is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: VSchultz
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at The Modern Honolulu. I can honestly say it was one of the nicest hotels, and nicest experiences I've had staying in a hotel, in my life (rivaled only by the W in Westwood, Los Angeles). Modern Honolulu is a very chic hotel located two hotels down from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Modern doesn't have its own private beach, but you can walk next door and access the beach very easily. You might not want to very often, though, because the Modern's pool area is fabulous beyond belief. They have a salt water pool, gorgeous chaise lounges and couches and comfy beds, and yummy drinks; there's even an upper level adults-only pool area for folks who don't like the company of children (but there weren't many at the main pool area anyway). The food's pretty good for a poolside bar, too, and there was even live music (soft, romantic) on Sunday evening. The Modern serves free coffee (Kona, of course!) with organic milk every morning from 6:30 to 9:00 a.m. They valet park your car and bring it promptly when you ask for it. The room was on the smallish side, but it was very well appointed with its own balcony, comfy bed, nice desk and TV, safe, good closet, and beautiful bathroom. The room is a little noisy, but Honolulu is a big city so I expected that. The staff people at the Modern are very accommodating: they even bring ice to your room upon request! Room service was great, too. I highly recommend Modern Honolulu. I will definitely be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Modern Hotel Waikiki: Experience Excellence in Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected The Modern based on reading dozens of feedbacks and we were not disappointed. The staff are super attentive without being obtrusive and the room was clean and lived up to the hotel's moniker. We stayed in room 628, a city view room, from June 1st to June 7th 2012. There was some street noise and, on Friday and Saturday nights, noise from the bar downstairs until 3 am. But we kept the tv on to mask the noise and slept through most of it. Never heard anything from adjoining rooms other than some doors closing in the hallway. This hotel is best suited for couples. There were a few babies at the pool, but no adolescents, perfect for those wanting a quite place in the sun. The selection of background music was also done very well. A ten-minute walk will take you to Ala Moana Mall (west bound) or The Outrigger Hotel/Fort Derussy Park (east bound). We didn't rent a car because the $28/day parking more than doubled the cost and we preferred walking off the meals we had anyway. Call speedishuttle.com for transport to/from airport. Cost was $28 each way (for two) and they have a fleet of new Mercedes high-top vans.

Reviews.Title: “extravaganza !”
Reviews.Author: Nelson T
Reviews.Content: After a great cruise from Sydney,Australia we spent 4 nights at the Modern hotel, Honolulu with a great view to the Laguna outside the Hilton komplex. We were told that the hotel recently changed owner and name, which normally is a bit suspicious, but we can assure that this hotel is a bargain at the Waikiki beach. Quiet area for a rather big city, excellent service from a young and friendly staff at the desk, concierge with very professional help finding trips around the island. First time ever, free hotel postcard service world wide. Probably cost them peanuts compared to hotel rate, but great,unexpected service. Fine pools and top level service even there. Will highly recommend this hotel.Gourmet Japanese style restaurant in the building . This hotel is worth the price. For a couple it`s a 15 $ taxi from airport to hotel, less if you`re 3 or 4. We shall be back !! // J & H Christiansen, Sweden ;-D :-))

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: Lauren S
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Modern Honolulu was a joyous experience. Staff were friendly and helpful at the front desk & around the pool day & night. There were many "bits extra" to enhance the experience. For instance, the awesome saltwater pool and fitness center were open 24/7 & that was great for jet-lagged guests. The rooms were beautiful & yes, modern. We loved our roomy balcony, and there really was a good ocean view. We enjoyed eating breakfast by the pool - the Portuguese sweet bread French Toast was my favorite. Wall Street Journals and Honolulu newspapers were available each day, even for late sleepers. The pareo was a nice touch, as a bathrobe would be too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Victory!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnard
Reviews.Content: The Modern is the best hotel we have stayed during any time in Honolulu. Stay here once and you will never stay anywhere else in Honolulu. It's has great ambiance, it's sexy, relaxing and like the name says modern. The staff is incredible! My wife and I stayed here while house hunting. Incredibly the staff was able to walk a fine line and ensured we felt at home and yet like honored guests for our entire stay. The rooms are spacious, clean and elegant. The bathrooms are spacious with large spacious standing showers like those found in nice Vegas hotels. And you receive a complimentary turn down service daily after 5PM (re-made beds if needed, water, ice, towels, etc). Their Valet Staff was quick and adaptable. Even providing Valet service for our bikes. The bar and lounge area allows you forget your in Hawaii briefly. Within a few days, the lounge and bar staff knew us like we were regulars. Great bartenders, waitresses and lots of seating. The food was amazing. On the expensive side. But amazing. The pool area is a little bit Hawaii and a little bit cabana. Salt water pool with underwater sound. Two levels with two bars and towel stands. Try the coconut mojito...it will not disappoint. The hotel is right around the corner from the Waikiki activities...and yet once you are on the hotel grounds you feel a world away.

Reviews.Title: “trendy”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is trendy and attractive. It has the look and feel of an upscale Miami hotel, perhaps a bit out of place in Waikiki. The rooms are large and kept very clean. Bathroom was delightful, with a large shower with rain shower head and well-lit, beautiful vanity. Large TV. Balcony with ocean view was spectacular. Pools and bars by the pools are terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy”
Reviews.Author: ERIN F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sexy. For all of you from LA and the Beverly Hills lifestyle, this feels like the place to be or to be seen. The lobby, the Library (their lobby lounge) and the pool are not your typical Hawaii hotel. No real "aloha" feel, but the rooms have an ukulele and pareo's for your use, which was a fun touch. This hotel is for the young adult 25-45. This is not ocean front, but a quick 3-minute walk. Key feature is the proximity to Ala Moana shopping center. You have access to Waikiki, but are away from the hype of the "strip." Rooms are spacious. Bathrooms are nice. You will hear noise from the night club, but that's part of the fun. Request a high floor and facing diamond head. Views of the Hilton Hawaiian fireworks are every Friday night. Morimoto's = fantastic. It's always busy, so make a reservation. At the pool, order a blended mojito (their signature drink). I don't even like mojitos and I LOVED it! Service was decent. Price point for waikiki is reasonable. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed from the start.”
Reviews.Author: blaecpoodle
Reviews.Content: The Modern impressed me from check in. Check in was friendly and fast, the public areas like the rest of the hotel were spotless and the staff friendly and helpful without being obsequious. We had a sea view room which was neat and spacious. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, towels were changed everyday and on the second day, housekeeping realising that there were three of us staying in the room added more towels to make sure we had enough. The pool area was well set out and the adult only area is a great idea. I have to say as well, the food served was really good. We were a little sick of American food at this end of the trip and it was nice to see a few healthy options on the menu. We didn't use the spa as the price was well out of our range. Two pieces of feedback only - The pool food service is friendly and cheerful but they seem to run on island time, which normally we didn't mind but when you are in a hurry can be a little annoying. Also, the feedback re noise is a little spot on. It didn't worry us too much on the 12th floor but can I suggest some investment in double glazing. All in all though, a great hotel and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: 12welltraveled12
Reviews.Content: The only nice thing about this hotel were the furnishings in the room. My husband and I had booked four nights but only stayed one. The staff fails to mention that if you are on the first several floors of the hotel you will not be able to sleep because the bass and music from the Addiction Nightclub will keep you up. We called twice (between 2:30 and 3:00 AM) and the only response was, "Sorry. We know it's really loud. Do you want earplugs?" We were on the 4th floor and every word to every song was audible through the walls, not to mention the room was vibrating. We asked several times to speak to the manager to resolve the issue. The manager refused to address us directly and instead sent the lady at the desk running back and forth to relay information to us. When asked for some compensation for the lack of sleep (maybe 2-3 hours total) we were advised because we had no incidentals charged (i.e. did not spend extra money at the hotel) we could not be compensated for our trouble. The Modern is more concerned with the money they are bringing in at the nightclub and those "guests" than they are with the comfort of the guests staying at the hotel and who are seeking a good night's sleep. AVOID!!

Reviews.Title: “First impressions are lasting ones”
Reviews.Author: johnasli
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the deal the hotel gave me. Being in the military I was given an upgraded room,$50 food credit and free valet parking. The rooms are gorgeous if you like the modern look. Everything is neat, clean and has great lines. Nori motors restaurant is amazing and I expected nothing less from an iron chef restaurant. I had to wait a long time for lunch out by the pool but it was very good. Everything is expensive but that's normal for Waikiki. I'm Planning in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 415SF_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a night, as our house rental was not ready until the following day. This place is very clean, the staff was great and super helpful. Prior to check-in we called to inquire about other room options. When we arrived, reception remembered we called and was very welcoming. The next morning, the car valet was very helpful with giving us directions. Reception was again very helpful with our need for a late check-out. As for cleanliness, this place was above 5 star clean...so clean that I embarrassingly and accidentally ran into the window to the balcony. It was a good laugh but describes how clean it is. If ever in the area, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Chic - Ultra GREAT”
Reviews.Author: GuyinSF
Reviews.Content: I had an awesome stay at the Modern. I booked this hotel on Priceline via their Bid process. I typically stay in Marriotts or Hyatts. I was crossing my fingers as I approached the property and I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was inviting; checkin was very quick. I had a King room with a great view from the balcony. The room was clean and very spacious. I was able to relax and never heard anything outside of my room. The staff was very friendly and approachable. I definitely recommend this place and will stay here again when in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel a lot but would have liked it to be a little closer to shopping and beaches.”
Reviews.Author: eric323
Reviews.Content: This hotel features modern decor, beautifully appointed bedrooms and baths. Our room overlooked the marina. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very nice pool area but outrageously expensive to reserve a poolside bed. This hotel is too far away to walk to international market. Overall a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms in a Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pink7oreo
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Modern as a stop over in Honolulu so I can't say as much for those guests who are planning to stay for the whole duration of their vacation. The rooms are very modern and up-to-date which we really appreciated. We had a corner city view room which was great for us as we weren't looking for anything spectacular. I would suggest to try and get a room at a higher level as the club is very close and the music is booming. We enjoyed Morimoto's Restaurant downstairs :) The only downside is that the hotel does not have it's own beach, but it isn't far from the Ala Moana beach park.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour.......avoid”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Jasper
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the nice pictures and descriptions. This is the worst hotel I have had the misfortune to stay in. My room was above an in-house nightclub which stays open and kept me awake until almost sun up, if you have a family don't even consider, my 2 year old wasn't allowed in the level 2 1 foot deep pool as it is apparently "adults only" even though there were no adults to be seen as the pool bar is down on level 1. On day 5 when I had had enough and arranged moving hotels the management was ok with that and told me that I could have a refund for the last 2 nights I had paid for, when I get back to Australia they had changed their minds and told me there was nothing I could do now I was in Australia. Stay here at your peril. They are a disgrace. 1 star is too many.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Decor, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Peachtreec
Reviews.Content: Many hotels in Honolulu have a worn down feeling, down from its peak from the 70s. While this hotel was a revamp of an existing building, they did extremely well in modernizing it. Nothing makes a hotel worse for me than cheap fixtures and hacks (dingy yellow ceiling lamps, crappy elevator buttons which are chipped away, cheapo bathroom sinks, leftover tiles and crappy shower curtain for a bathtub), and this hotel has done above and beyond to make it new and fresh. Rooms are clean, fresh including the bathroom and shared areas such as the hallways and lobby. The elevators were a bit slow at times even though there were I believe 3 or 4 of them, but then again that's just how it is in some hotels. The breakfast was quite pricey, I believe roughly $30 for the main set, but there are many places nearby in walking distance for other options. We would 100% stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Days at Modern Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: mkskDC
Reviews.Content: The Modern is a trendy looking hotel in a quiet location in Honolulu. It takes about a 10-15 minute walk to get to Waikiki beach and some of the restaurants and shops nearby. This didn't bother me too much as I used the hotel primarily for sleep and drove around the entire island during my stay in Oahu. The white on white look can look a little psychward-esque in some hotels but the Modern has a slightly refined style that makes the public areas and the rooms look sophisticated. I used the gym quite a bit during my stay and was pleased that no one else seemed to be in there when I was using it. The gym has a few treadmills and ellipticals, a weight rack with dumbbells (50lb. max) and a weight tower with various attachments. The pool and pooldeck were nice. It reminded me of being in the Hamptons. Uptempo music is played on speakers which gives the pool and bar area a nice vibe. Service at the pool though is lacking. It takes forever to get a drink and the pool attendant doesn't hustle to clean up used chaise lounges or get fresh towels. The valets out front deserve special recognition. I saw them sprint to get my rental car quite a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Newer/Clean/Trendy; A Bit Roucous At Night, Challenge to Valet”
Reviews.Author: Rock-Subculture
Reviews.Content: This is one in a series of seven reviews for seven hotels and resorts I stayed at during a recent trip to Hawaii (Maui and Oahu) in the month of May 2012. This is part of a continuing series of my impressions and experiences staying at various hotels and resorts while traveling to attend concerts worldwide. This review is for The Modern in Hololulu, Oahu, Hawaii. I have additional photos on my site. Property: The Modern Honolulu Location: Honolulu, Oahu (Hawaii) Address: 1775 Ala Moana Boulevard, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815 Phone: (808) 970-4161 Website: www.themodernhonolulu.com Room Type/Class: 3 – Ocean View (Room 816) Date: May 19-20, 2012 TripAdvisor Page/Reviews: LINK Booking Source: Direct Overall Rating: 3.75/5 [Note: Score is totally subjective based on price, location, and comparison to "like" properties within same area and price range] I choose The Modern Honolulu in searching for a property for a one night stay in the Honolulu/Waikiki area, and chose this resort based on TripAdvisor reviews. This was my first visit to Honolulu, so do not have any competing properties with which to compare. The Modern has a well-staffed valet service, but the drive up to the property can be problematic, depending on the time of day and traffic. If approaching from the opposing side of the street, I found that other drivers can easily block entry into the drive up area, leaving you stranding and blocking traffic for five minutes or more (there is no center turning lane, so you are literally blocking the fast lane on the street). It’s not so much attributable to lack of space, but lack of management. This was especially problematic at night, due to non-guests visiting their nightclub. So depending on your arrival and how backed up their valet is, this can lead to a negative/frustrated first impression, as you are left waiting in the street with your turn signal on for up to ten minutes, and when you finally have space to pull in, and there is room for many cars, you are left wondering who is in charge of the mess. The Modern lives up to its name, as it is very trendy, hip, and contemporary in appearance in the lobby and rooms. Check-in was fairly smooth; the room I had booked was not ready, so I opted to accept a lesser room in order to not have to wait for the one that was apparently in a better location. This is one of those hotels where you need to use your room key to activate the elevator; I suspect this is in part due to the aforementioned nightclub and flood of young/immature people that populate the common areas at night. The room itself is very clean and neat, with modern-style decor and appointments (kind of like an Ikea showcase). Not large, but certainly big enough for one or two people. In addition to the bed is a (very) small desk and lounge. I hard a challenging time finding outlets for electronic devices, and finally figured out that there were a few along the side of the desk. The room included a balcony with chairs and a small table, with a view of a marina off to the side. This room faced out the front of the hotel, and I found that it was a very noisy street below, in terms of traffic as well as noise from people (especially at night), even from the 8th floor. The resort features a really nice outdoor pool (with beach-like sand) with a full bar. Overall, the property skews very young, hip, and, for lack of a better term, “attractive”. Seems like everyone staying there must be supermodels and the like, so if you are the type who might be self conscious about that sort of thing, that is the sort of atmosphere I had found during my short stay. It definitely did not come across to me as family friendly at all, especially at night. It is a great hotel if you are young and looking for a place with nightlife and the like; if you are not, you might be annoyed by that sort of thing going on in and around the resort. It would seem that the former is the sort of clientele that they are cultivating. It is also not very close to what some would call “the action” in and around Waikiki – you really need to get in your car or a taxi to local attractions. They also charge $28/night for valet parking, which seems like a lot since incoming traffic is not really managed at all, leaving you waiting in the street for up to ten minutes just to pull up to the lobby area of the hotel. I would probably not stay here again, but don’t say that as a non-recommendation, just that I had no interest in that sort of scene even when I was younger, so just not my kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGe1775
Reviews.Content: I travel to Honolulu a lot for work (tough, I know) and The Modern Honolulu is my favorite place to stay by far. It has a great location that's close to the heart of Waikiki, but a bit on the fringes, which means it's easy to hop on the Nimitz Highway and avoid the Waikiki traffic. The staff are amongst the friendliest and helpful I've seen in Hawaii. Truly top notch. I especially like the folks in the Lobby Bar, the front desk, and the valets, who always greet you with a smile. The rooms have a great clean and modern aesthetic (pardon the pun) that doesn't feel dated like so many others in Waikiki. My only criticism is that service at the Sunset Pool is definitely on Hawaii time, so not the best choice if you're really hungry. I've waited 45+ minutes to get food more than a few times, but it is a great space to relax if you're not in a hurry and the staff here are are super friendly as well, even if they can be tough to wave down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: C0wt0wngirl
Reviews.Content: What beautiful rooms! We faced the apartment buildings, but what a beautiful view of the sunset every night and the wharf to greet us in the morning. (14th floor) We had a beautiful view of the ocean from our room. Night time was really quiet. Room service was rather expensive. $25 for a basic 3 egg/bacon/toast breakfast for one person. I just popped over to the ABC store across the street and they had an amazing little deli there. The staff were wonderful to us. The rooms are white but with just enough wood accents to make it an elegant room. Very roomy. At night we would sit on the lounge chairs at the pool and just soak in the beauty of the stars and the lights throughout the pool area. During the day the pool area was very quiet and relaxing. You are steps away from the beach. The Hilton hotel has adorable shops. We loved the live acoustic groups at the Hawiian Village that would begin playing around 5pm. The Hawaiin Village is right after you walk around the lagoon to get to the Hilton. There is one group called Johnny Pirahna and they played 70's and 80's music on Wed. or Thursdays. People were standing all over the place listening to them. We had such a good time. The mall isn't too far; a 7 minute walk. Just walk across the street to the ABC and stay on that same side of the street and walk towards the mall. Duke's is a good restaraunt which is on the beach and the staff is very friendly. They also had great music at night. We went to a great Seafood Buffet. It is almost at the opposite end of the beach by the Pacific Beach Hotel. There is a two story aquarium in the restaraunt and at 10pm a scuba diver and a women dressed in a mermaid outfit popped into the tank and fed the fish. The buffet is huge; seafood, beef, pork, salads and tasty desserts. You must go to Haunama Beach but it closes at 7pm. Very beautiful. Great snorkelling. Waimea Valley is a beautiful place to go to, but it's at the North Shore. The North Shore is green, lush with many awesome beaches to snorkel. Sharks Cove was awesome to snorkel. You must buy the banana bread that is sold as numerous roadside stalls. So good! ! Pearl Harbour is amazing. Take lots of water and a hat. We will definitely stay at the Modern again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penny6123
Reviews.Content: Excellent room - clean, spacious, comfortable, although it was noisy when the nightclub was open. The conceirge was very pleasant and helpful - she booked tickets for Pearl Harbour and arranged transport for us. Very good location as only a short walk to Waikiki beach. Free coffee supplied in the lounge area first thing in a morning, but you have to get there quick and we werent told about it on arrival. No coffee/tea facilities in the room but the fridge was useful for cold drinks. Little bit disappointed by the pool bar area as it was looking a bit jaded and the bar staff didnt seem to wipe down the tables when clearing.

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy hotel !”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Modern on our last weekend in Waikiki and loved it! Definately one of the most current hotels in the area catering to an urban customer! The service was excellent and we manged to get a great upgrade at a reasonable price last minute! This is a great place for couples including same sex!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, will go back again”
Reviews.Author: aja2010
Reviews.Content: If you prefer a clean, modern and trendy esthetics, you will like this hotel. We really enjoyed our stay. The room itself isn’t super fancy, but is serene and comfortable. The pools and outdoor bar are lovely, reminiscence of a spa. The staffs were all very friendly. The best part for us is that the Modern seems to be tailored to couples. We never saw any kids running around screaming in the pool area. The hotel is located on a busy street, but we actually like the fact that it isn’t dead quite at night. You are walking distance to Ala Moana mall, and many familiar restaurants (e.g. iHop, Red Lobster, McDonald’s and ABC supermarket). Check out the Wailana Coffee House down the street, it’s like Hawaii’s version of iHop. Our meal at the Morimoto restaurant inside the Modern was also fantastic. Finally, many thanks to Russell, at the front desk, who got us a fantastic room with an amazing view. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A good quiet property away from the masses on Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Ala Moana, great pools and good service at poolside. Great casual young staff. Very quiet rooms and great bathrooms. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good but still disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November and were hoping for a lot. We booked before the management "reshuffle" but our reservations were honoured. Unfortunately our "ocean view" room wasn't. it looked towards the adjacent hotel, and you needed to be on the balcony looking sideways to see the ocean. In my opinion this is just plain dishonest, and a laugh and a smile from desk staff is really not a valid response. There was a conference on while we were there, and only conference visitors could use the restaurant for breakfast. We felt like second class citizens. And the "showpiece" restaurant was closed during our visit for dinners. This hotel could be fantastic, and maybe is picking up now, but we were pretty unhappy. The negatives overshadowed the positives, but the room was nice, if a bit small, and the location was better than we expected as we could walk easily to Ala Moana and to Waikiki. We wouldn't go back though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: dee k
Reviews.Content: the hotel is all it promises to be...great rooms, good views, amazing restaurants. Its modern in every way. The staff is friendly and helpful, concierge is good but not as great as the other hotels. The best part are the 2 pools...especially the salt water pool with a great poolside bar.

Reviews.Title: “Lasting Impression of Hip, Stylish, boutique hotel for the fraction of the price. I will come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Clarissa M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on vacation to celebrate our anniversary. From the several times we've been to Hawaii, this has been the best visit we've had and I believe it has a lot to do with the "home" we made ourselves at The Modern Honolulu during our stay. The staff was always friendly, ready with a smile, (even if we had a late check-in, at almost midnight, they were ready with an ice-cold bottled water and wet towels to refresh us, while someone goes upstairs to our room to do a quick last check if our room is ready! we were blown away with the first impression!--- not to mention, whatever makes their lobby smelling oh-so-good, someone please bottle it up so I can take it with me and spray it in my own house!) the valets are just always helpful, the place so "homey" cozy, with a "hip", luxurious feel--- hello, "W hotel" for the fraction of a price! A lot of our friends (including a family member who is a Hawaii local) say they've heard from us the best deal that one could ever find in Oahu---my cousin and friends who live locally were amazed at what a great deal we got, apparently The Modern Honolulu as a pretty good reputation among the locals too!) We would come back here over and over again and not only that, we would recommend to ALL our families and friends that if they want a "REAL" relaxing, pampered vacation, away from too much crowds on other Waikiki resorts yet with quick access (a short walk to Waikiki Beach, hello, shopping! --at the Ala Moana Shopping Center), The Modern Honolulu is the place to be. My husband and I are looking forward to many more anniversary celebrations there when we visit Oahu. Thank you and please keep up the good job!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylishly modern, very comfortable, & just plain nice”
Reviews.Author: UptownDave
Reviews.Content: Our 6-night stay 14-21 Apr: I'll start with the fact that I've been to Honolulu, as well greater Oahu and all of the outer islands, many times. Having stayed in and seen many kinds of hotels and accommodations, including both of the venerable old Waikiki classics, I have to say The Modern Honolulu is my favorite. I acknowledge that, while it is not located on the central beach or in the middle of the Waikiki action--it's on the Ala Wai yacht harbor--it is close enough to walk to everything, including Ala Moana Beach Park & Magic Island, the Ala Moana Shopping Center, and central Waikiki. The hotel's location is a plus for me; it is quieter and easier to navigate by car than its counterparts in the middle of Waikiki. The hotel itself: beautifully and whimsically modern. The room is generously sized, with a king bed and a day bed and plenty of room to walk around and to stow belongings. The bed, linens, and towels are plush and comfortable. The bathroom is sleek and modern with an outstanding glass-and-tile shower. Additionally, toiletries & amenities are plentiful and high quality. The balcony is large and bowed, affording views in multiple directions--and, no, I did not have a full ocean or harbor view. Nonetheless, it was a sensational view and a great place to linger for a few moments when I wasn't busy doing all of the other fun things that Oahu offers. The room was exceptionally clean and included all the essentials--a fridge, which can be stocked as a mini-bar if desired, a safe, an iron & board, free Wi-Fi, and plenty of outlets for plugging in and recharging electronic gadgets. The pools are elegant and visually stunning and great places to relax and just hang out. The poolside attendants are just that: attentive. I felt pampered in the little bits of time I spent there. The staff, from the front desk staff, to the attendant who brought ice to the room upon request, to the housekeeping staff could not have been more pleasant or more attuned to fine and unobtrusive service! My stay and experience at The Modern, from service to accommodations, was very similar to a higher-end cruise I recently took. I was very positively impressed. I would definitely stay at The Modern again! By the way, I shop carefully for good deals when I travel, and I got a good deal here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on Waikiki Beach”
Reviews.Author: ocp100
Reviews.Content: Loved the trendiness of the hotel: a bookshelf in the lobby moves in the evening to uncover a bar, great pool (too bad we only had 2 nights on Oahu!), and very hip rooms (you can even plug in your I-phone in their speakers dock in your room!). Service was excellent. We were particularly impressed by the concierge, who not only helped us with planning our tour of East Oahu for the next day, but printed and delivered to our room a full package with directions, maps, and recommendations on what to do (both attractions and restaurants on the way).

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great hotel and exceedingly good value”
Reviews.Author: FoodieTraveler123
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Priceline and I was a little skeptical about how nice it would be after reading mixed reviews. It turned out to be perfect! I was attending a conference so the location was great because I could walk. There were a lot of nice little perks that I didn't expect like turn down maid service and complimentary coffee at the coffee bar in the morning. The maid cleaned our room and then refreshed everything in the evening. The staff at the pool and bars were so nice and helpful. Gabrielle at the front desk was great too, she helped get us switched to a room that was further away from the club. That was my only complaint - rooms on the third floor above the club should be for deaf people and 20 something partiers who won't be on bed before 3 am anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice vibe”
Reviews.Author: peggy2357
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel and would have given it 5 stars if not for how noisy it was. Part of the problem is that I had a corner room facing the street. If at all possible get a room in the back, overlooking the yacht club. I loved the all white decor, it was soothing and the lobby was really comfortable with private nooks to sit and enjoy a drink. I also loved the fact that they have 2 pools, and 1 is adult only. That was great. They also have a cool outside bar. The staff and valets are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Happy T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in an Ocean View Suite and it was money well spent. The room was lovely and clean and the facilities were excellent. From previous reviews I was a little worried about noise however didn't experience any problems during our 6 day stay. The pool was a great place to relax during the day, and the bar was the perfect place to have a few drinks in the evening. We loved the live music at the poolside bar - the singers were fantastic. Initially we were a little concerned about the location however the hotel turned out to be relatlively central. The Ala Moana Shopping Centre is a five minute walk down the road and although its a 15 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki, its an enjoyable one. There is also good access to the Hilton lagoon. We would definately recommend dining at Morimoto - a Japanese restaurant located in the Modern. Some of the best Japanese food we have had in a while. Also, the Lobby Bar is a great place to have a few drinks on a Saturday night. During our stay, we also spent a few days at the Sheraton Waikiki. In comparison, the Sheraton is definately more of a family resort, whereas the Modern is a funky hotel, that is less chaotic. If you are looking for a hotel that is young, fun and trendy we definately recommend the Modern Honululu.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: Keep_Wethering
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Modern for our first 3 days in Oahu, the hotel has been recently remodeled and looks "Modern", we upgraded to an oceanview suite and the view (even if partial) was to die for. Service was great around the clock: reception, concierge, housekeeping and valet (no ice machines anywhere in the hotel though). We picked the modern since it has a club within the same building but unfortunately we did not have a chance to go there since we were too tired from going around all day. Overall we had a great stay but honestly I would not recommend it, unless you know exactly what you are getting into, we did not, and ended up driving and parking near Waikiki beach where the action is almost every day (a 20 minutes walk if you prefer walking). Next time in Oahu we will likely get a place closer to the action, great hotel nonetheless and no resort fees!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel - 1 star service”
Reviews.Author: SiobhanNewton
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 1 week stay at the Modern in Honolulu which is esthetically a lovely place to stay but the service was beyond disappointing and severely below average reasonable standards for a US hotel. We slept in a room for 2 nights where staff didn't take much interest in ensuring that our window could lock - even after a cranky employee from maintenance assured us it was fixed when he stood there as we tried to force it shut all the while saying it was ok. The safe in our room containing wallets, passports, mobiles and jewellery simply ceased working and it took staff an extensive amount of time to try and open it - all the while having to wait in the room until the issue was fixed, unable to get out and go to the beach or shop. There are no kettles in the room so you can't make tea or coffee. Ordering boiling water and mugs from room service took 1 and a 1/4 hours one night - and when we wanted clean wine glasses, it took 3 calls to reception before they were even brought up. Housekeeping doesn't service the rooms until late in the afternoon - at least they didn't for most of the days we were there. The staff are very keen to push drinks on you whilst at the pool at all times of the day - probably because they want the tips but I wouldn't recommend eating breakfast at the hotel - it is expensive and the wait staff were generally appalling. We had one lovely waiter on our last day who was exceptional, but the day before he was hopeless. This hotel lacks consistency in every regard. Management take no interest in how happy their guests are - I spoke with the duty manager one day who assured us everything would be fixed and it wasn't. The staff at the front desk are generally pleasant - with the exception of one girl whose behaviour towards paying guests was unprofessional, rude and simply lacking maturity. If you choose to stay at this hotel, my recommendation would be to have few expectations and don't spend the majority of your time there - get out and enjoy the beautiful city and beach and shopping. Honolulu is a marvelous place but this hotel will disappoint. I will not be returning to the Modern and will be recommending to anyone who asks about this hotel to give it a miss . I have 2 family members who have trips planned to Honolulu later this year - I can ssure you they won't be staying there either.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Two issues. Our room was really loud with outside traffic noise. Would like to be able to get our own ice. We had to wait up to half hour for ice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: PiratesSayARRR
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 4 nights in April while attending a conference at the Hawaii Convention Center. I really liked the feel of the hotel as it was boutique and not an overgrown monstrosity like the HHV. The room was fantastic, a comfortable bed and wonderful glass enclosed shower. The pool area is awesome with teak decking and furniture and a warm pool with speakers under water. The waitresses are also very attentive. I had both lunch and breakfast around the pool and it was very good. The bar area downstairs opens in the evening and is a nice place to unwind. I will add that it gets very busy Thursday - Saturday around 10pm because of the nightclub on property. I visited the nightclub on Saturday evening, it was a small club that got very hot very quickly as the air conditioning was no working.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Luxury”
Reviews.Author: MollyMcMillen
Reviews.Content: My daughter was competing in a surf contest at Ala Moana Bowls in Honolulu. I selected the Modern Hotel as It was nearest to the surf break. It is rated a 4.5 star hotel so I was not sure how the staff would feel about my 13 year old daughter walking around with a surfboard and bikini clad but the staff was great. We stayed in an ocean view suite overlooking the Ala Moana harbor. The room was done in all shades of white with colorful accents, it kind of reminded me of a villa in Greece. There were two rooms and a bathroom all decked out in beautiful linens, big screen TV's in the sitting room as well as the bedroom and two balconies. The pillows and quilt were made of feathers which I love but my daughter is very allergic, so we called the front desk and they switched out the feather items, asap. I cannot say enough about the staff, they knew our names, they were excited about my daughters competition and asked her for daily updates, which made her feel very important, they happily held her longboard at bell desk. Her shortboards were transported to the room on the 15th floor without even a blink of the eye. Everybody was very welcoming and epitomized the laid back luxury feel. We dined at Iron Chef Morimoto's for lunch the first day there and it was beyond delicious, a must when visiting Honolulu. We also went to the pool bar at sunset, there was pleasant live music and the Maitai was perfect. The crowd was 30 to 40 and chic but casual. We loved this place and will only stay at the Modern when visiting Oahu's South Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: xerexes
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Modern Hotel. I fully agree with the other positive reviews. The hotel lives up to its name: it's modern and new. The hotel staff were friendly, and went above and beyond the usual customer service to make guests feel both comfortable and welcome. I stayed in a city view room, king suite on the 12th floor. I had a view of the city, the water (marina and beach) as well as the mountains. The room is more than ample, and I loved the walk in shower, large balcony and the comfortable chaise lounge! The teak louvered sliding door was wonderful to keep the sun out, provide privacy and let the natural breeze cool the room while leaving the balcony door open. Free wifi was a wonderful bonus. The tv was massive with a standard cable selection. The pool area was spacious, with lots of lounge chairs and covered areas (trees and umbrellas for shade). The pool deck is wooden which adds to the stylish look. The pool is heated and open 24 hours. The second pool is a bit of a misnomer - I wouldn't call it a wade pool, more of a reflective surface, but the area is fantastic with palm trees, sand, lounge chairs and hammocks. I only ate at the hotel (lunch) once, and that was by the pool area. The prices are pretty standard for the food in comparison to the other hotels in the area. The meal was excellent, so no complaints. However, you are within walking distance of plenty of cheaper food options: the food court in the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and the Royal Hawaiian offer excellent choices and there are lots of other restaurants in all price ranges. I ended up eating breakfast at the McDonalds on the corner and using their free wifi as well. Across from the McDonalds is one of the many ABC stores, where you can pick up ready made meals, drinks and snacks with which you can stock the bar fridge in your room - all of the Waikiki hotels seem to allow this. I'm not much of a drinker, so I didn't try out the very cool hotel bar, but the drinks I saw were very generous. I was a bit concerned about the location when I booked, but that was really of no concern. You are less than a 7 minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, and a 20 minute walk to the main drag in Waikiki. You can either walk along the main road or walk along the beach. This is the first time I didn't even bother to swim in the ocean - I just loved hanging out and using the pool! As others have mentioned, this is a chic, boutique hotel but it's not pretentious in any way and people of all ages and backgrounds were staying there. The only downside was that they ran out of the free iPads while I was there. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: poodlenyc
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night stay at the Modern Honolulu and loved it. This boutique hotel is everything you can ask for -- great service, extremely clean, great location, great vibe and very chic. The room are spacious and the kept very well. The pool area is also great and has a trendy vibe. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Really Recommend”
Reviews.Author: cruisequeen15
Reviews.Content: From arriving at the door of hotel we were greeted with such warmth, then on checking in were given a nice cold welcome drink and a face towel, which after a 10 hr flightwas very welcome. Our room service was outstanding, they even came in the evening and tidied up then left complimentary bottled water. The free wifi was also a treat. Would stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Modern”
Reviews.Author: Scifibiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Modern, as it was very close to a half marathon that we were participation in. I was pleasantly surprised at how great this hotel is. From the front desk to the pool area, just perfect. They really make you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Stefaniaglamour
Reviews.Content: The Modern Honolulu is the place to be. It s outside the Waikiki s confusion, close to the Hawaiian Village. The other hotels are very turisic, The Modern is different: elegant, new, fresh style, middle age target, clean. Excellent Morimoto restaurant. Trendy Addiction Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Lizard7275
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel trying to avoid the massive hotels in the area and were not disappointed. The rooms are bright,comfortable and stylish. The rest of the hotel too. Although not on the beach, you get there in just a short, nice walk and can opt to skip the noisy crowd and stay by the pleasant pool area. Good service and nice but pricey food. Only brownie point:a cockroach by the pool area that was swiftly removed upon request

Reviews.Title: “Need Staff Training”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was large, the ocean view was lovely and we loved being away from the chaos of Waikiki. You are close enough to walk but not staying in it. The only issue we had was getting three different answers to a question when talking to the staff. We wanted to ship a box via UPS or FedEx home. One staff member told us to go to the hotel next door, the other told us we would need to find a local UPS or FedEx office and the third said the hotel could do it. The staff were very nice and tried to be helpful, but they need to know what services the hotel has to offer. We would be willing to give them another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Urban, sleek, sexy, and fun”
Reviews.Author: TThax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Only one issue....we had what we believe were ants in our room. However, they moved us to the same style of room with our beautiful view immediately. The hotel is centrally located by great shopping and places to eat. The public trolley ($2 a ride) really helped us out since cabs were pretty pricey. Russell our wonderful front desk person is definitely delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...(except)”
Reviews.Author: Ankur T
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way except the concierge service of one concierge named Yuki. Everything about this hotel was modern. The pool area is great! Just 2 minutes from the pool is a ramp to the beach... I would have given 5 stars ...but for the concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastcopper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Modern during the first week of April. The hotel was recommended to us by a friend who went in January. The best part about the hotel is its location. Away from the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki Beach hotels and their overcrowded pools and beaches but easily within walking distance (15 minutes). The rooms are very nice. We saw other reviews about the noise from the nightclub. We requested a room on the upper floors. We were on the 16th (of 17) floors. We didn't hear a thing from the nightclub...just the ringing of the trolley bells, which was not a problem. Our room overlooked the pool. What a great view of the pool, the marina, and the ocean. The room was was neat and clean with twice a day servicing. However, the carpeting wasn't done very well. You could see that the carpet was just laid down and not properly nailed around the edges. But the best part of the room was the bedding. WOW!....the bed was soooo comfortable and the sheets and pillows are made by Frette, which is great brand. Very nice! The pool staff greet you and take you with towels and chair covers to the pool deck. As people leave, they clean up the towels and set everything back up for the next people. So there is no need to come down at 7am and save chairs. I would say that while the hotel might be family friendly, the pool area is not meant for rambunctious kids. There were some young kids running around and that was quite annoying. Staff were pretty good about warning them. The vast majority of the people at the pool were adults; there to relax, get some sun and read. The pool is a mix of salt water and chlorine. The temperature was perfect. Friends of our who were staying at the Moana Surfrider came by were jealous of the pool area. The pool menu is very good. They changed the drink and food menu while we were there, so I assume they're good about mixing up their menu's on a regular basis. The food and drinks aren't cheap, but they're in line with typical hotel pricing. Staff were always good about seeing if you wanted more to drink or eat. And if not, they would top up your water. Also, each afternoon they come around with complimentary sorbet. We never ate at Morimoto's. Our friends who recommended the hotel ate there and said not to waste our money. Too much money for too little food. Overall we recommend the Modern. It exceeded our expectations by a long shot. Don't be swayed by the negative reviews. I think they were unfortunate to be there when the hotel ownership changed hands. Whatever issues existed then, they have overcome and are no longer problems.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: harry036
Reviews.Content: This was not our first trip to Hawaii but it was our first stay at The Modern and it was great. The location was the reason for deciding on this hotel. The pictures on the website promised that the hotel would not be like most of the others along the beach. After previous visits to Waikiki we knew that the area seems to be in a time warp and the hotels generally reflect this. Not so with The Modern. It is far enough away from the noise of the main strip but still close enough if you want to walk to be part of it. It has a different feel to other hotels in the area. When you walk into the lobby it looks very minimalist - however the rooms are anything but. They have a 5 star feel to them - furnishings, linen and toiletries are top class. The pool area is the real stand out - a swanky resort style pool - not large - but then there seem to be no large pools in this area where real estate is precious. The pool has lots of day beds and chairs on the main level and there is a second pool tucked away on an upper level for adults. The signature restaurant - Morimoto is superb. The best Japanese food I have ever tasted. Very interesting presentations of traditional dishes and unbelievably fresh products. The added bonus to this hotel is that you can walk down the road to Ala Moana shopping centre - it is less than 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Heather L
Reviews.Content: The modern lives up to its name, very chic style and design, great tunes, outstanding value for your money. The staff are incredibly well mannered and knowledgable, the hotel is perfectly situated just outside of all the hubbub, but close enough to walk to. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Henryblackman
Reviews.Content: A wonderfull hotel, beautifully design and very comfortable. Not too busy and far enough away from the busy section of Waikiki. Just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place!”
Reviews.Author: Berkdizzle
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an amazing place! By far the best place to stay in Honolulu. We stayed for four nights and it was the best vacation in Hawaii we've had. Great service, gourmet cuisine, gorgeous vistas and inspired amenities.There is nothing like this place anywhere in Honolulu. The Modern Honolulu has a great sense of simple yet elegant style throughout. You will be very happy you stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MrsT31
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,modern facilities located away from the busier part of the tourist belt. Good sized rooms,4 of us were quite comfortable in one room with 2 double beds. Was a little noisy on 2 of the 3 nights we stayed there with music coming from the bar/ club downstairs(?). Otherwise it was great.

Reviews.Title: “wedding night stay”
Reviews.Author: Imac16
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience in only one night. Was our wedding night. Ate at the morimoto iron chef restaurant. Fannnntastic. Was given a front table overlooking the harbor as an example of the extra special treatment we experienced at the Modern Honolulu. If you can afford to splurge a bit i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Easter week”
Reviews.Author: Claude C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great vacation in Honolulu. The Modern is a great hotel with reasonable rates. The rooms are spacious and very modern. the people are very friendly and helpful. Staff was awesome. The only downside is that it is located on the West end of Waikikik. I did not mind because it was a little quieter and less commercial. Car rental is right across the street and the Mall is a 15 min walk. If you are staying there there is a McDonalds on the corner but we stck to the mall which had a great selection if you are eating on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: The Modern is true value for money, the staff are exceptionally fantastic and facilities awesome. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginger y
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Modern Honolulu. Excellent service and great food. Would recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, my wife and I stayed there for 6 nights. Everything was perfect with friendly helpful staff, great location, very modern clean room and great value for money. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: syh927
Reviews.Content: Wonderful & beautiful hotel. Would definitely recommend my friends to stay there. The decor, ambiance and service was amazing. We were here for a wedding and had 3 girls staying in one room. Needless to say, our room was definitely a mess every time we left for an event! But it was always so meticulously cleaned when we got back with water bottles and turn down service each time. The pool is also awesome - delicious drinks and a very attentive staff. The only downside to the hotel is that it's a bit of a walk from downtown Waikiki. Probably about a 15 min walk along the beach from the center - it's definitely not that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....... for adults”
Reviews.Author: lotsobiztravel
Reviews.Content: If you have small children I would not recommend this hotel as it gets very busy with the Club scene later at night - however, I would recommend to almost everyone else. VERY clean and during the day it is super quiet. The pools are tranquil and the staff is professional and friendly. All we did in the evening was walk through he lobby, and yes there were alot of young adults hanging around - but it was not rowdy or anything. It is actually a very very nice hotel in a location where you can walk to almost anything in Waikiki (restaurants/shopping). I was there on biz, so didn't play much but when I wanted a drink - the pool bar was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Geenadistefano
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks in Honolulu and moved from Sheraton to Modern Honolulu. What a difference!! This hotel is exceptional. Chic, modern, boutique and oozes style. If you want value for money, and enjoy quality, clean and comfortable rooms this is the place. After spending 11 days at this hotel, I cannot stress how wonderful the staff and personal service has been. Ashley has to be the best pool attendant ever, she made our stay relaxing offering us the best attention!! Thank you Ashley. But to all the staff at the modern we really thank you for your service and commitment and can't wait to come back to tell our friends in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigel L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last 3 days of our honeymoon before heading back to Australia. What a brilliant hotel. The facilities are excellent, the rooms really well equipped and the ocean views stunning (we had an ocean view room). The staff were fantastic, the concierge really helpful and the pool staff very accommodating. If we came back to Hawaii, we would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love”
Reviews.Author: Nejka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days of our honeymoon in the Modern! This was the best hotel we stayed in for sure! I can't understand how some people can complain, seriously! Probably old people, definitely better for younger couples and singles I would say. We were on the 14th Floor, ocean views. Amazing! We are both surfers and a surf break is in front of the hotel. We actually really loved the fact that it's a bit out of the main Waikiki madness but still close enough to walk there. The pool area is very nice, renminds me on Europe with trees and lights.. The place get awesome sunsets too. There is a club that goes off from Thuesday on and really good restaurant too. But it's all about style in the Modern. The roomgs are all white, just different to other dated crap you see in Hawaii. And staffwe thought was fantastic! Really helpful. All in all 10/10 for us.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning & Faultless”
Reviews.Author: mooeey
Reviews.Content: Omg.... We died & went to heaven staying here. Having just checked out of a large chain hotel in downtown Waikiki I was seriously ready to depart HNL never to return. Thank goodness we found The Modern. Absolutely everything was perfect! I cannot comment highly enough on all the staffs attentiveness to detail & the hospitality which was bestowed upon us during our stay. Rooms & amenities, amazing! Pool, staff, cocktails, menu selection, happy hour...all was magnificent! We ate at Morimoto's - wow too! I'm reluctant to rave on to much more as I fear this hotel will be inundated but they absolutely deserve all my accolades . Don't change a thing guys...you have it all sorted perfectly! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “You can't do better in Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: silvertraveler2008
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at The Modern Honolulu for 5 nights in late March; he was there for business, and I just tagged along. If you are going to be in Honolulu for an extended period of time, and you want to spend time relaxing at the pool, and being close to Waikiki (but not IN the madness of it), stay here!! Someone commented that it's very similar to the W hotel chain. I agree, but I think it's even better. The front desk staff, the valet guys, the pool staff...everyone was super friendly and accommodating. The pool itself is beautiful and really nice to sit and relax around during the day. Also, at night they have live music and a great happy hour menu to peruse while you're watching the sunset. You're also a short walk from the heart of Waikiki beach, and all the shops up and down the strip. Morimoto is delicious and well worth the visit. They also do carry-out, so if you're in the mood for incredibly fresh sushi and don't feel like leaving your room, it's no problem. Beds were so comfortable. Rooms are spacious. The vibe is very Miami: crisp, white, modern. I don't know that I'll be back in Honolulu anytime soon, but if I do return, I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay again..”
Reviews.Author: weluvkona
Reviews.Content: Reminds me of the W hotels. Great location in Waikiki, near shopping and nightlife. Very cool, chill vibe. Morimoto's restaurant inside the hotel is delicious...be prepared to take your time and drop some cash...but quality! The Addiction nightclub was fun, a little packed...but you can always go to the lounge to get some space and good people watching and music. Can get a little loud at night w/ the club downstairs...just close your windows and request a higher room. The showers are spacious and beds super comfy w/ the frette linens. Both pools are great and the loung chaises are super comfy...great bar, nice chill lounge music. Not sure we would bring our kids...there were only a few older ones...definitely for the adult crowd. Will be back next adults only trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oilexec
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb 28th to March 2 2012, Very friendly, helpful Staff! Quiet rooms at least on higher floors. Very clean. Great showers. Internet was fast and wireless in room. Always in all hotels the parking was a little expensive, but it was valet and very prompt, with no charges for in and out. Easy walk to local restaurants (OutBack, Red Lobster) and of course close to an ABC store (but what hotel isn't ). Last minute flight change was handled at Check-in by printing my boarding pass at no charge, very helpful! Would stay again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel delightful”
Reviews.Author: EagleEyeHG
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Great front desk service. Hotel sleeping rooms impeccably clean. Morimoto's great food and service. Staff really seemed sincere in their desire to be of service. Some rooms do not have good views and the rooms facing Ala Moana Blvd are quite noisy when the lanai doors are open. I liked the location which was short walk to Ala Moana Park and the shopping center. A pleasant 25 minute stroll into the heart of Waikiki. I think they included free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Marry me...I LOVE you MODERN HONOLULU”
Reviews.Author: ciaomonkey
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this property and how much I enjoyed my stay. But let me state that I prefer modern design hotels (also, usually means less kids) and this one is exceptional. If you are someone who prefers Hawaiian theme for their Hawaii trip, then this wouldn't be the place for you. The rooms are so comfy and well-appointed. The shower is large and one of the greatest aspects of it, were the handle and shower head were on opposite walls, so you don't get sprayed when you first step in. Why isn't every hotel shower like that? The bed was so comfortable. I was fortunate enough to have a room with balconies overlooking the pool and ocean. There are so many different areas in this hotel to sit and relax in a posh cozy setting. The outdoor bar, the indoor bar behind the bookcase, the lobby, the sofas near the pool deck are nicely hidden so you get to be outside but you are not in the sun. Cruise the whole place so you don't miss an ounce of the great detail that has been put into this place (but wear a sweater, like every hotel -it's heavily air conditioned). The pool decks are fantastic. Can't comment on the water, didn't go in. The pool staff is ready to assist. They'll take you to a chair and put a towel (with a hoodie feature, so it stays on the chair- maybe that's common but I hadn't experienced it before and it made me happy) down for you. Servers are always coming by - so you must try their coconut mojito-delish. Sure this hotel is not on the water, but it's a hop, skip, jump and I prefer to be on the pool deck where i can have service, bathrooms, and good music (beach sand is not the nice soft sand). The only 2 complaints are: elevators are a bit slow and their mouthwash tastes like bactine (but it was a bit of nostalgia to remember bactine). But those would never stop me from coming back. Also, if you have $$$, go to Morimotto's - menu is impressive and food divine. Free wi-fi in guest rooms - nice. Also, the bus stop to go to Diamond Head is right around the corner from this hotel. Couldn't be easier. If the hotel staff tells you to take a $30 taxi there, skip it and take the bus. It's easy, cheap, and green. This hotel is also in walking distance from the Ala Moana mall and you can walk along strip with all the other big resorts on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel - a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne E
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on line as it was part of a airline-hotel package. I really did not know what to expect, Our experience at the Modern Honolulu far exceeded any expectations we might have had. My first impression was how competent, helpful, and friendly the staff members were. Our room turned out to be absolutely beautiful with a view of the city and the harbor. The location was great - close to restaurants and transportation. The daily attention to our room was perfect - clean linens, ice, etc. All in all, the Modern Honolulu made our stay a memorable experience. We will definitely stay at the Modern Honolulu during our future visits to Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “A non-tacky, beautiful hotel in Honolulu!”
Reviews.Author: webble77
Reviews.Content: As a first time Australian traveller to Hawaii, I was advised by many friends who had been there that most of the hotels in Waikiki are huge, tacky and dated and from what I saw - they were right! I chose the Modern because it was none of these things and I'm so glad I did!
