It's the iPhone of hotels - sleek, sexy decor everywhere you look from the hotel lobby with revolving bookcase opening up to the lobby bar to the music you can hear under the water in the pool! The attention to detail in all aspects of this hotel are what makes it a pleasure to stay at. The location is good - about a 20 min walk into the heart of Waikiki (a pleasant stroll along the beach or through town) but nice and close to Ala Moana shopping centre and there is a beautiful non-crowded beach about 5 min walk away from Waikiki from the hotel. I totally recommend anyone stay at this hotel who wants a less tacky Hawaii experience!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in Honolulu!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyandChris
Reviews.Content: We read some bad reviews on here, most likely before the management change, and this hotel far exceeded what people had said. This hotel was perfect, the service was flawless, and our experience will be remembered forever! I do not think we will be able to afford this hotel once people find out how amazing it is! I would go back to this hotel again and again. We have lived in the caribbean, stayed at 5 star hotels in miami, the BVIs, Nevis, and in St kitts... Our experience at The Modern Holoulu far exceeded our expectations and the price was ridiculously affordable. Thank you for a perfect vacation! PS: Try their special Mai Tai with foam on top! It is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Depends”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Y298184
Reviews.Content: It was a nice room and they have the Morimoto Restaurant. But it wasn't kid friendly. They provided a lot of amenities that some hotels don't have and should, the service was O.K. but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: LisaER
Reviews.Content: As a previous resident of Oahu, I thought I had seen the "best of the best". That was before my stay at Modern Honolulu last week. The service, in every area of the hotel was exceptional, the rooms and overall decor beautifully designed and decorated, pool and amenties beyond my expectations, and location superb. There was nothing more that I could have hoped for or wanted during my stay and will most certainly return on my future visits to the island. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Oahu for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: gafiltafish
Reviews.Content: Sexy hotel! I was pleasantly surprised with my experience here. I originally was booked for a 3 night stay at Ohana Melia but EntertainmentHotelBucks messed up my PREPAID reservation! The agent tried to downgrade me until I complained that I selected the OM based on the amenities. They eventually upgraded me to the Modern which I had never heard of. The Modern IS NOT in the heart of Waikiki which is why I never looked into it. It's in the marina area which is at the end of Waikiki with views of boats. You have to walk down this walkway to get to the beach so it isn't exactly on the beach. Not subtracting stars for this since I was familiar with the marina area. You do however have a ton of buses right in front of the hotel which I made use of (no need to rent a car in Honolulu IMO, maybe just rent if you are going to the North Shore for the day). Walking distance is an ABC store, Subway, Enterprise, Red Lobster, IHOP, Waiana Coffee Shop (best restaurant in Honolulu IMO), McDonalds, some bars, and some Japanese restaurants. All the restaurants walking distance are cheap to reasonable. My room had a fridge which I stuffed. I asked the bell boy who came in if I could put in things and he said no problem. I never had a problem with using the fridge, but I never had a cleaning lady come in. The room was chic, all white and wood, with a comfortable bed, plenty of towels, a huge shower, and a nice big T,V. I stayed in room 820 which had 2 double beds instead of just 1 (all that was left without having to pay extra) which was fine. It was technically a city view but I still had a nice partial view of the marina. Had no problems with outside noise. They also had decent shampoo, conditioner, and soap in the room, and q tips which was nice. Oh yeah. Really cool feature that I have never seen before. They keep sarongs in the room for you to wear during your stay! I accidently took the bright pink one home to me so if a worker is reading this, I will happily return it the next time I am in town! The main reason I liked this hotel is it had excellent customer service. Every worker was friendly and helpful. They let me use the spa shower hours after my check out time and let me tell you the spa shower was great! Again great products in there, no one was in there but me, and as silly as it may sound it was a nice way to end my stay at the hotel LOL. I never went to either bar or ate any food there, so no opinion on that. I saw both pools but never used them. I don't get why I would lay out at a pool when I'm in Hawaii! I did think it was odd like the reviews here say that they didn't have a hot tub, but again I wouldn't use it anyway. They have no hidden fees and no fees for the internet (wifi in the room and a router if you want to hook up). They do charge for valet (who doesn't in Honolulu?), but right next to the hotel there is a much cheaper paid lot. Again no need to rent a car in Honolulu IMO. This had the vibe of Vegas hotels that cater to an under 40 crowd, but no one was pretentious, snobby, or anything like that (I wear cheap clothes and I'm average looking so I like places that cater to average to ugly people LOL). It all in all was a nice experience and wouldn't mind staying here again if I can get a good deal. I like how they didn't have too many kids staying here (I don't want to be around kids during my vacation). Advice: You can usually get the hotel for $110-$160 a night (before tax) if you play your cards right through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “This old fashioned girl loved the Modern”
Reviews.Author: Lynn026
Reviews.Content: The name of this hotel almost drove me away. I don't like the "too hip for their own good" hotels. This hotel is my kind of Modern. The rooms are sleek and clean. The hotel is small so you don't feel like you are in a crowd of tourists (even though I am a tourist). The hotel feels very adult. No little kids. I love kids, but it was nice not to have them running around the pool, etc. The pools are nice. I found the staff helpful and friendly. Overall, the hotel gave off a very relaxed vibe and the white decor was very peaceful. My only complaint was service at the pool restaurant. My order apparently was never put in. The manager and waitress did their best to apologize and fix the situation. Others around me complained about the slow kitchen. When the food FINALLY came, it was good, but this restaurant needs some work. The food and service at Morimoto is excellent but you really pay the price for it (not sure if it is worth it). I loved the location and my room on the 9th floor was quiet. I slept great. If you're looking for something a little different than your standard chain hotel, check out the Modern. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Honolulu #1 fan”
Reviews.Author: Jec1806
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Modern Honolulu was Amazing. The staff was accommodating and very professional. Since it was my first visit to Hawaii I didn't exactly know how to get around and the best places to dine, luckily for me the concierge at the hotel were full of helpful ideas and pointed me in the right direction. All in all a great experience and I would highly recommend that if your thinking of a hotel to stay while in Honolulu the Modern should be your first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, loved the private pool area!”
Reviews.Author: BananaMonkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011 for Thanksgiving holiday, and really liked the place. Pros: Absolutely stunning private pool/beach area Not noisy at all Great service Perfect if you want a not too busy hotel Really comfortable bed Great bathrooms (especially in the pool area) Cons: Some stains on the white carpet (probably hard to remove, but still) The reception area was like the artic! Brrr.. All in all, a perfect location for a quiet, relaxing holiday, but close enough to all the noise you want. I recommend renting a bike for a day or two, the easiest transportation around Waikiki you can get! That way you feel closer to the life of the more central Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel: Design, Service & Style”
Reviews.Author: Mattd1971
Reviews.Content: What a great place! The staff are very courteous and professional, the design and layout are amazing and we're looking forward to dining in the Iro Chef Morimoto's restuarant tomorrow night! When we first checked in the receptionist advised that we had a 'run-of-house' room where we would be on the lowest floor (3rd) and possibly hear the nightclub but luckily no noise and our so-called city-view room actually has views over the marina, hilton lagoon and the beach so it's great. The TV is huge, bed is massive and the little features like free sarongs and a eukele to play are pretty cool. Looking forward to our next 4 nights here!

Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfying Middle Market "Luxury"”
Reviews.Author: chuckymatt
Reviews.Content: The Modern Honolulu has chic decor, a perfectly nice location, and cozy rooms. But the hotel's staff is indifferent and untrained, the food is mediocre, the amenities are lame or missing, and with the elevated expectations they set with their marketing, it's a double letdown. In a nutshell? It's a "whatever" hotel. We stayed for four nights over a weekend, and our biggest qualm by far was the staff. I'm still rather annoyed (borderline angry?) at how nobody gave a darn that we were guests there. The front desk staff were robotic at check in ("we have this on the second floor, and that on the third floor, blah blah" without eye contact). When we got to our room, it was still being cleaned -- and it continued to be cleaned for about 20 minutes -- while we waited awkwardly on the bed. The hipster-y, "i'm way better than this job" attitude we consistently got from waitstaff at the bar and the restaurant (er, the wobbly tables around the pool) was annoying. They were slow. They messed up our orders (and, to their credit, fixed them). Coffee was always cold and/or old. The breakfast potato "tube" is silly and overthought. And when it started to rain while we were eating outdoors, they didn't even offer us help in moving to a covered seat. Hello? Anyone? Is this really happening? Enough complaining. The rooms were fine, clean, nicely designed. The vibe is trying hard to be Miami Beach, and almost succeeding. The attitude is horrible, and when I'm next looking for an upscale spot in Waikiki, I'll be looking a little further afield. The Modern let us down.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sonnyside
Reviews.Content: As soon as you arrive the bellman and front desk staff are quite efficient. We were able to get to our rooms without any hassle after a long flight and layover. The rooms are definitely modern and the housekeeping staff does do very well cleaning it each and every day. You do also get a turn down service every evening where housekeeping brings you ice and water and turn down your bed if you are not in the room. These are all nice touches. As another review said, we shortly noticed that our room was infested with ants. The first couple of days we had noticed one or two on the floor in the bathroom. We aren't incredibly picky so we just left it at that. A couple of days later they were all over the baseboards and in our closet and clothes. We called the front desk at about 10:30PM at night when we got back to our rooms and were quickly moved to a room down that hall. We absolutely would have appreciated a slight upgrade to an ocean view for the trouble, and having to pack everything late at night and move. We were quickly moved to an equal room and view and that was that. The Morimoto restaurant in this hotel is absolutely stunning. The food and service you receive is absolutely top-notch. In addition, the concierge--I believe her name is Stephanie--is incredibly kind, efficient, and sincere. The stay was fine overall. Most likely on our next visit in the area we will see what the other hotels have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel and exemplary staff”
Reviews.Author: Monica T
Reviews.Content: Arrival at the hotel the staff were friendly, quick and efficient. The concierge Stephanie was amazing organising and suggesting activities with attentiveness to our needs. The hotel itself was new, fresh and had many interesting charachteristics lke a bar hidden behind a revolving bookcase a stunning pool bar area with delicious food choices.

Reviews.Title: “the modern great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ronj350
Reviews.Content: hotel rooms are very comfortable,staff are friendly and helpfull. not the cheapest on the island but we also stayed at a cheaper hotel and there service and rooms are worth the extra dollars

Reviews.Title: “Nice Looking, but something's wrong somewhere"”
Reviews.Author: SydneyCandy
Reviews.Content: Went to the Pool Bar for food and drinks. Of all the places in Honolulu we went to this was the only one that asked for a c/card upfront.(Maybe people do runners?) Food arrived and we waited and waited for our drink, eventually having to ask - someone forgot! But one was then complimentary, so that was a professional way to handle that mixup. Next evening we decided to give The Modern another try, this time the Lobby Bar, disappointing cocktail menu, under previous ownership the place had the best list in Town.Room half full, nice space, had to wait until staff decided we might want to order a drink. " We don't have any lychees", was a sullen answer to a request for a Lychee Martini. So we left. I know there was history with a takeover of this place, but if your staff are happy, your clients are happy. There is definitely something smelly in the fridge at The Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed but will return!”
Reviews.Author: Mikejonson
Reviews.Content: To Whom it my concern  My Wife & I previously stayed at this hotel before when it was called The Waikiki Edition hotel. This was our return to his hotel. But unfortunately the room we checked into was infested with trails of ants in it. This problem was quickly alleviated by the front desk manager Suki, by quickly arranging another room for us. Not only did she upgraded us to the ocean side but this tiny lady moved all the luggage for us. She also set up hot cocoa service for us. The only other negative comment we have was the turn down service wasn't consistent. Some days we had bottles of water in the room and other days we did not, You do not receive housekeeping service unless you call and ask for it. So this is a mixed review. The overall experience made up for the shortcomings. We will defiantly return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice design and modern!”
Reviews.Author: Louise L
Reviews.Content: We where a group of friends traveling around Hawaii for three weeks and we stayed at the Modern two times during our trip. When we first arrived to Oahu for three nights and for our last night before flying home to Sweden. This hotel is perfect for a younger audience and I would not necessarily stay here if I had kids. There are plenty of other hotels that caters to that audience so as traveler in my mid 30's (as the rest of the group) I did appreciated not being splashed or bombed every 5 min in the pool :) The service is overall very good and the staff as well. The hotel has some great features as the bookshelf that acts as a small library during the day but at night is turned and voila it opens up to a lounge/bar area during the night. It's the little things that makes things great! I also have to mention the sarongs and the colorful ukulele that are on display in the rooms, nice and funny touch :) The hotel also have a popular nightclub and the pool area offers a great setting for some late evening drinks. So if you are looking for a hotel with nice design and a somewhat younger feeling book the Modern!

Reviews.Title: “For discerning travelers who appreciate excellent service and a refined chic atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: PeggyJoe
Reviews.Content: I would definitely come back. I chose the hotel based on traveler reviews and wasn't disappointed. Everyone on the service team was friendly and exceptionally helpful. Very handsome too! Very close to The Hawaiian Village so lots to see, do and shop nearby. Ala Moana Mall is also walking distance. We especially appreciated the complimentary bottled water. There were wine glasses and cork screw in the room. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Too Hard”
Reviews.Author: CAtravelfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is trying way too hard to be an "upscale" hotel. Snooty staff, "high security" elevators, weird upgraded ammenities were just some of the issues here. You get a shoe horn and lint brush, but no coffee maker or refrigerator. Every time you go up to your room, the guest must input their key card in order to press the floor they are on. Is it so dangerous that we need to be sure to keep the criminals out? Is the hotel that exclusive? The answer is no, the hotel is in a great location and is very safe from what we experienced. This is just another stupid choice to present themselves as "upscale". Not even to mention that several times during our two day stay a guest would input their card and wipe out everybody's floor selections so we were all scrambling to get our keys in the slot before the elevator passed out floor. We also got "over-ridden by a maintenance worker who put in his master key and changed the elevator from going up to going down to where he needed to go. We The service is also substandard, we left the hotel at 9am one morning to return at 2:30pm and our room was still not cleaned. Not a very "upscale" feature. My husband was working and needed to rest so we put the do not disturb sign out for a few hours until we left that evening knowing that our room would not be serviced and we were fine with that. When we returned the room was not serviced (as we expected) and we had a message that we had to come down to the desk to retreive as they would not inform us over the phone. After waiting in line at the desk for over 7 minutes (there is only one clerk working at 9pm, inadequate staffing is not really an "upscale" hotel feature either...) we were informed that housekeeping wanted to let us know they didn't service the room because of the sign. Really you couldn't leave a note under the door, a voice message or even tell me over the phone??! We were suposed to stay four nights, but left after two. There are some very nice design elements to the hotel and/or rooms and the pool area is very nice but does not get the sunlight until later in the morning since the hotel is in the middle of several high rise buildings. The night club is nice but we did hear the music up on the 7th floor on our last night. The light in the bathroom was burned out, hallway noise was VERY audible and while the hotel has no control of roadwork, we got to enjoy to melodious sounds of a jackhammer until 2am outside the thin windows. We also heard from another couple that was staying there that it took 45 minutes to have their breakfast order taken only after they had to speak to the manager. I saw that this is a regular occurance based on several previous reviews. Don't pay for what they are trying to be, the hotel is way to expensive for what they actually are...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price, great room, very modern, great young crowd atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Modern Feb. 20-27, 2012. Overall the experience was excellent. The service is good, the staff all young, dressed well and very attractive. The rooms clean roomy, very very modern and nice. Ours was a partial ocean view. The location is about a 20 min walk to downtown Waikiki strip. And it was a walk we enjoyed everyday. I would personally recommend the Modern to anyone 40 and under. That's just my opinion, the hotel has a funky and young vibe. The "Private Beach" on the 2nd floor was great, small wading pool surrounded by pool lounge chairs and sand avec pool side bar - was fantastic. Also, in the early evening the downstairs library area transforms into a lounge. Very nice spot to have a few pre-evening drinks to start the night. Overall, excellent hotel. Very fresh, new and "Modern" with a funky, youthful vibe. We booked this week trip through Expedia and traveled from Vancouver. The price was excellent and the hotel certainly exceeded our expectations. This is a boutique 4 star hotel, if you are looking for the best hotel with the best location on the beach, this is not it. But if you are looking for an excellent hotel, with a fresh vibe, and don't mind walking to the beach, and saving a ton of cash in the process, then The Modern is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tricia S
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh I loved my stay!! Everything was great. I loved the pool area in the evening while relaxing and having a cocktail. I loved it in the day because you could enjoy the pool, then take a beautiful walk out around the lagoon. The food is incredible, everything I had was fabulous. The staff was young, happy, and attentive without being annoying. Just fun and eager to help you. The location was great because I left in the morning and walked for 4 hours, enjoying breakfast and then some shopping at Ala Moana. I couldn't have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: Sebastien_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over the President's day week-end and after an easy and quick check-in, we were upgraded to a nice ocean/marina suite with ocean view. The modern design of the rooms feel clean yet not cold. We enjoyed the pool, which although smaller than other hotels in the area, is much nicer. The pool bar and the lounge are also amazing. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled but still subject to the pitfalls of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: CraigLieberman
Reviews.Content: Although newly remodeled, while the room was fine and the pools were superb, this place suffers from one major downfall: the noise in Waikiki is unbearable. Screaming partners, single panes glass, road noise audible from 14 floors up and road construction all night conspired against restful slumber. Add that with the fact that they screwed up my reservation, double billed me for two nights on the first night and then blamed me for the mixup and they get a low score from me. Customer service is number one in a town poolpulated by a wide range of choices and the staff I encountered just seemed indifferent. Change rO double panes glass and retrain the staff and you've got something here. Till then, I suggest anyone booking in Waikiki makes sure their hotel has double paned glass.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill!”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Just finished 2 weeks at this hotel, the only hotel on the island my client could find that had a room available for my entire stay. There had been talk about having to extend my stay-had that happened, I would have changed hotels & that was before the incident at check-out. No bill under the door, which is never a good sign. Stopped at the front desk, gave the clerk my room#, he played w/his computer & then announced 'you're all set'. Told him I needed to see the bill. Was not totally surprised to see $2600+ in room & tax charges on there that were supposed to be direct billed to the client. When I brought that up, clerk set to work fixing the bill but w/o one word of apology or even comment which tells me the intent was to bill both my card & the client! Hands down, this hotel has the world's worst beds-it is a platform about 6 inches off the ground w/a mattress (not even a pillow top) sitting on it. Be warned if sharing a room w/anyone, there are plantation shutters that divide the bathroom & bedroom, not a full wall. Further, there is an enormous sliding...something...in front of the doors to the balcony. No matter where you put the blasted thing, half the door to the patio is blocked by this monstrosity. Nice big shower, but clearly designed by a man-no bench or even shelf for the ladies who need to shave their legs. The live music on Tues nights that another reviewer considered 'cool' isn't very cool when one is 11 stories up w/the door firmly shut & must still turn the tv up to hear over the music! Apparently this had been a Marriott, of some brand, previously & there are still issues going on w/the union that represents the hotel workers on the Island-came back to find them picketing the hotel one night! Lastly, for some odd reason, none of the staff in this hotel wear name badges, which I find very disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Hip in Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: PCTV
Reviews.Content: For a different take on Honolulu The Modern is worth a try. It's more about the pool and the nightlife than the beach. Although the beach is just a short walk away. I was there while working a few days and found it a great place to work from. Excellent restaurant on site, and Waikiki is just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “MODERN INDEED!”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Modern is a nicely renovated vintage hotel that's off the beaten Waikiki trail but that's a plus in my book. Clean, nicely appointed rooms (most have lanais), comfortable bedding and just a block from the ocean make this place a real find. The biggest negatives are the stupid hipster bars in the hotel, they're noisy and have awful music but you can always byo poolside ;) for a relaxing evening. Iron Chef Morimoto has a hip restaurant on site, a bit pricey but unusual Japanese fusion cuisine that's worth a visit. So...go modern!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a property Hesitated to share the treasure!”
Reviews.Author: travelwiseandpicky
Reviews.Content: We found this property using bookit.com. What an unexpected surprise! Value for the area, unsurpassed, location a hidden gem, being that it is at the end of Waikiki away from the crowds, walking distance to the huge and amazing AloMoana shopping centre, right at the harbour and very close to the start of Waikiki beach. Restaurants in the area are great, some local treasures like the Chart house right across the street, of course in the hotel, the Iron Chef Morimoto's brings world class guests about the place. The staff at the property are truly amazing, especially the trio of concierge staff at our disposal, they are willing to assist with everything from maps, to reservations, car rentals, you name it, they were friendly, and the best, they did not have their hands out expecting gratuities at every turn! The wait staff were for the most part, fantastic, and the hotel bar is not only beautiful and full of ambiance during the evening, but the food and drinks are great, pricing is a bit high to be honest, and we found the bar could have had later hours, especially during the weekend nights. The proximity of the property, is amazing, right next to and very accessible to the famous Ilikai hotel and all its amenities make this hotel seem a grander scale. The pool area is fabulous, with consideration for the couples at the resort, they thought of everything here, family oriented downstairs, with loungers, food and beverage service, and upstairs, WOW very upscale private beach with a wading, lounging pool complete with palm trees, greenery, white sand. The only disappointment here was minor, not enough beverage and food service despite the amazing huge beachside bar available the F&B manager needs to get on this one! This area is supposed to be adults only, but as per usual, some guests felt that the rules did not apply to them and brought their little ones up, perhaps some enforcement would work there, again there is a great area for them below to indulge in! The rooms are all renovated, very fitting with white fresh linens, furniture and a beach theme, cleanliness is taken seriously here! The beds are very comfortable which was important as we stayed 10 nights. We were lucky enough to get a fabulous upgrade, so our balcony put us right over the pool, in line with the beach fireworks, the Ilikai property, and an amazing sunset! City views may be a bit noisy, but they have done a good job to soundproof the units. Bus access is unlimited, you can get everywhere from here! The Hilton Hawaiian is very close for shopping, walking paths everywhere take you along the entire Waikiki beach. There is valet parking and the self parking next door is close, but pricey, options are to park about a block away for less money if you don't mind the walk. There is an ABC fully stocked store right at the corner with a McDonald's for families, keeps costs down! We travel a great deal and I am a very picky customer being from the travel industry, so I like to think we have high standards and expectations, but with a moderate budget, this property fit the bill, and we will definately stay here again on next visit to Oahu! Thank you to Mr. V. C. for making our vacation wonderful, looking forward to next trip already!

Reviews.Title: “City hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: satokome
Reviews.Content: Nice 3-star hotel. The room itself was no frill (city view) but clean. Booked thru bookit.com for the best price. I asked the front desk to give me the highest floor room possible. She accommodated my request and gave me the 15th-floor room, which was great with a partial ocean view. Room service was excellent (daily ice and bottled water). Excellent food--both at Morimoto Restraurant and room service. Park at the self-parking right in front of the hotel for $20/day instead of hotel's $28/day valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely, a good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Regina C
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience staying at the Modern Honolulu. Everything was in working order, rooms were clean and comfortable, and service was always available from a courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “California casual...all the things we love but never knew.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCA94920
Reviews.Content: Ian's re-design of the hotel yielded a strong white structure with soft interior touches....like chic day beds in the room's window, teak shutters, casual bistro tables in the garden courtyard by the pool, comfy outdoor sofas with plush pillows--- a california modern sensibility without any fuss. We felt relaxed in the room, and this is the anti corporate hotel. Little design surprises everywhere. A toned down W. The coolness without trying sooo hard. The location isn't ON the beach, but a quick walk down the ramp will plop you on the Hilton lagoon which is basically the start of Waikiki beach. The pools overlook the harbor, and you're within walking distance to ala-moana mall, the luxury row, and all the big resorts. The modern is a small size boutique hotel compared to the mammoth complexes the Hilton and Sheraton occupy.

Reviews.Title: “Barefoot Chic”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the renovation of the hotel..it was well done and definitely felt up-,market...but with a casual feel much appreciated in Hawaii We enjoyed the pool side dining...loved the lounge chairs IN THE POOL...very fun..and the food was simple but good. Our stay was marred by breakfast at Morimotos (which is in the hotel but not owned by the hotel)Service was slow, food was expensive and poor standard..cold toast, eggs..greasy bacon...recommend go out of the hotel for breakfast as this is only option other than room service) The hotel should consider having their own breakfast by the pool. (coffee and pastry does not constitute breakfast for us) Overall terrific hotel...would recommend and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Modern”
Reviews.Author: Margot2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved the location, view, pools with comfortable seating and clean, fresh rooms. Everything was very modern and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Experience at the Modern”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl90105
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Modern Honolulu for a trip to Oahu. It is a unique experience, as you are tucked into a large metropolitian city that is also backed by a vast ocean; one of the best parts about staying at the Modern is that you get to see the best of urban culture and arts, as well as surf and sand. The pool is amazing if you want to just relax and have some cocktails (which are incredible, as well as the food). The spa is great (you're in Hawaii, any spa would be great), but all products used are organic which for a person like me that's key. They have a night club for dancing and enjoying. The location of the hotel is perfect for the amazing sunset views. It's a prime spot, as you can rent a car from right across the street. Great access to freeways to get to different spots on the Island, which the most northern part (North Shore), is a quick 30 minute drive. East Oahu (the most amazing beaches) is a quick 15-20 minute drive, and the West part is a simple 15 minute drive as well. Everyone tells you 1.5 hours, but unless you're driving 30 mph I have no idea where that time frame comes from. Not to mention, the shopping and food- all within walking distance of the hotel. The staff is fantastic and extremely aware of what to do, when to do it, where to do it. It's a wonderful experience and I'd highly recommend The Modern Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, BUT there is nightclub "Addiction" that cranks bass to till 3am”
Reviews.Author: JamesHunt1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. Morimoto in the lobby is amazing. But there is a nightclub in the hotel that cranks house/ dance music till 3am!!!!!!!!! And the hotel put us on the 4th floor of the hotel and the bass comes right up thru the walls. I can tell you what song they are playing and the bass can be felt in the bed. We called down and found out this will go on till My compliant is that no one ever said a thing about it. So we come back from dinner, exhausted and full and now have to move rooms at 11:30 at night - assuming there is a room to move us to and of course our stuff is all over the room at this point. We called down 15 minutes ago and have been waiting. Just heard back, the hotel asked us to pack our bags at midnight to switch rooms so we can pack again and check out tomorrow. I pointed out we are checking out tomorrow and why not just put us in the quiet room, leave our bags and all our stuff here until morning when come back to our room to shower and pack? Oh, good idea, Ill check with manager. We are now waiting again, still not sleeping. And the hotel manager Terrance Togi has decided that he will not help us and we are now repacking all our belonging so we can switch rooms and sleep. just sleep. I could care less how nice the room is or what the hotel offers when you can't actually sleep in it. This place is a mess, open for a few months and still learning how to deal with horrible situations like this. The best part is that we never ever talked to a manager or heard and an apology for anything other than the employee who applogized that the manager would not help us. With all the hotels on the beach, stay elsewhere and stop by mori moto for dinner

Reviews.Title: “Finally real nightlife in Waikiki!”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: I'll get right to the point: There is only one real nightlife destination in all of Waikiki and that is Addiction Nightclub at the Modern Honolulu. This place seams to be the only spot out of many that we visited that actually "get's it". The door is tough but reasonable, manned by two beautiful brunettes and several chiseled security guards keeping order. Once inside my friends and I finally felt at home: a great crowd, beautiful and attentive service staff, amazing music that had the girls dancing all night, and finally some real VIP bottle service. The space is not large, but it goes off and got crowded every night we went (Friday and Saturday) and heard the Thursday industry nights also have a cool vibe (but we weren't able to check it out). The sound system is amazing and the ceiling is covered in hundreds of light bulbs that give it a kind of hazy cloud effect throughout the night. Only minor complaint is the drinks and bottles are not cheap, but honestly, after the entire experience at Addiction, very well worth the price. Thanks Heather for the great service! I will definitely be back on my next visit and highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “A yacht on land.”
Reviews.Author: Twisted C
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed at during our recent trip to Maui and Oahu. We stay at the Ritz in Maui and Turtle Bay up on the north shore. I think I really would have liked this hotel when I was in my mid 20's, but now as I am getting older (early 30's) I find that I enjoy less hustle and bustle of the city and a more relaxing environment in the country. With that said the hotel was exactly what I expected and as what earlier reviews have indicated. Nice accommodations, friendly staff and beautiful common areas. It is a little posh but not overdone. If a hotel could be a yacht and the staff were your first mates and cabin boys then this would be the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wants to be luxe... but doesn't know how”
Reviews.Author: Joe A
Reviews.Content: The Modern aspires to be a luxury hotel, but can't quite figure out how to do it. During my stay, it seemed that they didn't have room ready for check-in by 3pm and in fact, some guests were kept waiting until after 5pm. The hotel offers a turn-down service, but missed my room two of the four nights I was there (and no, there wasn't a Do Not Disturb on my door). Rooms are okay. I wouldn't say that they are great and certainly not luxurious. Instead they are rather stark (mostly white) and not particularly large. Bathrooms are a little odd - if you are there with someone, make sure that you are very comfortable with them as the bathroom offers little privacy. Staff are pretty friendly. But, I would expect that as a luxury property (or at least laying claim to that) staff would remember guests names, valet would know that you are checking in, advance email or phone call to guests like I experience with other properties. Location is just ok. Not a place to go if you want to hang out on the beach although its about a five minute walk to the beach fronting the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Recent construction on Ala Moana Blvd makes getting into and out of the hotel a real pain if you try to do it after about 6:30 pm. This road work is expected to continue for several more months if not another year. Lobby Bar is nice and service there is good, although drinks are on the expensive side. Morimotos? Expensive and the service is so so. If you go, make sure that you have a couple of drinks as the service can be very slow. Overall, I think that they aspire to be a luxury hotel, but just don't know how. For a luxury experience, I'd recommend the Halekulani or The Kahala.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accomodations, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: wonderlilly
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back! In the chaos of Waikiki, it's great to find a beautiful haven that is walkable to the action but not consumed by it. The Modern is a tasteful hotel that seems intent on providing a relaxing experience- we found ourselves lingering at our own hotel more than we have on any other vacation. The staff was universally warm and welcoming: we were treated better than at any hotel in recent memory. The hotel seems intent on creating a unique experience- the first thing we noticed in our room was little ukeleles you could (theoretically) strum on your balcony. The views from both rooms we had were stunning. It is perfectly located, just a few steps from the beach and perched on the beautiful Marina. When you are lying on one of the comfortable beds by the pool, you will feel worlds away. The hotel also offers free internet in its rooms, which is a token of how this hotel extends itself (especially in a time when so many hotels are getting cheap) Tip: The music Tuesday nights at the bar by the pool is lovely, as are the special cocktails on the menu- the Coco Breeze (?) was a favorite in our group!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic alternative to the dated hotels in Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: fourstardust
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Modern for 3 nights in general and was very impressed with the hotel and the staff. My stay got off to a great start after 22 hours of flying to be given an upgrade to a suite for free. Followed by some great cocktails at the lobby bar. For me the highlight of my stay was the poolside bar and the great service we received from all of the staff

Reviews.Title: “Modern by name Modern by nature”
Reviews.Author: Mixologist80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Modern Honolulu with my family for just over a week in January. I understand the hotel was completely refurbished about a year ago and it has a very clean, new feel to it. It's facilities lean more to the boutique side (i.e. small). Staff at the front desk were reasonably efficient. Concierge was pleasant and helpful. I have read other reviewers write that service was patchy or inconsistent. We found it the same. Our first day we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and found the menu selection small, the service ok, but we decided not to do that again. By accident we found out that it was possibly to eat breakfast outside near the pool. For six days straight we had breakfast at the pool and on the seventh it all went to hell in a handbasket. We sat down and were ignored (ie not given menus). When we finally asked for menus, the staff member was flipant to say the least. Two of us ordered and about fifteen minutes later four more people in our party arrived and eventually ordered. The mistakes, delays and shockingly bad service were laughable. I have to say though that in the end, the manager did his best to correct everything and did not charge for anything we had during breakfast. While I would rather they got it right the first time, I can't complain with how they handled the situation in the end. We (my family and I) always tip...the gauling thing is that now it is not apprecaited or accepted as a reward for a job well done, it is now expected. Our expectations however extend that when we tip, the next time we visit, the service should be excellent. They have a "main pool" and a "zen" splash pool, which is ankle deep (not for swimming). On the day we arrived the splash pool was closed in the late afternoon and evening for a function, which was OK because the other "main" pool was available. However on one of the days the Main pool was closed from 4pm for a function. This was not acceptable. When there is only one proper pool, it is not reasonable to close it for a private function. We went to the hotels Restaurant on the first and last night of our stay the food was expensive, but excellent. The service on the first night was very poor (and we had a US$100.00 tip whacked on the bill because we were more than six people). On the second occaision the service was excellent (so we didn't mind paying the tip). The rooms were quite expensive, but we would stay there again. While this property is a little distant from Waikiki Shopping it is very close to Ala Moana shopping centre. One of the best things about Honolulu is the shopping. The prices and the variety. I would stay at the Modern again, as I like to stay in newer hotels and most others are aging. I have stayed at the Westin Moana Surfrider (rooms are small but well appointed) and Sheraton (Big hotel, old hotel - would not do it again).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Hilton Village”
Reviews.Author: Lmar206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and really enoyed the hotel. The pool is small, but never crowded and has a very Miami feel to it. Nice separation of space, and the outer deck area is setup with large comfy looking beds. Pool gets great sun due to the location. Pool Bar is relaxing, food seems to be basically room service (with prices to match, 17 for a small chicken sandwich and chips, ouch!) so nothing to get excited about, we ended up going to the abc across the street and picnicking poolside, the selection and quantity available didn't merit the high cost. Location is great, close to the Hilton village and all the shopping there, plus the mall close by. View from our room was the marina, and ocean, fantastic! Rooms have free internet and wifi, comfy bed, nice mnamilist white decor. Very peaceful and relaxing visit, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action!”
Reviews.Author: 618mom2boys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and we loved it. It's close to the action of Waikiki Beach. Restaurants, stores, the beach, and plenty of other fun stuff is all with in walking distance. They treat you like celebrities at this hotel. I don't think I ever once opened the front door. And the concierge is fantastic! The called around to different restaurants finding just what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “"The Modern" Alchemy”
Reviews.Author: lucyaziz
Reviews.Content: "Alchemy"- the art of turning metal into gold. "The Modern Alchemy"- the art of turning stark into sexy. On a tucked away back street, across from a McD's, a Red Lobster, and a behemoth Hilton Village, is the gem of a rather drab block. The Modern is the crown jewel of the area; of all of Waikiki, in fact. I was delighted from start to finish of my visit to The Modern in January. The service was impeccable. Upon arrival, not only was I checked in early (1:30 PM), but also was I upgraded to a poolside room by Gabrielle. It is no wonder she has been mentioned several times by previous guests; Gabrielle was the perfect welcome. My luggage arrived within 5 minutes, with a warm greeting from Hana, with white cruise ship shorts and a white happy smile. The room was beautiful; crisp, clean, and dazzlingly white. The Frette linens were so alluring, it was almost debatable as to whether I should go to the sunny pool, or lie in million-count cotton. I opted for the pool...but it was a close race. On my way to the elevator, I noticed the Wall St. Journal stacked for guests to take. What a sophisticated choice. Thank god; USA Today is so...Marriott. And for those who weren't as bourgeouis, a local paper was piled right next to The Jour-null. What a nice touch. Back to the Surise Pool (not the adult one, and it was still fun for adults). I strolled past a wall adorned with Jurassic-meets-Modern pots of ferns. Tres chic. I stopped at the host, and was offered my choice of any seat. Ohh, the options. Terry-cloth robed chaises lay nonchalantly by the small, but fitting pool. Large pillow-covered beds were tucked between shady trees for loungers. I tried both. Poolside service was swift and always delivered with a smile, although on the spensy side. Get the Pimms Cup. Soooo refreshing, I ordered it, um, a couple more times... The next morning, I ordered a carafe of French-pressed coffee. It was weak and tasted like water. No problem; my server arrived apologetically in less than 5 minutes, with a robust new pot and a plate of croissants for my troubles. How about valet parking (the only option here)? Perhaps I've been to Vegas too many times, as I always cringe at the thought of waiting 30-40 minutes for my car. Under 5 minutes. Every time - even once at 3:30 AM. No, I wasn't doing anything Vegas style. It was a biz trip...I think. I'm disappointed that other travelers on this site found the lobby boring. I would call it minimalist...or maybe, Modern. But what is boring about a wall filled with a collage of old surfboards? That's friggen cool! And what is boring about a bookshelf that secretly transforms into a bar at 5 PM? Bad*ss, I say. And speaking of bad*ss, let's talk about the bar for a sec. Private, welcoming, and intimate, all at the same time. Little candlelit tables dotted the sides for budding lovers. Therefore, I headed for the bar seats. I hope everyone is as lucky as I was to have Jason serve me. Order the Deconstructed Mai Tai from him and remember why life is so worth living. Also order the seared beef I-dunno-what-it's-called-cause-I-had-2-mai-tais-already. Then, marvel over the fact that Jason hears everything at the bar, even when he is at the end talking to someone else. Amaaazing. How about business accomodations? After all, I was on a biz trip, wasn't I? So, the business center was a bit lacking. I needed a couple color copies, and the printer was only programmed for black n white. Boo. I was late and cranky for my appointment. No problem. Russell, at the reception, had the antidote. "Well, why don't you just email it to me, and I'll print it out right here?". Whaaat? OK! Done. In, you guessed it, 5 minutes. I was enjoying my stay so much, I decided to extend it over Friday night. I called the front desk. "Ooh. We're sold out on Friday night. Sorry." Oh yeah, it was Pro Bowl weekend. Was that asking too much? Actually, no. My hero, Russell, saved the day again the next morning. "OK. Why don't you keep your room, and we'll keep the same price bracket, too." Seriously. I mean, seriously? At the end of the day, we expect the big things...but remember the little things. We remember places...and especially people (notice how many names I remembered? I suck at names). The Modern hit all marks with aplomb. It was one of my very favorite hotel experiences ever. I will not even bother staying anywhere else on my return to Honolulu. Thank you, Modern, for making my experience a golden one...

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in the area.”
Reviews.Author: eyebehold
Reviews.Content: There are a ton of Hotels in the area, but after taking a look at what was there, I was happy to be back on this property. Just like the name, it is very modern and beautifully decorated inside. The staff was amazing, always had big smiles, and were eager to answer any questions I had. My room was pleasant and had a great presentation. The downfalls to the room were: Windows let in a ton of noise, not even that loud air conditioning unit could drown it out. The Television uses what I am guessing is an internet television provider. It worked the first time I tried it, but failed to work the rest of the time. The television also had two volumes, Loud, or mute. Because I did not spend much time in the room, it was not a big problem, but watching sports in mute because the volume did not work was not fun. I had no idea where the clock was until just before I left the hotel, it is tiny to say the least and my wife let me know she couldn't read it even if she tried. I also noticed that I only got a few hours of sleep that night and felt very sore the next day. My guess is that the pillow was the culprit, since I love a firm mattress, and these were very firm mattresses. What stood out: the private beach area to tan was great, the pool is gorgeous, and everything else about the property was amazing. The Lobby is stunning and the staff was great. I'd come back again and again just because it was such a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “reviewing restaurant and grounds”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle B
Reviews.Content: We had a great dinner and drinks by the fire and I found everything very pleasant. The hotel decor was my favorite

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: cheerE
Reviews.Content: My wife, 9-month old baby, and I recently stayed at The Modern for two weeks. We had an amazing corner room on the 15th floor with two balconies overlooking the ocean and marina, and with a view of green mountains and part of the city. Staff members were great--efficient and helpful, cheery and kind, unpretentious. While we were there, three articles were published in the Wall Street Journal and the local city paper detailing some of the business-side decisions recently made by its owners. The articles were interesting, but more interesting to me were the staff members I queried about the changes, all of whom agreed that The Modern as it is now is better than it was in the past. Our experience confirms theirs. We walked everywhere without a problem, day and night. The Modern's location facilitated our driving day excursions to the leeward coast, to china town and downtown, to the north shore, Manoa falls, Diamond Head, etc., etc. Our room had a spectacular view of sunsets and fireworks... Overall, we had an amazing time in Oahu linchpinned by a wonderful stay at The Modern. (As an aside, the original Hawaii 5-0 has an opening shot of The Modern's building next to the Ilikai and several of the episodes include the building and neighboring garages and hotels. We were excited to see that its present mid-century decor is rooted in an actual mid-century building.)

Reviews.Title: “It is Modern”
Reviews.Author: HarryJ202
Reviews.Content: This is not a resort hotel but it is a comfortable property in a good location if you like to shop, being just minutes from the large Ala Moana Shopping Center with a good choice of stores from very high end (Miu Miu, a Prada cousin) to a Sears! Also plenty of eating places, including a busy food court. If you are an outdoors person, the Ala Moana Park is minutes away for a leisurely walk or a strenuous run on its beautiful winding trails. In the evening, you can sit with your loved one and watch a beautiful sunset through puffy clouds against the backdrop of the lovely blue of the Pacific Ocean. Several restaurants are right across the hotel - a McDonald's if you want to go easy on your budget or a Red Lobster if you feel like splurging a little more. Several other eating places are nearby, including an Indian restaurant run by a Samoan couple. If you are sensitive to noise, be careful. I was on the 14th floor and could hear all kinds of noises - traffic, construction, etc. - all the time, including at night. My room was clean and "modern," in fact so modern I didn't know how to turn on the faucet, which was actually quite simple. I was turning the handle from side to side when all I had to do was to lift it a little to get the water flowing - my fault, not the manufacturer's. There was a rather large, bulky lattice-type window covering which I found a bit inconvenient because it blocked a good open view of the ocean (I had a side view room anyway). The mini bar is expensive (as they all are) - $5 for a small bottle of sparkling water! The in-room safe is nice. Also you are a short ride away from Waikiki Beach. My taxi driver said it would cost about $6 to drive from the hotel to a Waikiki beach - reasonable. Don't do what I did - rented a car at $90 per day and drove seven miles round-trip to the beach. The gas gauge didn't move at all, so the rental car company took pity on me and refunded me the $35 I had prepaid for gas. If you have a nice leisurely breakfast in the Morimoto Restaurant, be prepared to share your food with the cute Hawaiin birds which hover nearby. For an evening meal, make a reservation as it fills up pretty fast. Bring plenty of money for dinner - it's expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for adults and business travel”
Reviews.Author: Brad R
Reviews.Content: I have to say from the reviews up here and on other sites that I was a bit skeptical, however, I have nothing but incredibly positive things to say. The design for the hotel is top notch and the staff for the hotel is attentive without being pushy or overwhelming. The common spaces are very, very well done, and the room is "of the moment" while also being "of Hawaii." For the entire hotel experience, think the Mondrians in LA or NYC meet Hawaii-- if that is your thing, then you'll love The Modern. If you are looking for a kid-friendly, large, all-things-to-everyone resort, this is not it. But, if you want a high design, well-run, happy and restful retreat, you can't beat The Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and top notch”
Reviews.Author: jettagirlk2
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as part of a last minute package and was very impressed with this Hotel--from the design and details right down to the staff. Everyone including the valet guys, front desk and concierge were exceptionally friendly and helpful throughout our 5 night stay. We were situated on the top floor with a gorgeous ocean view with the balcony facing the marina. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to chill and relax in Waikiki, and would go so far to say that this may be the nicest hotel I have stayed at. I have had the opportunity to stay at many hotels around the world and would have to say that this hotel made me feel extremely comfortable. If I had to really critique it in a nit picky sort of way the only thing I would say is that there is not a ton of privacy in the bathroom, as there are wooden lovers that separate the bathroom from the main and that there is no tub. (sorry I am a tub person). I would also like to give a special shout out to the concierge, Stephanie, who was super duper nice to us and became like a friend on the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: AussieMarina
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for their feature - their beach pool - and the day after checking in wake up to find a note under our door saying it is unavailable from Friday-Sunday - and then have to repeatedly track down management who are VERY busy ....not making us happy that is for sure

Reviews.Title: “Not actually a resort”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at The Modern. What a disappointment. We were prepared to like it a lot as our first impression was good. Although the lobby is not grand, it has a nice island feel to it. Check-in went well and our first view of our room was positive. We liked the soft color pallet with touches of Hawaiana. The room seemed light and airy. As we entered the room I caught my ankle on the projecting platform around the bed. That may seem like a nice designer tough, but each of us had issues with the sharp edges that seem to reach out when you walk around the bed. The first view was of the parking structure across the way, but when you got up close to the window, the marina and a little bit of ocean were visible to the side which was nice. The bath was large and fresh with plenty of thick fluffy towels, but no tub. We particularly didn't like the open to the bedroom feeling with the louvered shutters in the bathroom - you hear everything! The beds were very comfortable and we particularly liked the padded headboard, but the room was very noisy with hotel and traffic sounds throughout the night. The flat screen tv and the cable reception were very good though as was the internet service. Still, the amenities that would have made our stay more pleasant were missing. There was no refrigerator for keeping fruit, water, or juice in the room, only a very pricey stocked bar refrigerator. We missed having a coffee maker or microwave for a hot beverage. We were also disappointed that there was not an ice machine available. The only way to get ice was to call room service..not very convenient. We also missed any drawers for storage in the room. It just makes it easier to keep the room tidy. A plus was finding copies of the local newspaper as well as the Wall Street Journal on the console table in the hall outside our room each morning. To sum up I would say that our overall experience was not up to the standard we might have expected or hoped for at a resort. Where is the beach??? The best you can do is go to the the Hilton Hawaiian Village down the way.

Reviews.Title: “Haven for Hipsters”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: This 'so hip that it hurts' make-over of an unremarkable 60's era hotel oozes a breazy MTV flair that younger adults and club-scene devotees will enjoy. Morimoto Restaurant for breakfast was a comedy of errors in early January during our stay - though we marked 'unacceptable' on our bill, not a word or adjustment from the hotel. Obviously going through some growing pains, this place is probably best for the 'see and be seen' crowd. Location in relation to the beach is poor - its a sizeable hike - but well situated if you're going shopping at Ala Moana.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Paradise Getaway”
Reviews.Author: nvayupak
Reviews.Content: We decided to turn it up a notch during our last 3 nights stay in Oahu, so we checked in at The Modern Hotel in Honolulu. Upon arrival we were given the partial ocean view facing the west side of the island. We were also asked to see if we wanted an upgrade to the ocean view or the suite for a hefty amount. But we decided to stick to original room and thank goodness, we did. The room which was given to us was great, actually better than great. We had the view of the marina, a large partial view of the beach and excellent view of all the sunsets during our stay. Our room came with a balcony along with two chairs and a table. This allowed us to relax during the evening and enjoy the great view which was given to us. The room came with a large 50 inch HD television, nice comfortable couch, iPod player for your tunes, fridge and free water upon request. The best part was the nice large comfortable bed with soft pillows. During our stay here, I have to admit we got to a point where we were just to lazy to leave the room. They made it too comfortable for us that we stayed in doors majority of our time. We are very pleased that we stayed here and experienced a different side of the hotel chains here on Waikiki. If given the chance to return back to the Modern Hotel, I would say "YES" all the way true. The only thing that would hold me back from selecting this hotel would be the price and the large street noise from the cars. Besides that this is a very comfortable and relaxing hotel with all the bling.

Reviews.Title: “Its okay”
Reviews.Author: annie517
Reviews.Content: I was actually excited to be staying here given some of the positive reviews of late. First, I was actually treated a bit rudely by a snotty check in agent. Our room wasnt ready, and the room type we had been promised was not available. This was at 3pm. So when we came back, we settled for a lesser room type. The second person was much nicer. By that time the journey had been long and we wanted to rest. We actually were not disappointed in the room. It was clean, it was spacious. Beds could be more comfortable. In fact one day our room wasnt cleaned at all. Nightly we were asked if we wanted turn down service or water. Nice touch. No coffee makers, no signage or books in the room to tell you where things are located. Our city view room actually did slightly look over the ocean as well. The music from the pool could be heard on our 16th floor room. The Friday evening happy hour was loud. Our room did have great view of the Friday night fireworks. It seems to attract alot of partiers and a younger crowd. If you are looking for that, it is for you. If you desire something more family oriented, stay at one of the Hilton or Marriott resorts. The Ala Moana area is okay. Seems to have an awful lot of homeless population the hang in the park. Sad. The area down in the beach walk is much nicer. More restaurants, more shopping. Overall, I did like the Modern, but I actually considered it kind of "yuppy" ish. Some of the employees were kind, others were a bit snooty. The cars were always brought around very promptly. No complaints about the valets at all. Again if you like the modern, hip, W hotels kind of feel, this is for you. Its not one I would actually recommend for families though. A little too loud and I think they are trying a bit too hard to make it too "hip" instead of a more upscale, luxurious kind of feel like a four seasons or ritz carlton or something similar. Anyway... it was average... I wouldnt call it bad at all.. just average. Hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: “Honolulu Hot Spot”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: The Modern is cool, calculated and minimal with enough character to take it from blank palate to tropical urban oasis. The resort is a breath of fresh air in the Honolulu hotel landscape. Go to any other hotel on the strip and you'll see pool chairs playing footsie, crowded facilities and garden variety design. The Modern Honolulu is sleek, spacious and social, hanging between Waikiki and Ala Moana beaches. A massive surfboard installation hangs above reception and the rest follows this abstractly composed aesthetic: a secret swiveling bookcase leading to the lounge; neutral rooms decorated with tropical accoutrements; an outdoor bar with picnic tables and yellow bistro tables shaded by overhanging trees, lit at night by strings of twinkly wine-bottle luminaries—the list goes on. Every single one of the staff members I spoke to was lovely---helpful, kind and full of the Aloha spirit Hawaii has perfected. For this reason, coupled with the location and design, I’d come back in a heartbeat. The only oddities were the reservation process, I never received a confirmation email despite contacting them three times with two different email addresses {and I diligently checked my junk mail---in case it went there---every time}. Secondly, when I arrived I asked it they could look into a room change and nobody got back to me {even though I asked twice}. Finally, my room was cleaned twice despite the "privacy please" door hanger. All in all their service is good, but their follow-through lacks a lot. Rooms are decorated with a white and grey color scheme mixing dark wood plantation-style shutters, a plush chaise, big screen tv and tropical touches a la lime ukulele, sea shells and 3 colorful sarongs. The pool areas play into two different resort types, the ones who want a scene and the ones who want serene. The sandy-bottomed private beach pool area has a bar {only open sometimes}, loungers partially submerged in a blue-tiled wading pool, Adirondack chairs, beach beds, and plush loungers. The sunset pool--just below---is surrounded by wooden decking with beach beds for two, a bar shaded by a small forest of overhanging trees, plush white loungers and pool attendants. I wanted to give this hotel an "excellent" because it is so thoughtful and smart, however, there were a few service issues I escalated, which I never heard back on. What to know --- - The location is bang-on. Close enough to the action but far enough away from Waikiki's busy walkways. - There's am ABC store {big shocker:)} across the street, which is super convenient for picking up water, bananas, mags, etc.. - Make a reso in advance for Morimoto. It's a must-try, as is the tuna pizza appetizer. - Doors to rooms are really thin, bring earplugs. - Rooms are outfitted with a ton of little extras like mouthwash and slippers. My room was missing a robe. - There are tasteful grey and beige wool carpets throughout the hotel, unfortunately, these colors stain easily and there were noticeable marks in the hallways and in my room. - Depending on where your room is, ocean view could actually mean “10% hint of an ocean view with 90% street and other highrise view.” - The hotel’s food is decent---esp the poolside hummus & pita with balsamic-soaked tomatoes. - Happy hour at the pool is from 4 - 7. - Happy hour at the lobby bar is from 6 - 9. - Every Friday night at 7.45pm fireworks go off at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for 10 mins

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Modern Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: CTao
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this hotel. Ocean front suite is large and comfortable. Great design, colors and furniture. Large shower. Staff is super friendly, specially the front services staff, extremely helpful and always offer to assist. Morimoto Waikiki, lobby bar and the night club, all inside the hotel are MUST GOs. I will definitely go back and stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: canadianbeachlover
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. The decor is very nice, including the secret door that leads into the bar area in the lobby, very fun! Loved the service, everyone went above and beyond to help us, we were absolutely blown away by it! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Seniordad
Reviews.Content: Friend recommended this, used Priceline successfully. This is a modern, very pleasant place. I needed to drive several places. The staff were very helpful in printing out and explaining google maps. Rooms also have free wi-fi (not all area schools provide free wi-fi but this one does). The hotel is at the marina end of the beach that was ok with me. It's also located 1 block from 3 national car rental places, which allowed me to save money by picking up a rental car when I needed it, rather than the airport. Would rate this place very highly and via priceline, you can get an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: FunSunSmiles
Reviews.Content: This is a first class Hotel - the staff in particular are very professional helpful and the manager should be commended for the Hotel's staff and the way it is managed. We stayed 7 nights - some of the highlights: 1) They have two outdoor areas at the back of the Hotel - one has a swimming pool the other has a wading pool. The design is amazing as you can sit in a social area where there are lots of full length chairs to sun yourself. Or you can stay on the Upper level - they have full sun beds with big pillows and lots of towels. 2) The Hotel room was spotless and was cleaned everyday to perfection. There is a bar fridge I did not use as it is on the pricey side as are most Hotels - lots of selection if you desire. Very comfortable bed with big pillows - we had two queen size beds. The room was very large guessing it was 25 feet by 12 feet. Bathroom was clean - note there are no bathtubs but great shower. 3) The Spa - we checked it out did not use it but looked fantastic and the staff were very friendly. 4) Great location next to the Hilton the beach is about a 3 minute walk from the Hotel. 5) We took the bus from the Airport - it is only $ 2.50 and you can see the entire island. 6) Sorry cannot comment on the restaurants. 7) As mentioned in other reviews Waikiki beach is about a 15 minute walk along the beach but the Hotel beach is just at the back of the Hotel behind the Hilton not as busy. PS - Go to the Fat Greek just around the corner - great food and not expensive. Just a perfect place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “luxury and privacy”
Reviews.Author: poli1978
Reviews.Content: The modern is not actally on the best spot in waikiki beach but the courtesy of the staff and the level of the service and amenities will help you to forget the distance from the beach. The hotel has one of the best pool side I have ever seen! Pool bar is fantastic(drink a frozen margarita). Lounge and rooms are more than perfect. My compliments to the architects who designed the place! this is the place to stay in Honolulu! a little bit expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Tasteful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_YT9
Reviews.Content: I loved the design of this hotel. Rooms were very tastefully decorated and they have a beautiful pool area. Most people think of Waikiki beach as full of tacky tourists, and there are definitely a lot of hotels that fits this description. Fortunately, the modern was not in this category. It's a bit of a walk (15-20) to the heart of Waikiki beach which we enjoyed, but its not beach front if that is what you are looking for. I must also add that the Concierge at this hotel was incredible, she sent us detailed itinearys and suggestions to our room and gave us driving directions to the northshore along with tips on what to look at on the way. Highly recommended if you are looking for a hip hotel with a trendy flare.

Reviews.Title: “It was better as a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here previously when the hotel was known as Waikiki Edition and under management by Marriott. The hotel remodel was done by Ian Shrager and it's sleek and modern with many of the same lines one would see in a W Hotel. Beds are great, sheeting is great. Bathrooms are spacious and the towels are good. They are currently using Lather toiletries, which is different than the ones used when it was the Waikiki Edition. WiFI is slow as molasses. If you stream anything you'll be pulling your hair out. On our last stay I could swear we had twice daily housekeeping. Not now. We also had bathrobes. On this stay, I called the first night and the guy said they were short on bathrobes, but if they found any they would bring them up. This morning when I called reception, the gal was at least honest with me and said there are NO bathrobes anywhere in the hotel. The old ones had Waikiki Edition on them and they have not gotten any new bathrobes. I said I would be happy with one of the old Edition bathrobes, but she said they had gotten rid of all of them and there were literally none on property. As the Waikiki Edition, there was complimentary coffee/tea on the first floor in the mornings since the hotel did not have coffee makers in the rooms. There are still no coffee makers in the rooms and now they charge for coffee. One of the potential design flaws was the neutral cream colored carpets. We were in rooms on both the 12th and 15th floors. Room carpets are stained as are the hallway carpets. Since the hotel was just remodeled and opened in 2010, either the maintenance is way below par or the guests have unusually dirty feet. On this trip we noticed many of the pool employees taking a very casual approach to their jobs, joking around talking with one another and not being client focused. The servers were working hard but the chair attendants and one young chubby bartender were something else. One piece of advice for the bartender, don't make snide catty comments to the female server in front of guests sitting at the bar. You may think it's cute, but it's unprofessional. If she asks where her Pinot Grigio is, look at her and answer the question with respect rather than turning away and mumbling something only later to talk about getting "tipped out" to other bartenders. Not the interaction you need to be having in front of guests. And to the taller male pool attendant who looks Korean, don't ever refer to guests as those "gay guys" when joking with your colleague. It's offensive. Did you not notice there were no fewer than four same sex couples at the pool when you lost control of your mouth. Possibly you should read some marketing studies about which demographic groups have extra money to spend in establishments like this so that you can earn an hourly wage while you stand around joking all day when the manager isn't where he can watch you. Because whenever he was present, you were suddenly quite busy being busy. Another nuisance was having the adult pool closed all day long one day while the hotel staff got ready for a wedding in the evening. No one could use it so all guests were at the family pool where there were plenty of kids having a great time. If you stay here, request a room on the pool side. These are the odd number rooms. If you are on the street side, there is a tremendous amount of noise, even with the sliding glass door closed. Also note, this hotel is on the marina and there is NO beach. You can walk down the boardwalk and around a lagoon for beach access, but there is none at the hotel. Morimoto (televisions Iron Chef) is the only restaurant on property. There is bar food from a hotel kitchen, but Morimoto is the only restaurant. Breakfast for two will run at minimum $50. It's good, but not that good. Dinner with alcohol a starter and desert will easily exceed $200 and that's being conservative. A lot of celebs will stop buy if they are in Honolulu, including Reese Witherspoon, Elton John, the Obamas etc. We received a good rate for this stay, certainly cheaper than the prices when it was a Marriott, but it wasn't worth it. Between having the kid on the first night lie to me about bathrobes and then watching the pool employees in action during the day, we were left cold. Even with the hotel filing bankruptcy when they ousted Marriott, we had higher expectations for this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay at the Modern”
Reviews.Author: sydneybrowndog
Reviews.Content: If you are a family looking for somewhere nice and relaxing, forget the Modern. This place caters for the young and hip and the staff are "too cool" to open doors or be polite. They couldn't even get our bill right after 3 attempts. Also, they charge you $12 for any type of room service delivery (this is on top of the food bill). We stayed here for 4 nights and would never go back again! Maybe this place is ok for young couples - but it is terrible for families. If you know Sydney - this place is like a 'wannabe' Ivy. Check out the Aulani Disney Resort in Oahu - it's more expensive but absolutely fabulous if you have kids :)

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel - pleasant stay at a 4-star property”
Reviews.Author: airmike943
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, super clean rooms - well maintained. No nickel and dime excess charges. All in all a very enjoyable stay. Cool pool. Convenient location. I ordered through Hotwire and it turned out to be a super value, but you do not know what you are getting till you pay. I cannot speak for their direct booking rates.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: destes
Reviews.Content: Modern Hotel is in the best location in Waikiki within walking distance to every shop & restaurant imaginable and also very close to the Ala Moana mall (best mall I've ever been to!)  Staff, from Gabrielle at the front desk to the valet guys, are incredibly friendly and helpful with everything from copying documents to providing change and advising where to go to get your nails done!  The rooms are very hip, modern, clean and comfortable.  Love the linens even down to the bath mat!!  Having my own personal patio which overlooks the marina and ocean is such a treat; love sitting out there to watch the sunset each night!!! The furniture is not only stylish but extremely comfortable; love the chaise, patio chairs and bed!!   The pool area is large and comfortable and the bar behind the revolving book case is too cool for words!  Having the morimoto restaurant downstairs is an added bonus!  I can't recommend this hotel enough whether staying for business or pleasure; short or long term!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would revisit..”
Reviews.Author: Annette H
Reviews.Content: I had a very enjoyable stay, the service was wonderful, the rooms nice and roomy, good view of the ocean, the food was good, the pools were wonderful, could lounge and watch the sunset, very short walk to beautiful beach. Fun for all ages!

Reviews.Title: “Too Cool for School”
Reviews.Author: summcin
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel BUT you have to order ice from room service. What? A tip is not what I want to pay just to make a drink. I understand they want me to buy their expensive drinks but that is not always on my agenda. The pool service is great-no issues there. The crowds out in the driveway at night (the bar crowd) are a little overwhelming. I felt their focus was on the clubs they have in the building. I will go back to a simpler atmosphere on my next trip. You have to smoke outside on the driveway and I did, but was questioned about smoking in my room, which I didn't!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: SinceMay2009
