Reviews.Content: Perfect place for a peaceful vacation. We enjoyed every minute! Great pool area, very friendly staff, nice modern room. Morimoto's restaurant was also amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Cph4
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite appealing to the eye. The bed was very comfortable. I was on the fifth floor and could hear and feel the music from the nightclub below till 3 am each night. Had to have a maintenance technician come fix my aircoditioner due to a loud noise it was making. He arrived immediately after the call and was quick and professional. Nice pool and pool atmosphere. Checking in took forever. The gym was appropriately equipped. Overall not a bad place if you can get a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “URBAN RESORT IS CODE FOR LOCATED IN NOISEY AREA AND NOT ON A BEACH”
Reviews.Author: SURFER_DUDE44
Reviews.Content: I am updating a previous review I did in October. While the pictures you see on their website indicate a fantastic, serene location, I had the opportunity to take some photos from a condominium complex that towers over the MODERN. The hotel is the white building that in the center that is bordered by the the noisiest intersection in Waikiki (Ala Moana Blvd and Hobron Ave.) To the left is the Ilikai Hotel and behind is the muddy Ala Wai Harbor. The two pools in the center are indeed the property's pools. The round one is their "sunset private beach" because their is sand around the pool. Noise is the major issue. Because of the location you are subjected to endless traffic, sirens, construction and loud people from the property's nightclub.......at 2-3am. The roooms are okay and the service is too. But this is not a relaxing place to stay no matter how nice their website photos appear. Their advertising says "Urban Resort". That is code for "A hotel in the middle of a cluttered area that is not on a beach". They are charging 5 star resort prices for a 3 star "urban" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but wifi is super slow”
Reviews.Author: thorborg
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean and lovely hotel. It is very "hip". Everything is white and very stylish. Obama even came to eat at the restaurant Morimoto in the hotel. The one complain I have, is that the wifi is super slow and can only be used for light email and surf. Forget about streaming video or anything else that require just at bit of bandwidth.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: alohagirl760
Reviews.Content: Not sure what everyone is complaining about. I really liked it. I love the cool, understated decor and the uniforms. So modern and hip. Loved the pool. Really good looking people hanging by the pool, and both the pool and the wading pond were great! The location was good. Our of that Waikiki craziness, but you can get there if you needed too. Short walk to the beach. There is definitely some uneveness. Mini bar was empty when we arrived (which was good because we filled it with our own milk for coffee), but not guest-ready. Turndown service - some nights we arrived back to a full ice bucket and waters and sometimes not. Sometimes glasses were not replaced or cleared. And who designed that bathroom? Louvers? Really? Only share a room with people you know intimately. But everyone was really nice and the concierge recommended some great restaurants. Valets fetched the car quickly every time and when we called for ice, it was there in a minute. I'll definitely stay again if on Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Poor Service, WannaBe Upscale Experience”
Reviews.Author: des104joy
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks pretty cool inside, everyone is sort of like a stepford service staff, wearing white and always smiling... but it is only skin deep. The resort's location is the noisy hotel I have ever experienced. They were doing maintenance at 4 AM. I was awakened twice in the middle of the night by garbage trucks and spraying of sidewalks with pressure sprayers. The carpet had stains that had not been adequately cleaned. Vallet drivers were more than happy to take your car and peel out in front of other guest, smiling and laughing the entire time. Don't be fooled by the photos. This is not an upscale resort. It is an old resort that has been renovated and is trying to be upscale and hip. It doesn't measure up. This was my worst travel experience of the year. I have stayed is better Marriott Courtyards. The staff did finally move me to a higher floor where I could not hear the street noise. I recommend if you stay here that you request a very high floor and that you don't expect to have an upscale experience. They are still working to get things right.

Reviews.Title: “call it 4.5*”
Reviews.Author: taipeipeter
Reviews.Content: Relaxing, pleasant, stylish but not over-the-top. They seem to be trying to push to the 5* level, but there is just a bit of hardware missing: rooms lack bathtubs, though the walk-in showers are good (water pressure on my upper floor was a little low). No locker rooms, but a decent fitness center and an acceptable pool (they might renovate it for lap-swimmers to share with the lounge-swimmers, though). Nice (and good looking) staff. Very clean; good-sized rooms. The platform beds would make me think twice about bringing the kids, is all. Yes, lack of coffee in the rooms is an annoyance, though if you're not fussy you can bring in an emergency can from the ABC across the street. I found the "iron chef" restaurant noisy and crowded at night (and didn't go), but the Japanese breakfast was quite fine.

Reviews.Title: “understated relaxation in waikiki!”
Reviews.Author: rhlc
Reviews.Content: Overall, I really like this hotel. Location: This hotel is not in the heart of Waikiki--about a 10 minute walk to the heart of the action. I appreciated that because it made getting in and out with a car much simpler. It also contributed to the more laid back atmophere. Rooms: We had a standard room on a higher floor. We didn't have any problem with noise, but we specifically asked for a higher floor. Also, the hotel was far from full. I really liked the decor--it was kind of California beach, with a touch of Hawaii. Very relaxing colors. The bed was quite comfortable, but it was a platform bed so might be difficult to get in and out of for someone older. Also I banged my ankle on the platform a few times. The bathroom was fine. The shower was huge, but not a lot of water pressure, which was a little disappointing. Note about the bathroom--if you like privacy while in the bathroom, this room is not for you. The room and bathroom are divided by louvers which can be closed, but not like a door. Room service was great but pricey. Grounds: To me, this was really the best part of the hotel. The pool areas were really nice. I felt like I was just relaxing at a really awesome beach house backyard. It is pretty intimate (ie, small). There was a beautiful tree covered area near the bar, with teak picnic tables and lounge chairs. The ipe deck was gorgeous. I could see the tops of the boats in the harbor over the hedges. Heaven. BUT, not stereotypical Hawaii. Service: I think they might still be working out some kinks. Everyone was friendly, but just seemed a little confused. It is very informal, so that might bother some expecting the full "luxury, suck up attitude." Pet peeve: As has become the standard in expensive hotels, no coffee maker. You may purchase for $3/cup in the lobby. Why only 4 stars? I don't think this place is 5 stars. It doesn't have the over the top amenities to push it into that category for me. It's very nice if you can get a reasonable rate, though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway from the Waikiki madness”
Reviews.Author: sugartmp
Reviews.Content: The Modern was recently renovated and they did a great job. The hotel feels very chic and beachy, but not cheesy - think crisp white and medium dark wood accents. The service was excellent; very friendly and accommodating staff. The location in near the West end of Waikiki in front of the marina. You're not "on" the beach, you're in front of the marina, but you still have spectacular ocean views. The pool area is fantastic and you are next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which has it's own lagoon and beach access. The bar is a bit pricey, but nice for a cocktail or two - has a different vibe than most of the other hotel bars in Waikiki. It's a really nice walk or a $5 cab ride to the main drag of Waikiki. Really nicely done renovation, top quality service, and perfect location away from the chaos.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Yellowman15
Reviews.Content: The modern is no 4 star hotel in my opinion, but there are some good things that go along with the bad. The good: -Location is a good starting point to lots of things including Waikiki Beach, shopping, restaurants, parks, attractions, etc. -The service is great from check in to valet parking (these guys are in constant motion) -Everything is, well, modern - updated rooms, looks chic -Pools are nice - bar is close by - shade - full "beds" to lay on - nice breeze -Nice view of marina and some beach -Has trendy bar next to lobby check in HOWEVER - the bad: -It's NOISY - the walls are thin (for example we could hear someone in the room above us yawn one morning, no lie); there is music playing at all hours which is sometimes coming from the Hilton next door; even away far the traffic side you'll still hear traffic -$28+ for valet parking is only hotel option (again the guys are great though) -You have a fridge if you unload all of their stuff out but it's small -As others have stated, no privacy in bathroom Overall, for a discounted price this place will work but I'd probably pick another place to stay next time we're in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and chic but has its flaws”
Reviews.Author: travelfun_111
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in November and can say the stay was nice. I used Priceline and got this hotel for $99/night which is much less than the advertised price on the hotel site. I placed a bid on a 4 star hotel and got this resort class through Priceline which was a pleasant surprise. However, I don't think this hotel deserves a resort classification. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: - friendly, pleasant staff - clean and stylish rooms - fantastic housekeeping services which came to your room twice a day - complimentary bottles of water - satisfactory fitness center - has a safe - fantastic pool with great poolside service - location was accessible and close to McDonald's, ABC store, Ala Moana shopping Center, Starbucks at the Hilton, about 15 mins to Waikiki Beach - extended our check out time Cons: - shutters separating the washroom and bedroom is NOT a good idea - no privacy when in the washroom - with windows open, it was quite noisy outside - mediocre view - no coffee maker - mini fridge was too small - private beach was insignificant - lobby was nice but small - dark lighting - fee for using business center - not very kid friendly - be very cautious about the fees they charge you - they charged me 3 days of valet when I only used valet once and they charged me 2 bottles of kirins from the minibar when we did NOT have any - valet parking is a bit steep ($28/night) Overall, I was pleased with the hotel. The hotel is definitely catered towards the younger mid 30s generation I think... For the price that we paid, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorenrein
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was great. Rooms are very modern and private. Being off the main strip of Waikiki kept things quiet enough while being a short walk from the action. The pool is awesome with a south beach feel. Bryan, a bartender from the pool bar was great. He is def worth chatting with as he was a nice enough to point out a local perspective regarding things to do. Good man. Definitely recommend the hotel for its value and service. An added bonus is the Hilton fireworks are set off yards away. Great view from the ocean view rooms which we were complimentary upgraded to.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 4-5 Star, But a great 3.5 Star”
Reviews.Author: MOS1983
Reviews.Content: My review is based on a 6 night stay on the 5th floor in early December 2011. I booked through http://bookit.com and got an absolutely great deal. Nice Hotel, a great 3-4 star hotel but certainly NOT EVEN CLOSE TO A 4-5 STAR. Because so many people find each post so subjective I decided to start with some facts about the hotel that many people may not know and then go into my opinions. ***will explain more FACTS: -There is NO private beach *** -Valet Parking is $28 plus $1.32 every time they get your car -Rooms do not contain refrigerators for personal use*** -No coffee makers in Rooms -The Upper Pool area is often closed for "private parties" or require hotel guests to pay to enter -NO Jacuzzi on the premise -Free Wifi PROS (in my opinion) -Great location. A little separated from the main hustle of down town Waikiki but only a 15 minute walk to everything. Close to the beach area near the Hilton. -The pool area is great. Gorgeous views, great lounge chairs and beds, stylish bar. The so called "private beach" is just another lounge area but is gorgeous and a great place to hang out -The whole place is extremely clean and well taken care of -The service is good. The valet's deserve a lot of credit because they work extremely hard and are always moving fast for you. If you call guest services for ice you will have it within a few minutes at your door. -Free WIFI -The decor is pretty nice, great ideas, hidden lounges/bars, great property. Not very "Hawaii" more Miami feel. -Towel service at the pool is great and they have high quality towels. CONS and some major set backs during my trip -First off they should be required to remove the posting "Private Beach". All this area is is another pool area with sand. I heard a sales pitch for a wedding say they actually brought the sand from Waikiki beach. WHO CARES it does not make it a beach. While nice it is not a beach so please don't think you are getting a private area with the ocean or bay...you are getting a 15 foot by 15 foot sand box. Nice but not a beach. -No refrigerators in rooms. Upon arriving we got to our room and found a small fridge that was a stocked mini bar. Nice but knowing we would not use it we asked to have it emptied so we could use it and the hotel said they do not do that. I think a place trying to claim 4-5 star status would take care of the guest. -Concierge Servie is HORRIBLE. My biggest complaint came on Tuesday night. We stopped by the desk and asked for dinner reservations. We were dressed in shorts and sandals with collared shirts and stated "we are going to dinner dressed like this". We were recommended and given reservations at a local hotel eatery. Upon arriving there was a sign that said "NO SANDALS AND NO SHORTS". We turned away and found our own dinner. Once again a place trying to be an upscale hotel can not have a service like this. We were very disappointed in the concierge for our entire stay. -$28 a day for parking is one thing. But the 1.32 for each time you get your car is ridiculous. Not because I do not want to pay the fee but because at no point and no where is this price advertised; a complete unfair practice. -Once Monday came and the hotel was fairly empty asked for an upgrade to a higher floor due to noise. They could not accommodate, or they did not want to because I booked through http://Bookit.com (they mentioned the fact that i booked through an external site). Not really a big deal nor did I deserve an upgrade but I do believe you can tell a great hotel when they are trying to make you a customer for life not just one trip (i.e. Ritz Carlton, Kimpton Hotels) SUGGESTIONS FOR CUSTOMERS: DO NOT BOOK THROUGH THE HOTEL. You can get great deals on other sites that make the hotel worth it but don't pay their prices, they are not worth it yet. ASK for a high room. We stayed on the fifth floor and it was very noisy. I am not sure I would recommend this to other people. With that said I would stay here again for the right price. If anyone has more specific questions please message me. Like i said I stayed for 6 nights and got a good feel for this place. I am a very frequent traveler and have stayed in every type of hotel and many five stars and like to see places that truly offer great service to have great recommendations; I am just not sure that this is one of them. Once again I feel that this place is a nice 3-4 star with tons of potential but they have a long way to go and need some improvement to really compete with true 4-5 star hotels! If you are in the area and can find competitive prices I would check out the Halekalani-Royal Hawaiian, Westin, the Trump Hotel, and some of the Outrigger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Strange Hotel...beware of "Resort" status on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Discovision
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed here. It had a very strange, uncomfortable feeling....Contemporary or perhaps "Metrosexual" best describes this hotel. As other reviewers have noted, there is a ridiculous charge for Valet parking here and the minibar charges are ridiculous as well ($7 for a can of soda?). The bathroom is uncomfortable to say the least. Open-air shutters? I hope that you have no desire for privacy while you are in there. I just finished a two night stay there (at $100 per night). I attempted to book a two night stay again through Priceline and got this same hotel again! (now for $122 per night). Priceline will not allow me to cancel this reservation, even though I could have "extended" my stay here for two more nights at $100 per night (and they wouldn't adjust the price either).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nursewebb
Reviews.Content: Great service, food and atmosphere. Got an upgraded room on arrival with an envelope containing 2 pool side drink s voucher and a Mai Tai voucher for liking this hotel on facebook. Great start! Short walk to Hiltons beach front area where you can rent stand up boards and peddle boats (bit more expensive than along the beach but wanted to use the beach/rock pool with no waves). Short walk to Ala Moana shopping and to Central Waikiki. Only downside to this hotel is the night time noise, harley davidson bikes and drunkards in the middle of the night. Maybe if you got a room overlooking the pool the drunks wouldnt be a prob but there is roadway on 3 sides of this hotel. The windows need to be replaced?! The 'turn down service' needs to be consistent too (no show for two nights) Other than that the place is Modern, comfortable, affordable and luxurious. We would def. come back here and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I hoped it would be!”
Reviews.Author: BJMUTA
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this property on Trip Advisor and was a little worried about some of the comments. My main concern was the noise levels that everyone complained about from the nightclub on the first floor. I decided to stay at the hotel anyways because I was really excited about the possibility of a truly modern hotel that caters more to adults than kids. We were there for our 27 year anniversary and I really wanted a low key place... I emailed the hotel several times asking to please make sure we were on a high floor away from the nightclub.... When we arrived we were greeted with cold face towels and lemonade which was very nice. I was pleased to learn that the hotel manager had upgraded us for free from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view on a high floor. The room was great and I loved the modern decor. The hotel overall was very quiet and I never even noticed the nightclub (even when we sat in the poolside bar area at night just off from the nightclub). We used the fitness club everyday and it was well kept and very nice. The pool attendants were very nice and set your towels up at the location you desired. We did not eat at the hotel except for snacking at the pool bar in the evening when we were playing cards with friends. We found a new drink that we LOVE... A blended Coconut Mojito!! Yum!!!! Internet is free and bottled water is provided daily in your room for free! Downsides to hotel: 1. We knew it was a walk to the beach and shopping and it personally didn't bother us however it is a trek to get anywhere. 2. I would highly recommend doing the package that includes parking (if you have a rental car) as it is very pricey. We rented mopeds one day (24 hour rental) and when we inquired about the cost to park them overnight at the hotel, the valet staff was rather rude and said we would have to pay between $15-$18 PER moped even though all 4 would fit in one spot!! TIP: If you do rent mopeds, the parking garage across the street lets you park in a designated area for $2.00 per moped. 3. Food and Drink is very expensive!!! Fair warning but typical for a nice hotel Overall I would definitely recommend The Modern Honolulu for couples who want a more quiet getaway with not a lot of kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sojorner
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay at this hotel. We booked a city view room after having a disappointed stay at another hotel on the first week of our vacation. Upon arrival we were given a free upgrade to a partial ocean view room with a balcony. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating. This hotel has a very unique atmosphere ( very zen like) and you should visit its website to see what they offer. We travel 4 or 5 times a year and this is by far the best we have stayed at recently.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Outrageous Minibar Charges”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Modern, formerly the Waikiki Edition. It is a reasonably cool, contemporary boutique hotel, which is quite refreshing for Honolulu, which tends to have fairly dated properties. Rooms are comfortable enough (although have shown some wear and tear since my last visit) restaurants/bars are vibrant, staff is friendly and I’ve enjoyed my stays there. Needless to say, I was a bit shocked at check out on this stay to discover that the one soft drink consumed from the minibar had a $7 price tag associated with it. I travel extensively, understand that minibar items have high markups, and I’ve generally accepted that you can expect to pay a reasonable premium to retail for the convenience. Seven times retail however is quite excessive and distasteful. It makes you feel taken advantage of. Much like over the top landline phone charges, it simply cannot be cost-justified – it is just a money - spinner for hotels when guests choose to use these services. Because I didn’t remember seeing the minibar price list at the time of consumption, after checkout I returned to my room to confirm the price and lo and behold discovered that there wasn’t a price list or menu in the room. So not only was the hotel charging $7 for a can of soda, they also failed to provide guests with a menu to make us aware of these prices before consuming. This is not only outrageous - it is also unethical. Tempers my enthusiasm for this hotel and I will almost certainly not return as a result, which is sad because I do like the hotel. Just can’t justify it with business practices of this nature. This is clearly more a matter of principle than the $7 itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: HurdinT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. Don't listen to the bad reviews. They don't know what they talking about. I had a bless !! No need to go into details...all was great ! Very helpful staff and very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Louise S
Reviews.Content: We just got back this evening from a four night stay at the Modern Honolulu. Since we had not looked at the Tripadvisor reviews prior to going (because of a blind reservation through Hotwire), we checked to see what people had to say. I must admit, this is the first time we are writting a review. We felt this was required, as we could not believe we had stayed at the same hotel described by other guests. We were stunned at the negative reviews. This certainly is not what we experienced. My husband and I, as well as his daughter and son-in-law were all quite pleased with the excellent service we received. We travel a lot --- all over the world! We are of the opinion that those who have complained about this hotel, are probably people who are very difficult to satisfy! Here is what we experienced. We reserved two rooms through Hotwire. When I called to confirm this with the hotel, I was told we only had one room reserved. (I truly believe this was a Hotwaire error.) I spoke with Masa who assured me that everything would be looked after. He later e-mailed me the confirmation, and called to let me know everything was OK. He also told me that because of this confusion, he would do something special for us during our stay. This was about one month before our trip. Surprinsingly, Masa followed up with me during our stay to make sure everything was to our expectation! The Check-in: we were greeted with several men to help with our luggage. We were offered tasty lemonade, and hot towels. These services were much appreciated after a very long flight. The checking-in staff (two ladies) were great. We asked for a complimentary upgrade, and received it. (We had paid for standard rooms through Hotwire.) We were upgrated to two side-by-side rooms with a great marina and ocean view. The sunsets were gorgeous. The Room: We were on the 9th floor close to the elevator. Noise was definately not a problem. The room was quite clean, inviting, and comfortable. The bed, duvet and pillows were excellent. It had a well stocked bar fridge, no drawers but plenty of closet shelving. The room was cleaned daily at a reasonable time, and cleaned again with turn-down service after we left for dinner. We were surprised to be provided with two bottles of water every night with ice in a bucket in each of our rooms. One night, we arrived back to a beautiul plate with a coconut, candies, three truffles and three maccaroons. The washroom was very modern, and a terrific shower. I must admit, the shutters opening into the room, did make for a conversation piece. We enjoyed watching the sunset from the balcony. On the last day we had lunch on the balcony and made the comment that we should have used the balcony more often. The pool area was very nice, very relaxing and the daybeds were excellent. The towel service staff were attentive to our needs. Carly, one of the concierge, was very helpful in providing guidance for activites, and driving directions. A taxi was reserved for our departure back to the airport, and we received a typed confirmation of this a little later that day. Let's not forget, we are in Honolulu -- it's a great place to walk. The location of this hotel is fantastic! We walked to the Waikiki beach (15 minutes away); we walked to Diamond Head (30 minute walk); walked along the ocean in front of all the hotels; walked all the way to downtown Honolulu to the Aloha Tower (40 minute walk), then back through Chinatown, saw the state and municipal government buildings, the palace, the king's statue, the ethernal flame, and even a bronze statue of Elvis; walked to the high end Alo Mona shopping mall (5 minute walk). Lots of choices of restaurants in the area (from inexpensive to expensive) --- from McDonalds and Subway just a block away, or a $4 breakfast (eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast) a half a block further or delicious and high end restaurants --- we enjoyed an Italinan dinner at Sergio's one evening and had dinner at The Fat Greek another evening. Three car rental companies are a block away. Parking at $28 in the hotel is expensive, so we chose to park in the street about 2 blocks away for free. The outside doors were always being opened for us at this hotel! And to top off how well treated guests are --- on our last day, we asked for a late checkout. Our flight was not until 9:30pm. We were able to use our room until 2:00pm, and if we wished to, later in the day we were told we could shower and change in the spa area. Yes, there are always little things we can find to complain about, but my goodness, let's not be petty! We honestly felt when reading previous reviews, we and the other guests that had posted negative reivews, have we had not stayed at the same hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of upselling!”
Reviews.Author: CS27
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fabulous pool area and world class restaurant. Distance from busy part of Waikiki an advantage. Arrived just prior to check in time to find our 'city view room' wasn't ready, but for an extra $120 a night we could have an 'Ocean View suite'. I agreed, only to find a gorgeous suite with one kingsize bed (we are 3 adults). After ringing reception they said at night staff would come and blow up an air mattress??? We declined room, and were offered an 'ocean view' room at only $40 extra a night. i agreed, only to find a tiny sliver of ocean and the rest the building next door. By now I was feeling stressed but went to dinner. After our return to the hotel i spoke to reception to let them know how disappointed I was and that I would prefer the room I originally booked, a 'city view'. When we finally moved to this room it was to find a far better view of the ocean than the 'ocean view' room.. just ridiculous.Felt that staff were probably instructed to try to upgrade, but their inexperience resulted in an awkward encounter, leaving me, the customer, feeling a bit confused and embarrassed. Quickly decided to put this experience behind us so we could fully enjoy our holiday, which we did. In spite of the mix-up I would encourage others to give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL M
Reviews.Content: Beware!!!!! I booked my hotel stay for this Hotel through Hotwire. A few days prior to arrival Hotwire sent email stating my Hotel stay at The Modern was cancelled and they(the hotel) didn't have any accommodations for me elsewhere.. To make a long story short, the hotel said it was because of overbooking. After pressuring for the real reason(which probably was to get a better rate out of someone else) The Hotel said it was because management wanted all reservations cancelled due to the fact that the Secret service was going to shut down hotel to guests during to APEC. Bogus answer #2. After pushing for why they could kick me to the curb since I had a Guaranteed Reservation, they basically said too bad, you can rebook for another time or have a refund.After more pressure they offered to move me to another one of their hotels, but at this point I had already been fighting to get other accommodations. Who would want to stay with a Hotel after they just kick you to the curb without any consideration to your plans. I did stop by hotel on my visit. The only issue was that there was screening into the hotel by Police. Big deal!! Most of the hotels had screening. They thought they were special since someone from a delegation was staying in their hotel. So pupu to normal folk. Well let me say ...it was the best thing they ever could have done!!!' I booked my stay at Trump International Waikiki Beach Resort. This Hotel is a True 5 Star. The best location, staff, quality and overall experience. This hotel far outperforms the Modern. The Modern doesn't deserve a 5star or even 4 star rating.Their locaion is very inconveniencing. The Trump also had A Prime Minister staying at the same time, and there was only a few minor delays during his motorcade arriving or departing. It was actually an honor to have been there at the same time. There is a lot of talk around town about the modern as well. So "Modern" Thanks !!! Keep up the your practices, because it alows travelers to probably get the real experience they deserve by staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very promising property”
Reviews.Author: BBoopL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Modern for 3 nights after spending a week at the sprawling Hilton Hawaiin Village so it was a welcomed change of pace. Very modern decor and furniture - great rooms. Staff very young and eager to please, but still require more training in certain aspects of service - a work in progress but very promising. I'm sure there are rooms with great views, but our "partial ocean view" had barely a sliver of a view. Would have given 5 stars if the view was better or if the staff would have at least offered to upgrade us since the hotel only had a handful of guests while we were there. Ambience very calm and relaxing. Pool was unique and tranquil and the day beds some of the best we've ever tried. Morimoto Restaurant right downstairs and serves delicious and interesting meals. Unless you are looking to be in the heart of the touristy area, this location on the very far end of the Waikiki beach is actually one of it's strong points - far away from the generic madness and much more peaceful. Waikiki beach is easily accessible, but that is by far the worst beach on Oahu. Rent a car and go to the many other more true Hawaiin beaches (car rental one block away)!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Modern Experience”
Reviews.Author: danasbox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just picked up a junket and spent three nights at the modern in Waikiki. Wow we usually stay at the other end of the beach closer to the park. But this end of the beach opened our eyes to a whole new Waikiki and we loved it. The hotel is fantastic! Excellent service from the minute we checked in. Everyone was very professional and happy to help make us reservations. We had a fantastic meal on the outdoor patio at Morimto's. We spent a day at the pool and had terrific tacos and lounged around on the beds, wonderful! Our room was large and had two patios. We had breakfast in the room every morning and it was very reasonable. I did something to the remote to one of the TV's and someone was there to fix it so fast I couldn't believe it. The whole hotel is brand new and done with thought and attention to style. There are surf breaks just a short walk out past the marina. I went surfing and caught a couple GREAT waves that made me say I'm coming back and I'll stay at the Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out Your Invoice (credit card)”
Reviews.Author: AkiOY
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night though, we were very dissapointed by the man with attitude who was working at the reception. We paid the room through the travel agent in advance. At the time of check-in, the lady at the reception noticed the room was already paid. But at the time of checking-out, the man tried to double charge my room. I showed the proof (my pre-paid voucher), he also checked in their system, finally they only charged the room service (food was good) and extra upgraded fee ($70) to my credit card. But now we came back home, checked my credit card status....he did charge the room! Now my travel agent is trying to investigate the situation. Other than that, we were dissapointed that the Morimoto restaurant was closed when we were there. Morimoto was the only reason why we chose this hotel. The hotel should mention on their website that the restaurant would be closed when. Yeah, the hotel is new, or it was APEC busy period....can NOT be an excuse. I should have followed this TripAdvisors' comment.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise....”
Reviews.Author: Trish S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned my bday getaway and we we were originally booked to stay at the Moana Surfrider - but due to a mixup we ended up at the Modern Honolulu. Stephen at the front desk was great. He was very helpfull and made sure we had a room we were comfortable in. The hotel service is definately 5 star....towels service, coffee service, house keeping...ect. The towels are new and fluffy and the beds are so comfy. If you are looking for a quiet romantic getaway off the beating path, I would highly recommend the Modern. It is a bit pricey, but worth it as the service is truely the best in Waikiki. The only downside,.... is... it is far away from the main Waikiki beach and drag... but great exercise to walk - 15-20mins. The hotel food prices are on the higher side. Morimotos is great - but not for everyday. In addition, the non-smoking policy should be enforced better. 2 guests - two room away were chain smoking on the lanais and I called 3 times to complain. The smell was so bad we kept our patio door closed the whole day and we had an ocean view. I would suggest perhaps, offering a a package special - in suite dining credit to attract more business. Like I said, 5 Star service to the front desk... You guys are great! Please keep up the good job!

Reviews.Title: “Started out okay, but quickly went down the toilet. BELIEVE THE LOW REVIEWS!”
Reviews.Author: prof-quantum
Reviews.Content: Things seemed to start out okay. The room was decently clean, except for a few curious stains on a day bed type lounger in the corner. The bed is pretty comfortable if you remember that the bed frame is wooden and half a foot wider than the mattress...and manage not to whack yourself walking around the bed. Internet is free and decently fast. I stay at tons of 4*+ hotels and this really did start out ok, then things started going downhill. 1) Parking is stupidly expensive. Park along the Ala Wai canal and walk for 5 minutes. It's FREE. 2) The "ocean view" rooms face another hotel and give you almost the same view as a non ocean view room. This is a complete scam that I didn't fall for and you shouldn't either. 3) There is no "private beach". It's an ankle deep wading pool a level above the regular pool with some sand thrown around it. To get to the beach is a bit of a hike. 4) The patio door is the least soundproof thing going. You hear endless traffic noise all night during the week...and then on the weekend you're treated to something really special. 5) This hotel runs a NIGHTCLUB...yes a full on NIGHTCLUB within the hotel Thursday/Friday/Saturday. If you're staying here on those days (against your better judgement given my and other very poor reviews), make sure you are in an upper level room. I was on the 5th floor and was KEPT UP ALL NIGHT BY THE NIGHTCLUB. Yes, on the 5th floor. All I could hear were beats resonating up through the floor which continued non stop well past 2am. At that point, you got to listen to all the drunk idiots on the street below yelling for the next hour plus. So umm...maybe a few floors above where I was would be better...maybe paying for an "ocean view" would be quieter...but that's all just conjecture. To put things in perspective, I've stayed at a few hotels where I read reviews that they were noisy. Those weren't anywhere as bad as this hotel. I found myself opening the patio door more than once wondering if it stopped ANY of the noise (barely). This property often comes up on Hotwire (5* - ha!) and Priceline (Resort - really?) for $100 a night or maybe a little more. At that price, it's STILL too much to pay given that there seem to be many many more options in the area. You certainly shouldn't be naiive enough to pay full price. Like I said...this started out OK, but like others have posted here, I just couldn't wait to check out.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star: Trick or Treat? Definitely a Trick!”
Reviews.Author: nikorami
Reviews.Content: 5 star...NO! Unless it is on a 10 star scale!!!! This hotel is definitely not 5 Star. I will start with something funny, but gives you a quick indication: The place has 1/2 ply toilet paper! LOL....funny I know, but 5 star locations do not have 1/2 ply TP! Ok, moving on: The floors in the rooms were disgusting! I wore my shoes/flip flops most of the time because it was gross. Who knows what all the stains were?! No coffee in the rooms, you had to go down to the second floor to get coffee. No drawers for your clothes...you have to stuff them into a single closet. The chairs on the balcony were really uncomfortable...why would a place put this type of chair out, I have no idea!. Ok...on to more bad things about this place: The place is down right noisy as it is right next to multiple streets. The hotel seemed to have ZERO concern with the level of noise late at night outside their hotel. People screaming, yelling for hours late at night. The hotel cost is also one big scam...they first try to get more money out of you for a Ocean view...$65 more. BTW, the Ocean View from this hotel sucks!! A boat area, and the local park full of homeless people. Ok...on to more costs...they charge you $28/per day for valet parking...a surprise for sure...but oh well. Now guess what...even though you paid $28 per day for the valet service...at checkout we were hit wit a $1.32 charge every time the valets brought our car up? WTF??? What was the $28/day for? Oh...and as I said, they did not tell us this at check-in...only at check-out. The staff at the front desk is average. The bar staff at their local bar are not very nice/freindly. We tried each bar once and no more. Another funny one: They advertise a 'private beach'....LOL...this is yet another joke....it is a shallow pool of water with sand around it and lounge chairs. The pool facility is below average too. No jacuzzi. Oh, also they kick you out at 10pm...you can't even be in the area...and they are rude about it too! On to the location: As noted before, this is a short distance away from a park with a lot of homeless people and is in a not so safe feeling area. It is a 15-20 minute walk from the main Waikiki Beach areas and shops, etc. The walk is not bad....just a pain. But you just don't feel safe walking at night in the area. The only positive were the valets...they were quite good...they surely know about the extra $1.32!!! All in all this place ruined..let me say again..RUINED!!!! our holiday! I would not recommend this to anyone in general...but when you call it a 5 star facility, it borders on a crime of false advertising!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - best pool area anywhere”
Reviews.Author: kelly b
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Some of the older reviews here do not do it justice - all renovations are completed and the management are fantastic. Great clean, new rooms, fantastic pool area. The hotels restaurant is home to USA Iron Chef Harimoto!! I thoroughly enjoyed staying here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BigCityBeachLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon before heading to Maui. The hotel was clean, the rooms were beautiful and the bed was so comfortable! There was a nice balcony and views, and the service was excellent. The concierge was very helpful and they let us shower in another room after checkout since we had a late flight which was really really nice! We loved the pool area and had a fabulous meal at Morimoto. Definitely recommend this hotel for couples!! We were overwhelmed at great service and amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Bad location. Don't let the touched up photos fool you.”
Reviews.Author: R0wN
Reviews.Content: Be very careful. This is not a luxury hotel and definitely not a resort. It is located next to the Ilikai hotel and does not have a good location. Rooms are noisy, so much so we had to flee to Halekulani. We were there on business and the hotel had just been taken over by Aqua. I've always felt that the reviews of their hotels were suspect. Believe me, if you stay here you will feel taken. The only good thing about this place is Morimotos restaurant. The hotel has a scary parking lot and when we walked around the front of it, it smelled really bad. We paid over $400 for a small room. The furniture was modern but not expensive and is already starting to look old. It's just not worth the money and even if I had to pay $200 a night, I wouldn't do it. Very small pool and service is not top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek & chic – loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Eurofriends
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Moana Surfrider may be in the best location in Waikiki, there is no challenge as to which hotel is the coolest – with the best rooms. The Modern wins hands down. This is one of my favourite hotels…anywhere…and I travel quite a bit both for business & on holidays. We stayed for 5 glorious nights. I found The Modern perfect – with its white with splashes of colour scheme, chilled out music, trendy crowd and helpful staff. - They let us leave our luggage in storage when we moved from the Westin and were going to Big Island for a few nights - Loved the cold towel and freshly squeezed lemonade at check-in - Staff is young and professional - Rooms are serviced not once but twice daily - Whenever we arrived back to the apartment to change and go out again we’d find chilled water and ice waiting for us - You can see the Hilton fireworks on Friday night from the hotel, although we walked to the Hilton lagoon (which is only a 2 minute walk from The Modern) and had the best view of the fireworks from their launch site - When we wanted to book some tours, the Concierge (Stephanie) took her time and showed us all of our options. Once we’d selected our tours we went to the beach and when we returned confirmation of our tours, times, pick-up locations etc.. was waiting for us in our room - The design of the outdoor areas is superb - Pool areas were awesome. Lots of luxurious, comfortable lounges with great thick towels placed on your chosen lounge by the pool staff upon arrival. There’s even music under the water - really - You can order food from the pool staff or at the bar until quite late and it’s very, very good –a s are the cocktails - We had a marina-facing room and it was immaculately clean with a big walk-in shower, large vanity, huge king size bed, with lots of storage room =, a flat screen tv, comfortable chairs on the balcony and a lounge chair. The room was quite large - Wifi is included in the room price - Even the hallways are wide and spaciousso you don’t feel like you’re at just another hotel chain -Our room was on the 10th floor and we had no trouble sleeping, with no noise whatsoever from outside or neighbouring rooms - There’s a bar and a nightclub on the premises as well as Morimotos. All are excellent, as is room service - We found the location quite convenient. We’d already spent 5 days in the centre of Waikiki. The Modern is a 10 minute walk from Ala Moana, and 15 to 20 minutes along the beach to the Moana Surfrider in the centre of Waikiki. We walked there every evening, and caught the bus from the stop 2 minutes away from the hotel in to town every morning We literally cannot say enough about our experience at The Modern. It will be our first choice next time we go to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great guest rooms, very nice pools, not ideally located for tourists”
Reviews.Author: jsl_00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my boyfriend at the end of September. We booked this hotel when it was still being managed by Marriott and we chose it because of the modern décor of the rooms and the beautiful pool areas. After the change in management, we reconfirmed our rate with the hotel and got the room for 199 + taxes and fees. We loved the guestrooms at this hotel. Everything is all white and dark wood and the décor is exactly the modern style that we love. We felt right at home here. I have absolutely nothing but good things to say about the room. Turndown service was nice and two complimentary bottles of water were provided. The towels were replaced each evening. Housekeeping did a really good job of cleaning the room. Our room was a city view room and overlooked the parking garage and from the lanai we had a good view of the marina and ocean which was nice. The service at the hotel was okay. Nothing out of the ordinary. Two things that did bother me was that we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a better room for $79 a night…many good hotels with available rooms on weeknights would just provide a complimentary upgrade so I was a bit annoyed by this since the hotel seemed pretty empty – why not make a customer happy by comp’ing the upgrade when the room would be empty anyway and it was a Weds/Thurs night? Another thing that bothered me was that we had to call the bell desk to ask that our luggage be brought up after we got to into the room and it took them quite a while to get up there – my boyfriend had to go down and try to find out what the hold up was…this was particularly annoying bc after over 10 hours of travelling we just wanted to shower and change and go to the pool. The location of this hotel is not ideal for tourists. The beach is within walking distance but it is at the far end of Waikiki beach. We walked into the Waikiki beachwalk area where all the shops and restaurants are and it took 20-25 minutes. I think you could take the trolley there though. The hotel is within walking distance of Ala Moana Shopping Centre – which has great stores but after walking to the shops along Waikiki Beach we realized how much better the Waikiki Beach area is. After two days at this hotel, we transferred to the Trump, and I would highly recommend staying in that area as it is much more in the middle of the action and so so much more convenient! Also, some previous reviews included complaints about the street level noise – we faced the side of Ala Moana Blvd and could definitely hear the traffic but with the lanai doors closed it really wasn’t horrible. It did not bother us at all, however we are accustomed to hearing downtown traffic in Toronto so maybe that’s why we were not fussed. You could definitely hear noise in the hallways in the early mornings but the hotel wasn’t that busy so it didn’t bother us much. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for couples but not families. If the price was much cheaper than other hotels closer to the Waikiki beach strip, then it would be worth it, otherwise I would rather stay in the more central area. The two pools are relaxing and quiet (there were no children running around during our stay which I liked). The rooms are beautiful and modern.

Reviews.Title: “You're in paradise without every really knowing it!”
Reviews.Author: dtravelgirl007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights (when it was still the EDITION) to celebrate my husband's birthday. It was such a delight to be here...this place is truly amazing. Although we didn't partake in the club or pool activities, we walked around the property several times a day to just see how plush it was! The lobby doesn't scream HAWAII! as others do. But it did have a cool display of 'broken' surfboards behind the counter. Our room was incredible. We didn't have a balcony; but we had a view of the Ilikai & the pool. Also we had a view of Waikiki Beach. The only hint that we were in Hawaii were the 2 sarongs on the pegs on the wall, a toy uke, and a comp book with a vintage Hawaiian cover. The toiletries - which I LOVED - had sleek black packaging. The bathroom was pretty open if you forget to close the wooden blinds. Definitely, had to have Morimoto's for dinner. That is a treat in of itself...made me go to the one if Napa when I got home. The decor and staff were so knowledgable and just friendly. So, if you want to be in paradise; but not necessarily know it, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn t
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Modern Honolulu for business but felt so relaxed surrounded by the amazing ambience I am coming back to stay on my vacation. The two pools have their own uniqueness and feel. The bar behind the book shelves is a must to see. The rooms are comfortable and sleek. And best of all, is the phenomenal food! Room service is by far one of the best I have tasted. Amongst all the big named hotels and budget hotels in Honolulu - this hotel is refreshing, hip and cool!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Globalbanker
Reviews.Content: As a W Hotel fan I was disappointed that the W Waikiki had closed but was so happy to discover The Modern Honolulu recommended by a local. Wow! Amazing spaces both inside and out - - the upper pool gave me the option to float about when I needed a break from reading in a hammock (I think they call it the sunset pool) the more active pool scene in the lower pool was great too with a very attentive bar staff and a nice crowd. Our room was as cool as the lobby, hidden bar and outside areas. Very clever use of space and a nice update on the Hawaii kitsch - - it was a difficult decision not to buy the Ukulele in the room! While the space was tops, the staff was very helpful and made me feel like Hawaiian royalty. My quest for the perfect MaiTai was guided by everyone from the bartender to the front desk staff. Catherine and Brie at the front desk remembered my name and made me feel homesick as I left to return back to the my other island home Manhattan. I can't wait to return and HIGHLY recommend The Modern and of course Morimotos restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great staff, loved the place!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna V
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Modern Honolulu in September and loved it! From the moment we were dropped off and stepped in we knew we made the right choice. The reception, lobby area is sleek and modern and the staff were really polite and accomodating - the takeover had no effect on our stay here and we had a seamless, enjoyable stay. Our room was absolutely stunning! Our room was automatically upgraded and we had a room on the 16th floor. The room was clean and spacious and the views were amazing. Our room was cleaned at least once a day, most days twice! We found the concierge service first class - in particular Stephanie who helped to plan activities and trips to help us get the most out of our trip. Her customer service skills and honest opinion was much appreciated. The hotel pool area was a beautiful place to retreat once you've had a day out or just for chlling out. The hotel itself was in immaculate condition and we loved our stay here. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value, but trendy”
Reviews.Author: SeattliteTravels
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I've stayed in a number of Waikiki hotels over the past six years. I must unfortunately report that the Waikiki Edition by Marriott (one if only two Edition properties worldwide) operates in a sad state of service. Someone who visits strictly as on vacation for a limited number of days may not notice all the service foibles, however, they're glaring and should be unheard of in a property such as the upscale Edition. I finally report all this after 80+ nights at the property. If looks were everything, this hotel might be one of the best, but there's more to the story. If not for the spacious bathrooms, I would not keep booking at the Edition (not, by the way, called the "MODERN Waikiki"...an illegal takeover attempt by the property owners).

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: BobSulz
Reviews.Content: we arrived during the transition from the Edition name to the new name, Modern. It made little difference to us as the level of service and accomodations were first class. The new management and staff went out of their way to be helpful. We had a great time and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for couples”
Reviews.Author: Northwestern1
Reviews.Content: We arrived two days before the transition from The Edition managed by Marriott to The Modern managed by Aqua. The management team put in the extra effort to make the transition work well for us. Each day the staffing and organization improved. The setting is very comfortable and relaxing and the best reastaurant in Honolulu is right there. We enjoyed Morimoto's every day for breakfast and then for lunch or dinner. The hotel is a very short walk over a nice arch way to the beach, which has the effect of keeping the number of children staying there down. The staff is helpful and the music at the pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Mistake”
Reviews.Author: tchan52
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the EDITION the eve of the takeover, we were staying for 7 days and excited to be in Hawaii! The Hotel was hopping and the positive reviews we had read all seemed to indicate it would be a lovely stay. My husband and I were celebrating our 10 year anniversary without the kids, so we had really looked into which hotel would meet our needs and expectations. The EDITION reviews sounded great...but don't go to the MODERN Honolulu expecting the old reviews to be true. During our stay we had 2 days without wifi, closed bars and/or a bar that served virgin drinks (that you STILL had to pay for) while they waited on their liquor license, no spa services available our entire stay, there was initially no concierge then a rotation of various people some of whom were helpful and others not so much. As others mentioned, there were people in suits milling about, a general air of tension and security hovering all over the hotel our entire stay...not a very romantic or 'modern' trip. Instead of offering us some kind of compensation or an upgrade we received nothing for our inconvenience...we had a letter at the initial take over and then no follow-up informing us what was going on or effort made to make our stay more enjoyable. Sometimes there were a lot of staff, other times the hotel seemed a ghost town...the only constant was the inconsistency during our stay. We paid a lot of money for an experience that was lacking on pretty much every level. The staff did what they could and the room was nice, but for the amount of money we paid (heck for any amount of money!) I wouldn't repeat the experience. I am writing a letter to the hotel and will keep you posted on the outcome. I believe this could be a great hotel, but it is far from that right now. The only bright spot in that hotel is Morimoto's...excellent food and ambiance!

Reviews.Title: “Honolulu EDITION Hotel Changes Ownership Overnight---NO Longer a Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: Greg_Loves_Travel
Reviews.Content: **WARNING** to Marriott Rewards Travelers: This is NO LONGER A MARRIOTT PROPERTY ! The tip off to me should have been that another platinum level Marriott guest and I were given a not so nice check-in on 27 August. Despite a medium level occupancy, we were given basic rooms, near the noise of Ala Moana Blvd. NO customary "nice to have you here" nor upgrades nor typical amentities were provided. Overnight on Saturday, this EDITION Hotel changed management. This change was NOT even hinted at during check-in. But, the deception came clear: a letter introducing the change was LOUDLY slide under my door around 4am, awaking me with "new management" people talking in the CAVERNOUS-sounding hallway. This compounded the existing street NOISE outside in the 1775 Ala Moana Blvd area, LOUDLY heard inside two different rooms on 2 different floors. The room color scheme is very monochromatic to the point of being stark. When speaking w/ the front desk staff on Sunday morning, "oh yes, we are no longer a Marriott property" as if that was something to be proud of. With the crazy level of Room noises, we decided to change hotels. Trying to check out, the Lobby was a MADHOUSE of people at 11am Sunday morning. SECURITY guards (we counted about 25) were all over, like some third world country coup, surrounding the perimeter of the building and inside the PACKED LOUD lobby. It was evident the "new" management had POORLY planned their transition and probably concerned about recently sacked Marriott employees. No apology was offered by a new front desk manager and "our system is down" so a copy of the folio was not available. One week later, I am still waiting for "we'll Email you the bill". Want to have a TERRIBLE experience at a "luxury" hotel that has a new and VERY DISHONEST management ? Then you'll stay at whatever the new name is at 1775 Ala Moana Blvd in Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern ,,,,, (now called that!) A beautiful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: littlemizfab
Reviews.Content: We were there a few days before and after the takeover - which did not really affect us at all. The spaces, lower pool area, restaurant, bar area and rooms are gorgeous! Its very new and very stylish - lots of comfy spaces to curl up with a book or a drink. The lobby libary area is very cool!.... at night the massive book shelf opens and behind is a very cool bar with a lovely atmosphere. The service we received there was fabulous - very prompt and nothing was too much trouble for the staff ROOMS - Yes.... there is ALOT noise from the street below but I found the air conditioning noise cancelled most of that out and I generally slept ok. If you got a room nearer the marina it would be better - we were fairly close to the main street. . Probably the only hotel room I have stayed in that is NO tea and coffee making facilities in your room - and one night craving a good old cup of tea - eventully paid US$10.00 for a room service one! The rooms overall are very very comfortable - the beds, pillow and linin are devine. There are tonns of amenities and towels provided and a nightly turndown service - loved that. It is one of the best stocked mini bars I have ever seen. I heard NO noise from rooms either side or above - as you can do in some hotels. Apparently it is quieter to stay on the pool side of the hotel - where we were - not the side street side - as during the weekend you get a lot of noise from the nightclub below - people coming and going till it shuts in the early morning. It a 10 min walk to Ala Moana shopping centre - which is fantastic! Across the road is a really good conveinence store selling everything from pharmacy supplies to liquor. Its a 10 min walk to Waikiki beach front - where you are spoilt for choice for activities, other restaurants and shops closeby on the Boulevard. Great location overall - do stay here if you like new modern hotels - but not if you like beachfront.

Reviews.Title: “Transition of branding Beware of new ownership”
Reviews.Author: ziilander
Reviews.Content: I would rate this 5 stars before when it was owned by Marriott, but a 3 is generous for location. Before the transition, the staff was the best I ever stayed. Fitness center and it had a towel and ear buds ready for you. After workout, there were cold refreshing towels in the fridge to wipe your face. Right outside the door was coffee. Morimoto for lunch was awesome and valued less compared to dinner. The concierge was looking hot and new everything about eating and what to do. Chisel chin dudes open the door as you left and valet also offered bottle water for your adventure. The staff was looking very hot and sexy that made it like "Vegas/Miami style" hotel. Crazy Box is a guest list only club and it took us 3 ID checks to get in. WTF! We checked out of the day of transition and went over to Hilton Waikiki and that was the best decision on our part. We saw rent a cops, no white uniforms but name tags, system was done and everything was done manually. I felt stressed out for them, that is why we left and I new I couldn't get the same type of service as we did before. Chaos broke out when there was no more coffee and the staff did not know what to do. It was a big cluster @#$%! No concierge was available. I wish them luck to get back in order and it just going to be another boutique hotel with out the class of service. .

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel, NOT a resort.”
Reviews.Author: SURFER_DUDE44
Reviews.Content: This building, which used to be part of the Ilikai Hotel, is located on the noisiest intersection, Ala Moana Blvd and Hobron, in Waikiki. Some rooms are literally right on the road and the noise is worse than a Motel 6 located on a freeway. This a not a beachfront property. It backs up to a boat harbor, but the nearest sandy beach is blocks away. The sand box by the pool is just that....a sandbox with a pool in the middle. Try laying on your lounge chair listening to the noisy traffic which is literally right below you. Also the bus fumes are a plus too. That being said, the rooms are nice except for the slotted bathroom doors (have you noticed EDITION management, everybody comments about this). Some rooms do not have a lanai so be sure yours has one before you make your booking. Although because of the noise the lack of a lanai can be a blessing. For the kind of money they charge for a room, you could do a lot better at the Hilton Hawaiian Village around the corner.......a true beachfront resort. And very QUIET. Will never stay at Edition again for that reason alone. Your whole Hawaiian experience should be a relaxing one. One without listening to police and fire sirens at all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “ALERT! Name & Affiliation Change”
Reviews.Author: JLaw725
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Sun 8/28/11 on a one night points stay (Marriott). They told me that at 7am that morning the hotel dropped out of Marriott's branding and changed names to "The Modern Hotel". They were in complete disarray, however were very nice and while they did not honor my Marriott point stay they did offer me a complementary night. (I was only staying one night there). Also they did not have a lot of staff or services and many employees did not report to work. Beware if you have a Marriott reward reservation coming up as they will not honor it. I did hear other guests saying that it was a last minute forced change of name etc.
